original: 'og gi mnar med pa nas brtsams te ji srid tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gang la mes zad par byed pa de ni mes 'jig pa'o //üîΩ'dor bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: 'og gi mnar med pa nas brtsams te ji srid tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gang la mes zad par byed pa de ni mes 'jig pa'o // 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i lus kyis so //
translated: From the Avici hell up to the Brahma world, the destruction by fire is that which burns up the world.üîΩThe destruction by water is that which is destroyed by water.

original: lhung bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba srid pa'i lus kyis so //
analyzed: lhung bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba srid pa'i lus kyis so //
translated: The destruction by wind is that which is destroyed by wind.üîΩThe destruction by fire is that which burns up the world from the Avici hell up to the Brahma world.üîΩThe destruction by water is that which is destroyed by water.üîΩThe destruction by wind is that which is destroyed by wind.

original: de ltar de dag sdug bsngal mang po myong ba ni de mang po yin la sdug bsngal yang yin bas des myong bar bya ba gang gi phyir de skad du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag sdug bsngal mang po myong ba ni de mang po yin la sdug bsngal yang yin bas des myong bar bya ba gang gi phyir de skad du brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, they experience many sufferings.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni ma bsad pa dan pha bsad pa dang dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems dang gsod sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni ma bsad pa dan pha bsad pa dang dgra bcom pa bsad pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems dang gsod sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o //
translated: The five heinous actions are: killing one‚Äôs mother, killing one‚Äôs father, killing an arhat, causing a schism in the sa·πÖgha, and with evil intent, malicious intent, drawing blood from a tathƒÅgata.

original: gsod sems zhes bya ba ni gzhus pa brjod par 'dod pa la mtshams med ma yin zhes bya ba lung gis so //
analyzed: gsod sems zhes bya ba ni gzhus pa brjod par 'dod pa la mtshams med ma yin zhes bya ba lung gis so //
translated: Malicious intent is not a heinous action if it is expressed by words.

original: mnar med pa'i dmyal bar ltung ba'i slad du gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir mnar med pa ste rang gi don la aa na'o //
analyzed: mnar med pa'i dmyal bar ltung ba'i slad du gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir mnar med pa ste rang gi don la aa na'o //
translated: because they cannot be grasped in order to fall into the Avici hell, it is called Avici, ‚Äúuninterrupted.‚Äù

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa tshig gsum po ni don mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa tshig gsum po ni don mnyam pa'o //
translated: The three phrases beginning with ‚Äúreflection‚Äù have the same meaning.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni de rnams nyid las gang gi don du de rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni de rnams nyid las gang gi don du de rnams mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Gain and honor are those very things for the sake of which they are seen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis de mi mthong ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis de mi mthong ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is that? means why is it that they do not see those things, etc.?

original: lo 'dab rul pa ni rlon pa rul @146a * //
analyzed: lo 'dab rul pa ni rlon pa rul @146a * //
translated: Rotten leaves are wet and rotten.

original: pa'o // de ma dor na rlon pa gzhan yang chud zos par byed do //
analyzed: pa'o // de ma dor na rlon pa gzhan yang chud zos par byed do //
translated: If they are not removed, they will cause other things to rot.

original: lta bu ni rigs te rlon pa rul ba bzhin du skye ba gang rnams la yod pa de rnams ni rlon pa rul ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: lta bu ni rigs te rlon pa rul ba bzhin du skye ba gang rnams la yod pa de rnams ni rlon pa rul ba lta bu'o //
translated: The example is appropriate. Those who have birth, as if they were rotten leaves, are like rotten leaves.

original: nag po ni rtsva'i bye brag go //
analyzed: nag po ni rtsva'i bye brag go //
translated: Black is a type of grass.

original: de yang zhing las ma bton na zhing chud za bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang zhing las ma bton na zhing chud za bar byed do //
translated: If it is not removed from the field, it will ruin the field.

original: nye bar skyed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar skyed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The production is the accomplishment.

original: nag po bzhin du nye bar skyed pa 'di rnams la yod pas na nag po nye bar skyed pa'o //
analyzed: nag po bzhin du nye bar skyed pa 'di rnams la yod pas na nag po nye bar skyed pa'o //
translated: Since these have the production of the dark, they are producers of the dark.

original: yang na sprul nag po'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni sprul nag po'o //
analyzed: yang na sprul nag po'i rigs can zhes bya ba ni sprul nag po'o //
translated: Or, the dark ones are a type of snake called the dark ones.

original: de rang nyid dug dang bcas pa 'dres pa rnams dug langs shing dug dang bcas par byed do //
analyzed: de rang nyid dug dang bcas pa 'dres pa rnams dug langs shing dug dang bcas par byed do //
translated: They themselves are poisonous, and they make others poisonous, and they make others rise up and become poisonous.

original: tshul ma yin bas zhes bya ba ni de rnams las thos pa dang dad pa la sogs pa'i lam ma yin bas so //
analyzed: tshul ma yin bas zhes bya ba ni de rnams las thos pa dang dad pa la sogs pa'i lam ma yin bas so //
translated: By improper means means by a path that is not the path of learning, faith, etc.

original: brlag ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: brlag ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The destruction is the suffering of the hells, etc.

original: mi bzad ba dang nad kyis reg pa ni gnod pa chen por nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi bzad ba dang nad kyis reg pa ni gnod pa chen por nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The contact with terrible diseases is the certainty of great harm.

original: reg pa ni thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg pa ni thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The contact means the attainment.

original: snang ba ni sngar byas pa'i las la rnam par smin pa shes pa'o //üîΩdkar po'i skal ba ni dge ba'i cha'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni sngar byas pa'i las la rnam par smin pa shes pa'o // dkar po'i skal ba ni dge ba'i cha'o //
translated: The light is the knowledge of the ripening of previously done actions.üîΩThe white portion is the virtuous portion.

original: de dang ldan ba na dkar po'i skal ba can no //
analyzed: de dang ldan ba na dkar po'i skal ba can no //
translated: One who possesses that is endowed with the white portion.

original: phrad par ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phrad par ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The meeting is the application.

original: sdig pa byed pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sdig pa byed pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who commit evil are of two kinds:

original: gcig tu nag po la spyod pa dang dkar po'i cha dang 'dres pa'i nag po la spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gcig tu nag po la spyod pa dang dkar po'i cha dang 'dres pa'i nag po la spyod pa rnams so //
translated: those who practice exclusively black and those who practice black mixed with white.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i sdig pa 'bad pas yongs su spang bar bya zhes bya ba 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis gzhan la brtse bas gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i sdig pa 'bad pas yongs su spang bar bya zhes bya ba 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis gzhan la brtse bas gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The noble Subh≈´ti, out of compassion for others, says, One should strive to completely abandon such kinds of evil, beginning with Then the Blessed One said to the noble Subh≈´ti.

original: ngag gis zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba ste las gzhan la ltos pas ci gzhan yang las mngon par 'du bya ba yod dam /
analyzed: ngag gis zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba ste las gzhan la ltos pas ci gzhan yang las mngon par 'du bya ba yod dam /
translated: By speech is meant the question: Is there any other deed to be done, in dependence on which one would know this much about the perfection of wisdom?

original: gang gis 'di tsam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skur pa 'debs pa las skyes pa'i bsod nams ma yin pa'i tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gang gis 'di tsam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skur pa 'debs pa las skyes pa'i bsod nams ma yin pa'i tshad bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One declared the extent of the demerit produced by the slander of this much of the perfection of wisdom:

original: rab 'byor ngag gis nyes par smras pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor ngag gis nyes par smras pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the evil spoken by speech...

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i ngag gis nyes par smras pa 'di nyid kyis te gzhan gyis ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i ngag gis nyes par smras pa 'di nyid kyis te gzhan gyis ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By this very speech that deprecates the perfection of wisdom, not by any other, is meant.

original: legs par gsungs pa ni phyin ci ma log par yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa ni phyin ci ma log par yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well-expounded means that it is well-spoken without error.

original: chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyi chos so //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyi chos so //
translated: The Dharma-Vinaya is the Dharma of non-erroneous meaning, because it is reasonable.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dul bas na 'dul ba'o //üîΩde skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'on te don 'di sngar yang dris pa ste lan yang @146b der gsungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dul bas na 'dul ba'o // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'on te don 'di sngar yang dris pa ste lan yang @146b der gsungs so //
translated: It is the Vinaya because it disciplines the afflictions.üîΩWhen this was said, etc. means that But this meaning was asked about before, and the answer was given there.

original: sngar yang de dag de rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid dang po skur pa 'debs pa ci zhig rgyu mtshan du gyur ces bya ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs kyi tha ma la gnas pa yongs su dri ba'o //
analyzed: sngar yang de dag de rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid dang po skur pa 'debs pa ci zhig rgyu mtshan du gyur ces bya ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs kyi tha ma la gnas pa yongs su dri ba'o //
translated: The former, etc. means that The former, etc. is a question about the present and past states, asking What was the original cause of the deprecation?

original: de bas na dang por skur pa 'debs pa nyid bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na dang por skur pa 'debs pa nyid bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, first of all, the very one who denigrates is empowered by MƒÅra.

original: dad pa dang rab tu dang ba med pa'i rgyu dag gsungs so //
analyzed: dad pa dang rab tu dang ba med pa'i rgyu dag gsungs so //
translated: The causes of lack of faith and lack of clarity are stated.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu gzhan rnams kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu gzhan rnams kyang gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, etc. states other causes.

original: sdig pa'i grogs pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa ni mngon par mi brtson par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa ni mngon par mi brtson par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa la ltos pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: The result of being empowered by an evil companion is stated: He becomes one who does not strive, because he is not intent on listening, etc.

original: / phung po la mngon bar zhen par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / phung po la mngon bar zhen par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: He becomes one who is attached to the aggregates.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni 'dod pa brtan pa la sogs pa las ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni 'dod pa brtan pa la sogs pa las ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is not turning away from firm desire, etc.

original: phung po la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni 'don pa la don gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: phung po la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni 'don pa la don gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúattached to the aggregates‚Äù is clear in the sense of the verbal root ‚àögrhƒ´.

original: rnam pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'dir yang rigs dang bral bas bab pa'i chos la lhag par mos pa ma yin pa nyid rgyu gtso bor blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'dir yang rigs dang bral bas bab pa'i chos la lhag par mos pa ma yin pa nyid rgyu gtso bor blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the aspects should be seen as the principal cause of the lack of superior intention toward the Dharma that is to be attained by one who is devoid of lineage.

original: gzhan rnams de'i nye bar mkho ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams de'i nye bar mkho ba'o //
translated: The others are its requisites.

original: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la bdag la bstod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum gyis phung po gcig go //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la bdag la bstod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum gyis phung po gcig go //
translated: In the reading four aspects, the three beginning with praise of self constitute one aggregate.

original: dmyal ba'i gzhung mang ba nyid kyi phyir dmyal ba'i le'u ste le'u bdun pa'o /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i gzhung mang ba nyid kyi phyir dmyal ba'i le'u ste le'u bdun pa'o /
translated: Since the text on the hells is extensive, this is the seventh chapter, The Chapter on the Hells.

original: // / sngar bcom ldan 'das ma la che ba'i bdag nyid thos pa dang mngon par 'phel ba'i gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus de la lhag par mos pa'i slad du gang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa zhes dris pa la /
analyzed: // / sngar bcom ldan 'das ma la che ba'i bdag nyid thos pa dang mngon par 'phel ba'i gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus de la lhag par mos pa'i slad du gang nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes pa zhes dris pa la /
translated: Previously, the elder Shariputra, who had heard about the greatness of the Blessed Lady and had increased his superior intention toward her, asked, From where did you die and be reborn here?

original: gnas skabs de nyid kyis dam pa'i chos la skur pa 'debs pa'i gtam gnas skabs su byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de nyid kyis dam pa'i chos la skur pa 'debs pa'i gtam gnas skabs su byas pa'o //
translated: By that very occasion, he made an occasion for a discourse disparaging the true Dharma.

original: da ni yang gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas brtan rab 'byor mos par dka' ba nyid dag gnas skabs su 'byed pa ni mngon par mi brtson pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: da ni yang gnas skabs de nyid kyis gnas brtan rab 'byor mos par dka' ba nyid dag gnas skabs su 'byed pa ni mngon par mi brtson pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Now, in that very situation, the difficulty of faith is divided into situations with the words ‚Äúlack of effort‚Äù and so on.

original: mos par dka' ba ni rigs dman pa rnams kyis de la lhag par mos pa la de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pas yang rnyed par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mos par dka' ba ni rigs dman pa rnams kyis de la lhag par mos pa la de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs pas yang rnyed par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The difficulty of faith is due to the fact that those of inferior lineage have difficulty in having faith in it, and due to the fact that it is difficult to attain by serving the Tathagatas and so on.

original: rgyu gsungs pa ni mngon par ni mngon par mi brtson pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsungs pa ni mngon par ni mngon par mi brtson pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause is stated: ‚Äúlack of effort‚Äù and so on.

original: mngon par mi brtson pa ni lhag par mos pa'i rgyu la dus ring por ji lta ba bzhin du ma goms pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi brtson pa ni lhag par mos pa'i rgyu la dus ring por ji lta ba bzhin du ma goms pa'o //
translated: Lack of effort is not being accustomed to the cause of faith for a long time, just as it is.

original: don du mi gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa zhan pas so //üîΩnye @147a * //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa zhan pas so // nye @147a * //
translated: Lack of interest is due to weak aspiration.

original: bar bstan pa ni bgegs su byas pa'o //
analyzed: bar bstan pa ni bgegs su byas pa'o //
translated: The hindrance is taught:

original: legs par mi nyan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la'o //
analyzed: legs par mi nyan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la'o //
translated: Not listening well is to spiritual friends.

original: yang mos par dka' ba nyid de bstan pa'i don du ci tsam du zab pa lags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang mos par dka' ba nyid de bstan pa'i don du ci tsam du zab pa lags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Also, in order to teach the difficulty of having conviction, he says, How profound is it?

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ci tsam gyis zab pa ni gang zhig 'di ltar mos par dka' ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ci tsam gyis zab pa ni gang zhig 'di ltar mos par dka' ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One says, It is profound to the extent that it is difficult to have conviction in it.

original: zab pa'i dri ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bcings ma grol ba bstan pa dang mu med pa bstan pa dang chags pa dang ma chags pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bstan pa bzhi ci'i phyir bar skabs su mdzad /
analyzed: zab pa'i dri ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bcings ma grol ba bstan pa dang mu med pa bstan pa dang chags pa dang ma chags pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bstan pa bzhi ci'i phyir bar skabs su mdzad /
translated: Why did the Blessed One, in the middle of the question about profundity, give four teachings: the teaching of unbound and unfreed, the teaching of boundless, the teaching of attached and unattached, and the teaching of not two and not separate?

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas skabs la /
translated: Subh≈´ti, form is unbound and unfreed is the stage of non-conceptual perfection of wisdom.

original: gang zhig yongs su grub pa chos kyi ngo bo snang ba de 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la dus 'di tsam du las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i 'ching ba thams cad kyis ma bcings zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su grub pa chos kyi ngo bo snang ba de 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la dus 'di tsam du las dang nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i 'ching ba thams cad kyis ma bcings zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which is the reality of the perfected, the appearance of the nature of things, is said to be not bound by all the bonds of karma, afflictions, and karmic maturation in the state of samsara for this length of time.

original: phyis yang yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs la ma grol ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phyis yang yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs la ma grol ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Later, it is also said to be not liberated in the state of the perfected.

original: gang gi phyir kun brtags nyid ni 'ching ba zhes bya ba dang grol ba zhes bya bar brjod kyi nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med pa dang 'gyur ba med pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun brtags nyid ni 'ching ba zhes bya ba dang grol ba zhes bya bar brjod kyi nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med pa dang 'gyur ba med pa'i chos nyid kyi gzugs ni ma yin no ;
translated: Because only the imagined is said to be bound and liberated, not the reality of form that is uncontaminated and unchanging like space.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gis gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni rab 'byor gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gis gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, because form is without an inherent nature,‚Äù meaning that the absence of the inherent nature of form due to the imagined and the dependent is the meaning of the reality of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la gzung bar bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be understood with regard to feelings, etc.

original: yang ma bcings ma grol ba nyid la gsal bar byed pa'i don du dus gsum dang sbyar bar byed de //
analyzed: yang ma bcings ma grol ba nyid la gsal bar byed pa'i don du dus gsum dang sbyar bar byed de //
translated: Again, in order to clarify the very lack of bondage and lack of liberation, it is applied to the three times.üîΩSubhuti, the prior limit of form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' ma bcings ma grol zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la 'khor bar dri ma dang bcas pa ma dag pa'i gnas skabs sngon gyi mtha' zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi sngon gyi mtha' ma bcings ma grol zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la 'khor bar dri ma dang bcas pa ma dag pa'i gnas skabs sngon gyi mtha' zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having shown that, it is said that the prior limit is the impure stage with defilement in samsara, the reality of form.

original: de ltar na nye bar bstan nas slar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyi ma'i mtha' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na nye bar bstan nas slar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyi ma'i mtha' zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, having shown that, it is said that the later limit is the impure stage with defilement, the lack of both affliction and purification.

original: dus gsum yang 'gyur ba med pa mi gnas mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid ces bstan par byed pa ni rab 'byor gzugs la sngon gyi mtha'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i @147b phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum yang 'gyur ba med pa mi gnas mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid ces bstan par byed pa ni rab 'byor gzugs la sngon gyi mtha'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i @147b phyir ro //
translated: The three times are also shown to be unchanging, nonabiding, and realitylessness: Subhuti, it is because the essence of form is nonexistent in the past.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la dus las nges par grol ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la dus las nges par grol ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The word back is used because of the characteristic of being definitely liberated from time in reality.

original: mchog tu mos par dka' ba zhes bya ba ste mchog tu zab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu mos par dka' ba zhes bya ba ste mchog tu zab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be supremely difficult to believe because of its supreme profundity.

original: de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba bstan pa la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs da ltar byung ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba bstan pa la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs da ltar byung ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, in the teaching of non-bondage and non-liberation, the essence of samsara and nirvana is called the present state of purity and impurity for bodhisattvas.

original: gang zhig bstan pa'i don du rnam par dag pa'i bstan pa rtsom par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig bstan pa'i don du rnam par dag pa'i bstan pa rtsom par byed de /
translated: For the sake of teaching that, the teaching of purity is composed.

original: rab 'byor gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad la bcings pa med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad la bcings pa med pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, whatever purity of form, that very purity is the purity of fruit - because all phenomena such as form are unfettered, there is no affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas rang bzhin can gyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas rang bzhin can gyi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Because there is no affliction, there is natural purity.

original: rnam par dag pa la rang bzhin can nyid kyi phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa la rang bzhin can nyid kyi phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams med pa'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of purity, the phenomena of purification do not exist.

original: rang bzhin can gyi rnams par dag pa la rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams don dam par cung zad byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin can gyi rnams par dag pa la rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams don dam par cung zad byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Since purity is the nature of phenomena, the phenomena of purification do not perform any function ultimately.

original: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang byis pa rnams la kun tu brtags pa nyid de yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang byis pa rnams la kun tu brtags pa nyid de yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of affliction and purification is only imagined for the childish, not for the accomplished.

original: de la gang zhig gzugs rnam par dag pa ni de 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang zhig gzugs rnam par dag pa ni de 'bras bu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the purity of form is called the purity of effect.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba su zhig so sor gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba su zhig so sor gyur pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the phenomena of form and so on, there is no one who becomes the purity that is the effect.

original: gang zhig 'di chos nyid kyi gzugs grub pa la rang bzhin can rtag tu rnam par dag pa nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di chos nyid kyi gzugs grub pa la rang bzhin can rtag tu rnam par dag pa nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: For one who has accomplished the reality of form, the nature of purity is always present.

original: de nyid ni 'bras bur gyur ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming can rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'bras bur gyur ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming can rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That itself is the result, which is the meaning of the term ‚Äúpurification,‚Äù which is called nirvana.

original: de ltar gzugs dang 'bras bu dag la rnam par dag pa gcig nyid yin zhes mjug sdud par byed pa ni gzugs rnam par dag pa dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de tha mi dad ces bya ba
analyzed: de ltar gzugs dang 'bras bu dag la rnam par dag pa gcig nyid yin zhes mjug sdud par byed pa ni gzugs rnam par dag pa dang 'bras bu rnam par dag pa 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med de tha mi dad ces bya ba
translated: Thus, form and the result are the same in terms of purification. The summary is: The purification of form and the purification of the result are not two, nor are they divided.

original: la / gnyis su med pa na gcig nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: la / gnyis su med pa na gcig nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are not two because they are the same.

original: gnyis su byar med pa ni so sor bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pa ni so sor bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not divided because they cannot be divided.

original: tha mi dad pa ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not different because they are not different.

original: ma chad pa ni bar ma chad pa'am rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chad pa ni bar ma chad pa'am rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are not interrupted because they are uninterrupted or permanent.

original: da ni chos thams cad rnam par dag pas gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ba la @148a * //
analyzed: da ni chos thams cad rnam par dag pas gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ba la @148a * //
translated: Now, since all phenomena are pure, the purification of form and so on should be explained.

original: gtso bo nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The purity of omniscience is stated because of being the principal thing.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //üîΩda ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par dag pa'i bstan pa thob pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dang ba mngon par 'phel ba spobs pa yang dag par skyes pa rim gyis rnam par dag pa'i tshig bcu gcig la yang 'khor yang dag
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do // da ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rnam par dag pa'i bstan pa thob pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dang ba mngon par 'phel ba spobs pa yang dag par skyes pa rim gyis rnam par dag pa'i tshig bcu gcig la yang 'khor yang dag
translated: Omniscience is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: par bsdu ba'i phyir bstan pa rtsom par byed pa ni zab bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: par bsdu ba'i phyir bstan pa rtsom par byed pa ni zab bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the Elder Shariputra, having attained the teaching of purity, with the increase of faith in the perfection of wisdom, with eloquence properly arisen, in order to properly gather the retinue in the eleven stages of purity, he begins the teaching with ‚Äúprofound‚Äù and so on, up to ‚Äúbecause of purity.‚Äù

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas nye bar bsags pa'i 'khor ba pa'i chos rnams las de rnams so sor ma yin par gyur ba'i chos nyid dri ma da rnams kyis dri ma can du 'gyur ba ma yin te
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas nye bar bsags pa'i 'khor ba pa'i chos rnams las de rnams so sor ma yin par gyur ba'i chos nyid dri ma da rnams kyis dri ma can du 'gyur ba ma yin te
translated: This is the reality of those which is not individual, because of the accumulation of dharmas of cyclic existence that are defiled by the stains of the discursive thoughts of the root and secondary afflictions. Those stains do not defile it,

original: / dus thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di byis pa rnams kyis yang dag par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: / dus thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di byis pa rnams kyis yang dag par dka' ba ste /
translated: because it is completely pure at all times. This is difficult for the childish to understand correctly.

original: de bas na rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir zab pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir zab pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because of its complete purity, it is said to be profound.

original: gsal bar bgyid pa ni 'od gsal ba ste dri ma dang bcad pa'i gnas skabs la yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bar bgyid pa ni 'od gsal ba ste dri ma dang bcad pa'i gnas skabs la yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Illumination is luminosity. Even in the state of being covered with stains, it is said to be naturally completely pure. This is because of its complete purity.

original: snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa rnams la sprin dang ba mo la sogs pa med pa la shin tu rnam par dag pa'i snang ba chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang bar bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zla ba dang nyi ma la sogs pa rnams la sprin dang ba mo la sogs pa med pa la shin tu rnam par dag pa'i snang ba chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIllumination‚Äù means that just as the moon, sun, etc. are without clouds, mist, etc., they become a great, pure illumination.

original: de bzhin du chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir snang ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir snang ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the dharmatƒÅ forms, etc. are also illuminated like an illumination because of their purity.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa'i dri ma rnams slar mi skyed pa ni mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa'i dri ma rnams slar mi skyed pa ni mtshams sbyor ba ma mchis pa zhes brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúUnconnected‚Äù means that the past afflictions, thoughts, and the stains of conceptual elaborations are not produced again, and that is called ‚Äúunconnected.‚Äù

original: yongs su dor ba de rnams la slar skye ba med pas gsungs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su dor ba de rnams la slar skye ba med pas gsungs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since those things to be abandoned are not produced again, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of purity.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du sprin dang kha ba la sogs pa yod kyang nam mkha' ltar rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par nyid brjod do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du sprin dang kha ba la sogs pa yod kyang nam mkha' ltar rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par nyid brjod do //
translated: The expression ‚Äúwithout defilement‚Äù means that, like space, it is naturally pure, even though clouds, snow, etc. exist at all times.

original: thob pa ma mchis pa mngon par @148b rtogs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba 'di dang thob par byed pa'i chos yod pa la thob pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: thob pa ma mchis pa mngon par @148b rtogs pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba 'di dang thob par byed pa'i chos yod pa la thob pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout attainment, without realization‚Äù means that attainment occurs when there is something to be attained and an agent of attainment.

original: rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa yod na mngon par rtogs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa yod na mngon par rtogs pa 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: But when there is nothing to be realized and no agent of realization, there is no realization.

original: de la kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dag gsal ba tsam la yongs su grub pa chos nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dag gsal ba tsam la yongs su grub pa chos nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In this regard, the perfection of wisdom, the reality of the perfected, is said to be the mere manifestation of the imagined and the relative.

original: de bas na de'i 'ga' zhig thob pa 'am mngon par rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'ga' zhig thob pa 'am mngon par rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no attainment or realization of it at all.

original: mngon par grub pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par ma grub pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes rnam par gzhag pas mngon par ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyiüîΩpha rol tu phyin pa la brjod do //
analyzed: mngon par grub pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon par ma grub pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes rnam par gzhag pas mngon par ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is described as having the characteristic of non-establishment.üîΩNon-apprehension is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shin tu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams rnams ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The desire, form, and formless realms are imagined and dependent.

original: gang zhig de rnams la mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de rnams la mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of those is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni shin tu skye ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni shin tu skye ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba 'don pa'o //
translated: In some places, the reading is utter non-production.

original: de la skye ba ma mchis pa ni mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba ma mchis pa ni mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Non-arising is non-occurrence.

original: ma 'tshal ba yang dag par ma 'tshal ba zhes bya ba la ma 'tshal ba ni rang nyid kyis ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'tshal ba yang dag par ma 'tshal ba zhes bya ba la ma 'tshal ba ni rang nyid kyis ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Non-seeing is not seeing by way of the nature of direct intuition.

original: yang dag par ma 'tshal ba ni chos rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs cung zad mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par ma 'tshal ba ni chos rnams kyi dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs cung zad mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Non-realization is not seeing even the slightest bit of the apprehended form, because of the characteristic of the unreality of things.

original: gnyis kyis dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dri ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dri ba'o //
translated: In order to clarify the characteristic of the nature of the object of perception and the perceiver by way of the duality, he asks:

original: bcom ldan 'das yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, again...

original: lan ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad mi mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lan ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad mi mthong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The answer is: Form, etc. The meaning is that one does not see all things such as form, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnod par mi bgyid phan par yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di nyid kyang shin tu rnam par dag par de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de de bzhin nyidüîΩni de bzhin nyid la phan pa 'am gnod @149a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnod par mi bgyid phan par yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di nyid kyang shin tu rnam par dag par de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid de de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin nyid la phan pa 'am gnod @149a * //
translated: Because this is also the characteristic of suchness, which is extremely pure.

original: pa bgyid pa ma lags te /
analyzed: pa bgyid pa ma lags te /
translated: Suchness does not help or harm suchness.

original: dper na nam mkhas nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkhas nam mkha' la'o //
translated: For example, space does not help or harm space.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /üîΩyongs su mi 'dzin yongs su mi gtong zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad dang yongs su gtong pa med pa mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de ni gal te chos gang yang yongs su
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste / yongs su mi 'dzin yongs su mi gtong zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad dang yongs su gtong pa med pa mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de ni gal te chos gang yang yongs su
translated: For that very reason, it is said that because of the purity of expression.üîΩNot grasping and not releasing refers to the perfection of wisdom, which has the extremely pure characteristic of not grasping and not releasing anything at all.

original: 'dzin pa'am yongs su dor ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'am yongs su dor ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not grasp or release any dharma at all, it would not become pure.

original: 'og tu gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og tu gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bdag rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Later, the elder Subh≈´ti will say, ‚ÄúThe purity of form is the purity of the self,‚Äù meaning that form and so on are nonexistent due to the nonexistence of the self.

original: 'dir dngos po med pa ni rnam par dag pa ste thob pa ma mchis mngon par rtogs pa yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir dngos po med pa ni rnam par dag pa ste thob pa ma mchis mngon par rtogs pa yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, the nonexistence of things is purity, and there is no attainment and no clear realization, as before.

original: de ltar rnam par dag pa'i bstan pa yongs su rdzogs pa la mu ma mchis pa'i bshad pa zab pa nyid rtogs pa'i don du rtsom par byed pa ni bdag mu ma mchis pas na gzugs mu ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa'i bstan pa yongs su rdzogs pa la mu ma mchis pa'i bshad pa zab pa nyid rtogs pa'i don du rtsom par byed pa ni bdag mu ma mchis pas na gzugs mu ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In order to understand the meaning of the profound explanation of the infinite teaching of such purity, he begins, ‚ÄúBecause the self is infinite, form is infinite.‚Äù

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir dang sngon gyi mtha' dad phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus med pa'i phyir mu ma mchis pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir dang sngon gyi mtha' dad phyi ma'i mtha' dang dbus med pa'i phyir mu ma mchis pa nyid de /
translated: Because there is no extreme of eternalism or nihilism, and because there is no prior limit, no later limit, and no middle, there is infinity.

original: gang zhig de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di rtogs pa 'di ni 'di'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di rtogs pa 'di ni 'di'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That realization of the bodhisattva in this way is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar zab pa'i don gyi yul shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyid la brjod kyi sangs rgyas rnams la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar zab pa'i don gyi yul shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyid la brjod kyi sangs rgyas rnams la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the perfection of wisdom, the object of such a profound meaning, called the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas and not of the Buddhas?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yongs su mthar thug pa dad bya ba byas pa ma yin te 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yongs su mthar thug pa dad bya ba byas pa ma yin te 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: The intention is this: This perfection of wisdom is not one whose function is completely finished, but rather, it is the knowledge of paths in the knowledge of all aspects, which is the perfection of wisdom of the Buddhas.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa la ltos pas shin tu rnam par ma dag pa la ltos pas shin tu rnam par mang dag ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa la ltos pas shin tu rnam par ma dag pa la ltos pas shin tu rnam par mang dag ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is called the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas because it is very pure in dependence on that very pure knowledge of paths, and it is called very impure in dependence on the very impure knowledge of paths.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyid la brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Bhagavat, etc.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: pha rol tu song ba zhes bya ba 'am pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: pha rol tu song ba zhes bya ba 'am pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called ‚Äúperfected on the other shore‚Äù or ‚Äúhaving the nature of perfected on the other shore.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called a ‚Äúperfection‚Äù in the case of bodhisattvas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol du song ba yang @149b dam pa rnams la tshu rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pha rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pa 'di 'gram gnyis las tha dad par gzhan du dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol du song ba yang @149b dam pa rnams la tshu rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pha rol gyi 'gram na yang mi gnas pa 'di 'gram gnyis las tha dad par gzhan du dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, perfected on the other shore, does not stand on this shore, nor does it stand on the other shore. It is not observed as something other than the two shores.

original: tshu rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi 'gram la'o //
analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi 'gram la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis shore‚Äù refers to the shore of the conditioned.

original: pha rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi 'gram la'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi 'gram la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other shore‚Äù refers to the shore of the unconditioned.

original: gnyi ga'i bar rgyang ring po na yang zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa dang lkog tu ma gyur pa gal te 'ga' zhig tu yod par gyur na de'i tshe gang la yang nye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bar rgyang ring po na yang zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa dang lkog tu ma gyur pa gal te 'ga' zhig tu yod par gyur na de'i tshe gang la yang nye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they were far apart, in the middle, means that if the middle were to exist somewhere between the two, then it would be near to something.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di la rgyu gsungs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di la rgyu gsungs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Exalted One states the reason for this: because of complete purity.

original: gal te 'gram 'ga' zhig la dmigs par 'gyur na de ltar yod na ni rnam par dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gram 'ga' zhig la dmigs par 'gyur na de ltar yod na ni rnam par dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the middle were to be observed somewhere, then it would not be completely pure.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig tu yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig tu yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: But because it does not exist anywhere, therefore it is completely pure.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir 'gram gnyis la med de gzhan du yang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir 'gram gnyis la med de gzhan du yang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of complete purity, it does not exist in the two extremes, nor does it exist elsewhere.

original: chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid du gzhan gyi 'du shes yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid du gzhan gyi 'du shes yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In all dharmas, there is no other notion of the sameness of suchness.

original: de'i phyir gang du yang gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang du yang gnas pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it does not abide anywhere.

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni gang du yang gnas pa ma yin no zhes spang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni gang du yang gnas pa ma yin no zhes spang ngo //
translated: Thus also means that it does not abide anywhere.

original: gal te shes par gyur na mtshan ma'i sbyor bas 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni gtang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te shes par gyur na mtshan ma'i sbyor bas 'dor bar 'gyur ba ni gtang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to become cognition, it would be abandoned by the application of signs, because it would be relinquished.

original: ring du bgyid par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bar ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring du bgyid par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bar ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would be made distant means that it would be far away.

original: zab pa nyid rtogs pa'i don du chags pa dang ma chags pa'i bstan pa skabs 'byed pa ni rab 'byor ming las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zab pa nyid rtogs pa'i don du chags pa dang ma chags pa'i bstan pa skabs 'byed pa ni rab 'byor ming las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: In order to realize profundity, the teaching of attachment and non-attachment is opened up. Subh≈´ti says from the name, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ni ming gi sgrar kun du brtags pas brda'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa kun du brtags pa zhes gnyi ga yang sgrib pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir chags pa zhes brjod pa yin te chags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ni ming gi sgrar kun du brtags pas brda'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa kun du brtags pa zhes gnyi ga yang sgrib pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir chags pa zhes brjod pa yin te chags pa'o //
translated: In regard to phenomena such as form, the conceptualized sign of convention is called attachment because both are of the nature of obscuration, due to the conceptual imputation of the sound of the name.

original: chags pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du brtags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the conceptual imputation of what is not real.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, Thus... and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the statement of the knowledge of path aspects.

original: legs par bshad pa ni thams cad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa ni thams cad ma yin pa'o //
translated: Well-taught is not all.

original: rnam grangs yongs su gsal ba nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs yongs su gsal ba nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught to clarify the categories.

original: legs par bstan te zhes bya ba ni phra ba yang chags pa'i rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshin tu mthar @150a * //
analyzed: legs par bstan te zhes bya ba ni phra ba yang chags pa'i rgyu mtshan nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro // shin tu mthar @150a * //
translated: Well-explained is because the subtle is also taught as a sign of attachment.

original: gtugs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mthar thug pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtugs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mthar thug pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very ultimate is because the ultimate accumulations of merit and wisdom are taught.

original: chags pa 'di dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: chags pa 'di dag kyang ngo //
translated: These are also attachments.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni khyad par la'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni khyad par la'o //
translated: Also is for the distinction.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i yul gyi bdag med pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i yul gyi bdag med pa mchog tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Attachment has the characteristic of holding the supreme selflessness of various objects.

original: gzugs stong pa'o snyam pa ni chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa'o snyam pa ni chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i sbyor ba nyid kyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The thought ‚Äúform is empty‚Äù is attachment.

original: ci ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams la chags pa ni phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: ci ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams la chags pa ni phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: Just as attachment to the dharmas on the side of affliction is a perversion,üîΩso too is attachment to the dharmas on the side of purification.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe first production of the thought of enlightenment is not the first production of the thought of enlightenment‚Äù is attachment.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.

original: de bzhin du rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams la yang zhes gsungs pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par byang ba'i phyogs rnams la yang zhes gsungs pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.

analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar ni mi nus so zhes bya ba ni chos rnams la gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba med ces bya ba ni rtogs pa las yongs su bsngo ba dmigs pa'i sbyor bas bya ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: koo shi ka de bas na rang nyid kyis chags pa spangs pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: koo shi ka de bas na rang nyid kyis chags pa spangs pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: The thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is attachment.üîΩThe thought ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom is

original: gzhan rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i dus su yang dag par ston pa dang zhes bya ba sngar thos pa dang mi ldan pa thos par byed cing yang dag par dgod pa dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su grub pa'i phyir yang dag par 'dzin par byed
analyzed: gzhan rnams la yang dag par ston pa'i dus su yang dag par ston pa dang zhes bya ba sngar thos pa dang mi ldan pa thos par byed cing yang dag par dgod pa dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su grub pa'i phyir yang dag par 'dzin par byed
translated: When teaching others, he teaches correctly. He causes those who have not previously heard the teachings to hear them, and he establishes them correctly. He causes them to take up the teachings correctly because he has attained them himself.

original: pa'o // yang dag par gzengs bstod pa zhes bya ba ni dal ba rnams spro ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // yang dag par gzengs bstod pa zhes bya ba ni dal ba rnams spro ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: He encourages those who are not diligent.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa rnams la legs so bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa rnams la legs so bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: He rejoices in the efforts of those who are diligent by applauding them and so forth.

original: yang dag pa nyid rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni chags pa gtong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni chags pa gtong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He approves by giving them permission to practice the perfections, and he exhorts them to practice the perfections by praising their benefits. He admires the practice of the perfections by those who are practicing them, and he dedicates the roots of virtue to great enlightenment.

original: de ltar yang dag par dgod pa la rang dang gzhan gyi don dag bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par dgod pa la rang dang gzhan gyi don dag bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, in order to show the benefits of establishing others in the perfections, he says, Thus, having established others in the perfections, he dedicates those wholesome roots to great enlightenment.

original: de bdag nyid la yang gnod par mi byed cing sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur mi byed do //
analyzed: de bdag nyid la yang gnod par mi byed cing sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur mi byed do //
translated: He does not even harm himself, nor does he fail to honor the Buddhas.

original: rang nyid kyis yang dag pa nyid rjes su rtogs pas phan yon gsungs pa ni 'di dag thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis yang dag pa nyid rjes su rtogs pas phan yon gsungs pa ni 'di dag thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The benefits of the realization of reality are stated in the passage beginning ‚ÄúAll these‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la 'grib par 'gyur ba rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la 'grib par 'gyur ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to those who are on the path of the knowledge of path aspects.

original: mtshan mar yid la byed na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs @150b pa la sogs pa la dngos po nyid du gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar yid la byed na zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs @150b pa la sogs pa la dngos po nyid du gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one attends to the signs‚Äù means that one grasps the TathƒÅgatas, and so on, as real things.

original: de ni yongs su mngon par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni dus gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yongs su mngon par mi nus so zhes bya ba ni dus gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not possible to fully comprehend them‚Äù means that they transcend the three times.

original: mtshan mar bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not possible to take them as signs‚Äù means that they are essentially signless.

original: dmigs par bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: dmigs par bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not possible to apprehend them‚Äù means that they are not apprehended by the application of non-apprehension.

original: gang gi phyir de ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang rtogs pa dang rnam par shes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang rtogs pa dang rnam par shes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Because seeing, hearing, discerning, and cognizing are, respectively,üîΩ

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not perceived by the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind, respectively.

original: de ni de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams dang mthong ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams dang mthong ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the domain of the conceptual thoughts that have such a nature, nor of the consciousnesses of seeing, etc.

original: mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo la gnas pa rnam par mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pas mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo la gnas pa rnam par mi rtog pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is realized by the supramundane wisdom that is nonconceptual, which is based on the equality of the objective supports and the subject, because it is the object of the equality of the objective supports and the subject.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni zab po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ni zab po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of dharmas is profound.

original: sngar nyid gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zab pa dang mos par dka' ba nyid rtogs pa'i don du bstan pa'i skabs byas pa'o //
analyzed: sngar nyid gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus zab pa dang mos par dka' ba nyid rtogs pa'i don du bstan pa'i skabs byas pa'o //
translated: The elder ≈öƒÅriputra has already made the occasion for teaching the profundity and difficulty of being devoted to it.

original: da ni bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa'i zab pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis brjod par byed pa ni zab pa zhes bya ba ste dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni bdag nyid kyis rtogs pa'i zab pa gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis brjod par byed pa ni zab pa zhes bya ba ste dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the profundity that is realized by oneself is expressed by the Elder Subh≈´ti as ‚Äúprofound‚Äù because of being void.

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad kyis dben pa dus pa dus thams cad du gnas pa ste 'on kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad kyis dben pa dus pa dus thams cad du gnas pa ste 'on kyang /
translated: Because of that, that which is the nature of all dharmas is void of all the defilements, is pure, and abides at all times, but

original: glo bur pa'i dri mas yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: glo bur pa'i dri mas yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is not an objective support because it is not relinquished by adventitious defilements.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin zab po zhes bya ba ste /üîΩ'di'i gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin zab po zhes bya ba ste / 'di'i gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound by nature.üîΩThe reason for that is stated: because of being pure by nature, because of being luminous by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chags pa'i dri ma rang bzhin gyis glo bur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chags pa'i dri ma rang bzhin gyis glo bur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being void by nature, etc. means because the defilement of attachment is adventitious by nature.

original: don ni 'di yin te dus thams cad du chos rnams thams cad ni chags pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba rang bzhin gyis dben pa ste 'on kyang chags pa yang kun pa rtags kyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te dus thams cad du chos rnams thams cad ni chags pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba rang bzhin gyis dben pa ste 'on kyang chags pa yang kun pa rtags kyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: However, attachment is the imagined object.

original: dmigs par bya ba kun brtags kyi chags pa la yang ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba kun brtags kyi chags pa la yang ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Also, in the imagined attachment that is the object, all phenomena that have intrinsic nature are the intrinsic nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gos pa med pa dang @151a * //
analyzed: gos pa med pa dang @151a * //
translated: Because of being unstained and

original: dben pa de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis zab pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis zab pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: isolated, the perfection of wisdom is profound by nature.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba rtogs nas ngo mtshar bar gyur pa slar gsungs pa ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba rtogs nas ngo mtshar bar gyur pa slar gsungs pa ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having realized that it is naturally free from stains in that way, the one who is amazed again says, ‚ÄúBecause of being isolated by nature,‚Äù

original: de bas na phyag 'tshal bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na phyag 'tshal bar bya ba'o //
translated: and therefore it is to be worshipped.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin dben pa nyid de 'dir gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni ma byas par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin dben pa nyid de 'dir gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni ma byas par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are also isolated in their intrinsic reality. The reason is stated here: ‚Äúbecause they are not made.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ma byas par zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid kyi 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma byas par zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin nyid kyis ngo bo nyid kyi 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not made, the Blessed One fully awakened to suchness, the essence of the unconditioned.

original: de bas na dmigs pa'i sbyor bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa de bas na de rnams rang bzhin gyis cung zad ma yin te gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa'i sbyor bas mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa de bas na de rnams rang bzhin gyis cung zad ma yin te gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since they are not fully awakened to by the application of observation, they are not in the least bit intrinsically existent, because they are the essence of nonduality.

original: gang zhig yang gnyis su med pa de bzhin nyid de 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yang gnyis su med pa de bzhin nyid de 'di rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: That which is nondual is the intrinsic reality of these.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir de ni de kho na nyid de chos nyid gzhan 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin zhes de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir de ni de kho na nyid de chos nyid gzhan 'ga' zhig gi rgyu ma yin zhes de'i phyir rang bzhin med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it is their essence, it is thatness. It is not the cause of any other reality. Therefore, it is said to be ‚Äúessenceless.‚Äù

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te gcig kho na'o //
translated: The nature of phenomena is not dual but is just one.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis chos rnams la rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis chos rnams la rang bzhin gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because phenomena have a single nature by way of the nature of suchness.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na chags pa'i mtha' de dag thams cad rnam par spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na chags pa'i mtha' de dag thams cad rnam par spangs pa yin no //
translated: Subh≈´ti, in this way all those extremes of attachment are abandoned.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci ltar nam mkha' ni sprin dang khug rna la sogs pa yod pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par ma dag pa ma yin te rang bzhin ma rtogs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'o
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ci ltar nam mkha' ni sprin dang khug rna la sogs pa yod pas rang bzhin gyis rnam par ma dag pa ma yin te rang bzhin ma rtogs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa'o
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúbecause space is profound,‚Äù just as space is not naturally impure due to the presence of clouds, mist, and so on, the profound perfection of wisdom is not naturally impure due to the presence of the afflictions.

original: // rjes su rtogs par dka' ba ni de bzhin nyid dang gcig pa'i ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // rjes su rtogs par dka' ba ni de bzhin nyid dang gcig pa'i ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to realize because phenomena, which have the nature of the perfection of wisdom, which is of one nature with suchness, appear to have a variety of natures.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar su yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med do zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i dri ma bsal ba'i mthar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar su yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med do zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i dri ma bsal ba'i mthar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is because no one at all is fully awakened‚Äù is because there is the convention of being fully awakened to the removal of adventitious defilements.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni du bas me ltar chos gzhan gyis bsam par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni du bas me ltar chos gzhan gyis bsam par mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúInconceivable‚Äù means that it cannot be conceived by another phenomenon, like fire by smoke.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni sems kyis shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni sems kyis shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That itself is stated: ‚ÄúIt is not to be known by the mind.‚Äù

original: sems kyis rtogs @151b par bya ba ma yin pa ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis rtogs @151b par bya ba ma yin pa ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to be realized by the mind means that it cannot be realized.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot made‚Äù means because it has the characteristic of suchness that is unconditioned.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni gang gis chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la ji ltar spyad par bya zhes 'dri bar byed
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni gang gis chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la ji ltar spyad par bya zhes 'dri bar byed
translated: Thus, thus means that by not observing the characteristics of all phenomena, in this perfection of wisdom, which is the knowledge of path aspects, one should practice as asked.

original: de / gal te gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma mthong zhing spyod na de'i tshe spyod ces gsungs pa ni gzugs la mi spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de / gal te gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ma mthong zhing spyod na de'i tshe spyod ces gsungs pa ni gzugs la mi spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If one practices without seeing the intrinsic characteristics of forms and so on, then one practices, as stated in the line ‚ÄúIf one does not practice with forms and so on.‚Äù

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid de mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang ma mthong zhing spyod na de'i tshe spyod ces bya ba lan gnyis pa gsungs pa ni gal te gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid de mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang ma mthong zhing spyod na de'i tshe spyod ces bya ba lan gnyis pa gsungs pa ni gal te gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If one practices without seeing the characteristics of phenomena such as impermanence, then one practices, as stated in the second response, ‚ÄúIf one does not practice with impermanent forms and so on.‚Äù

original: gzugs ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ma thob pa dang thob pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ma thob pa dang thob pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The line ‚ÄúIf one does not practice with forms that are complete and incomplete‚Äù refers to not attaining and attaining the completion of meditation.

original: de ni gzugs ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not form.

original: rdzogs pa ma yin pa'am rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi don dam par de bzhin nyid de de la yang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi rigs pas gsungs pa nyid de ni gzugs ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ma yin pa'am rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi don dam par de bzhin nyid de de la yang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi rigs pas gsungs pa nyid de ni gzugs ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is not complete or complete is the ultimate reality of form. And since the characteristic of form is not reasonable in that, it is said: It is not form.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni rdzogs pa ma yin te zhes 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni rdzogs pa ma yin te zhes 'don pa yin no //
translated: In some recensions, it is not complete that is read.

original: ngo mtshar ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni chags pa dang bcas pa nyid dang chags pa ma mchis pa nyid bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni chags pa dang bcas pa nyid dang chags pa ma mchis pa nyid bshad pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the marvelous is the explanation of the absence of attachment and the absence of nonattachment.

original: gzugs la sogs pa med par rtogs pa la yang mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa'i spyor bas chags pa dang bcas pa dang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa med par rtogs pa la yang mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa'i spyor bas chags pa dang bcas pa dang chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even in the realization of the nonexistence of form, etc., there is the characteristic of attachment and nonattachment due to the practice of signs and signlessness.

original: 'di'i rjes la sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das ma rnams la gzugs ni chags pa med pa zhes bya ba spyod par mi byed pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa ni chags pa med pa zhes bya ba spyod par mi byed ces bya ba 'ba' zhig 'donüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rjes la sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das ma rnams la gzugs ni chags pa med pa zhes bya ba spyod par mi byed pa nas ji srid du rnam par shes pa ni chags pa med pa zhes bya ba spyod par mi byed ces bya ba 'ba' zhig 'don pa yin no //
translated: After this, the former Bhagavatƒ´s are recited, beginning with ‚Äúform is not to be practiced as attachment‚Äù up to ‚Äúconsciousness is not to be practiced as attachment.‚Äù

original: chags pa ma yin pa dang mi chags pa yang ma yin zhes zhu gtugs byas pa rnams la yang mang ba'i chos kyi phung po 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa ma yin pa dang mi chags pa yang ma yin zhes zhu gtugs byas pa rnams la yang mang ba'i chos kyi phung po 'don pa yin no //
translated: And for those who ask, ‚ÄúIs it not non-attachment?‚Äù the many Dharma aggregates are recited.

original: chags pa dang bcas pa dang chags pa med pa zhes bya ba yang 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa dang chags pa med pa zhes bya ba yang 'don pa yin no //
translated: And ‚Äúwith attachment‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout attachment‚Äù are also recited.
