original: de yang mdor bsdus te bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phal cher bsnan pa nyid do //üîΩdang por bstan pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa gnyis pa las bstan pa'i phyir sngar 'byung ba'i 'don pa yang legs @152a * //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdus te bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phal cher bsnan pa nyid do // dang por bstan pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa gnyis pa las bstan pa'i phyir sngar 'byung ba'i 'don pa yang legs @152a * //
translated: But since this is not in accord with the brief teaching, it is mostly an addition.

original: par 'brel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: par 'brel ba ma yin no //
translated: And since the second is taught for the sake of the first, the stream-enterer who abides in the fruit, the order of recitation is not well-connected.

original: chags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The unattached is the form of reality free from obscuration.

original: de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, one who practices

original: gzugs ni ma chags pa zhes spyod cing /
analyzed: gzugs ni ma chags pa zhes spyod cing /
translated: practices the form that is unattached.

original: ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unattached is so called because it is free from all attachments.

original: de bas nam bcings pa de khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bas nam bcings pa de khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Therefore, one who is bound is bound by the passions of the three realms.

original: de'i phyir ma grol ba ste nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma grol ba ste nyon mongs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Therefore, one who is not liberated is not liberated by the passions.

original: yang dag par ma 'das pa ni khams gsum las so //
analyzed: yang dag par ma 'das pa ni khams gsum las so //
translated: Not transcended means not transcended the three realms.

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The summary is stated beginning with Subhuti, thus, etc.

original: chos 'di ni zab ste zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma thams cad rjes su mi 'dzin pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang sbyor bas thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'di ni zab ste zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma thams cad rjes su mi 'dzin pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang sbyor bas thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This doctrine is profound means that it is free from all signs, and is free from all addictions because it is applied to meditative concentration.

original: bstan kyang mi 'grib ces bya ba ni bstan pa dang ma bstan pa dag la mtshan ma med pa nyid kyis 'grib pa dang 'phel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan kyang mi 'grib ces bya ba ni bstan pa dang ma bstan pa dag la mtshan ma med pa nyid kyis 'grib pa dang 'phel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase even if it is taught, it does not diminish means that there is no diminution or increase due to the absence of signs in both the taught and the untaught.

original: 'di nyid dpes gsal bar byed pa ni nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid dpes gsal bar byed pa ni nam mkha'i khams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This very point is clarified by an example, beginning with the phrase the realm of space.

original: rtogs par byed pa po'i skyes bus yang ste'u dang tsandan du mnyam pas sbyar bar bya'o zhes de'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i dpe'o //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa po'i skyes bus yang ste'u dang tsandan du mnyam pas sbyar bar bya'o zhes de'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i dpe'o //
translated: The person who realizes this should treat a lump of earth and a piece of sandalwood equally, thinking I will treat them equally. Therefore, it is an example of an illusory person.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang po ni kun nas nyon mongs ba'i khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang po ni kun nas nyon mongs ba'i khong khro ba'o //
translated: The phrase it does not become defiled means that it does not become defiled by the first, which is the anger of defilement.

original: gang zhig slar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni der kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig slar kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni der kun nas nyon mongs pa ni rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: The phrase it does not become defiled again means that it does not become defiled by the second, which is the attachment to defilement.

original: de ltar ngo mtshar ba thob pa'i gnas brtan gyis /
analyzed: de ltar ngo mtshar ba thob pa'i gnas brtan gyis /
translated: Thus, the elder who has attained such a wonder

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dga' ba'i spyod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa la dga' ba'i spyod pa gsungs pa /
translated: speaks of the practice of delighting in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dka' ba bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dka' ba bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is difficult to do.

original: spyod cing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //üîΩzhum par mi bgyid ba zhes bya ba ni bying bas so //
analyzed: spyod cing zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so // zhum par mi bgyid ba zhes bya ba ni bying bas so //
translated: Practicing means by means of serenity.üîΩNot discouraged means by means of laxity.

original: ya ya por mi 'gyur ba ni rgod pas so //
analyzed: ya ya por mi 'gyur ba ni rgod pas so //
translated: Not fainthearted means by means of excitement.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni ldog pa'o //
translated: Not turning back means by means of turning back.

original: nam mkha' sgom pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid gcig tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' sgom pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid gcig tu snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Meditating on space means by means of the appearance of a single characteristic.

original: go cha 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi don du rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: go cha 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sems can thams cad kyi don du rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This armor means that which is put on for the sake of all beings for perfect enlightenment, as will be explained.

original: nam mkha' dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i sbyor bas de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i sbyor bas de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Space means by means of the application similar to space, because it is endowed with that.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang @152b rlung gi grags pa'i dbye bas gnyis su gsungs pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang @152b rlung gi grags pa'i dbye bas gnyis su gsungs pas so //
translated: Similar to space, similar to the dharma-dhƒÅtu means that it is taught as twofold by means of the distinction of worldly and supreme wind-yogas.

original: nam mkha' yongs su thar par 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su thar par 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDesiring to liberate space‚Äù means that it is equal to space.

original: sems can 'degs par 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni gyen du slong ba zhes 'degs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'degs par 'tshal ba zhes bya ba ni gyen du slong ba zhes 'degs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDesiring to lift up sentient beings‚Äù means that it is a lifting up that is a raising up.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten du rus dang rigs dang ming mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig gis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten du rus dang rigs dang ming mi shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother monk‚Äù means that he is not known in the world by clan, family, or name.

original: chos gang yang mi skyed pa ni rnam par byang ba can no //
analyzed: chos gang yang mi skyed pa ni rnam par byang ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot producing any dharma‚Äù means that it is a purification.

original: 'gog par mi bgyid pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: 'gog par mi bgyid pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot stopping‚Äù means that it is a defilement.

original: de ci la zhes bya ba ni gang du yang ma yin zhes rlom sems su byed pa'o / nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de ci la zhes bya ba ni gang du yang ma yin zhes rlom sems su byed pa'o / nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can gyi stong pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù means that he conceives of it as not being anything at all. ‚ÄúIn space‚Äù means in emptiness that has the characteristic of space.

original: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan no //
analyzed: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the open air‚Äù is another term for that.

original: nam mkha' ni skar ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni skar ma'i lam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace‚Äù is the path of the stars.

original: bla gab med pa ni sa'i steng du ma bkab pa'i gzugs can ma yin pa'i gnas zhes bya ba kha cig go //
analyzed: bla gab med pa ni sa'i steng du ma bkab pa'i gzugs can ma yin pa'i gnas zhes bya ba kha cig go //
translated: The open-air site is a place without a roof, a non-material place, so they say.

original: gang bsrung ba dang bskyab ba dang sba ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la /
analyzed: gang bsrung ba dang bskyab ba dang sba ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la /
translated: In the recitation, ‚Äúprotection, defense, and safekeeping,‚Äù

original: gang zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äúwhat‚Äù means ‚Äúwhat kind.‚Äù

original: koo shi ka gal te de ltar zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: koo shi ka gal te de ltar zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pas so //
translated: Kau≈õika, if it is like this, means if all dharmas are not apprehended.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Kau≈õika, moreover, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is of two kinds:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: transcendent and pure mundane.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i khams la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes bya dang khyad par med pa'i ye shes kyis nam mkha'i dkyil dang mnyam par chos rnams thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i khams la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni shes bya dang khyad par med pa'i ye shes kyis nam mkha'i dkyil dang mnyam par chos rnams thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the non-conceptual realm, by the wisdom that is no different from the knowable, sees all dharmas as equal to the center of space.

original: de'i rjes la thob pas sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang chu zla dang mnyam par chos thams cad mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pas sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang chu zla dang mnyam par chos thams cad mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: After that, by the attainment of the fruit, one sees all phenomena as being like an illusion, a mirage, and the reflection of the moon in water.

original: de bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni koo shi ka 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni koo shi ka 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, with reference to the supramundane, it is said: Kausika, what do you think?

original: ji ltar sgra yod pas brag ca med kyang snang ba yin pa de bzhin du gnyis kyis stong pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod na chos rnams med pa'i gnyis kyi ngo bor snang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgra yod pas brag ca med kyang snang ba yin pa de bzhin du gnyis kyis stong pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod na chos rnams med pa'i gnyis kyi ngo bor snang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as an echo is not absent, although it is empty of sound, in the same way, if the perfected nature exists, which is empty of duality, phenomena appear as the nature of duality, which is absent.

original: gang zhig de ltar yongs su shes pa de la bsrung bar bya ba ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //üîΩde bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad brag ca dang mtshungs pa de bas na de rnams dngos po la mngon par zhen @153a * //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar yongs su shes pa de la bsrung bar bya ba ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o // de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad brag ca dang mtshungs pa de bas na de rnams dngos po la mngon par zhen @153a * //
translated: The idea is: What is to be guarded in regard to one who has thoroughly understood in this way?

original: pas rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: pas rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: Therefore means: Because all phenomena are like an echo, therefore one does not falsely project them by clinging to their reality.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni lta bas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni lta bas so //
translated: Not seeing is by way of view.

original: mi shes pa ni 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni 'dzin pas so //
translated: Not knowing is by way of grasping.

original: yang dag par mi shes zhes bya ba ni rtogs pas so //
analyzed: yang dag par mi shes zhes bya ba ni rtogs pas so //
translated: Not fully understanding is by way of realization.

original: des ni 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bstan nas gzung ba med pa nye bar bstan pa ni gal te de ltar gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: des ni 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bstan nas gzung ba med pa nye bar bstan pa ni gal te de ltar gnas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having thus taught non-grasping, he teaches non-apprehension:

original: sangs rgyas stong shes par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas stong shes par gyur to //
translated: If he were to stand thus, he would know a thousand Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus phyogs bcu la sangs rgyas stong mthong nas phan tshun du brjod par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus phyogs bcu la sangs rgyas stong mthong nas phan tshun du brjod par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: By the power of the Buddha, he sees a thousand Buddhas in the ten directions, and says to each other, Thus it is.

original: de lta na yang chen mo rnams la shar dang lho dang ji srid du thams cad du sangs rgyas stong shes par gyur to zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang chen mo rnams la shar dang lho dang ji srid du thams cad du sangs rgyas stong shes par gyur to zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
translated: Even so, in the great assembly, in the east, in the south, up to everywhere, he knows a thousand Buddhas, is the recitation.

original: nyi khri'i gzhung 'grel las kyang de rnams kyis sangs rgyas stong mthong ba ni de la dang ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi khri'i gzhung 'grel las kyang de rnams kyis sangs rgyas stong mthong ba ni de la dang ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the Twenty-Five Thousand also says that they see a thousand Buddhas in order to generate perfect faith in them.

original: lha rnams kyis phan tshun du brjod pa'i tshig nyid gsungs pa ni de dag gi ming 'di dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis phan tshun du brjod pa'i tshig nyid gsungs pa ni de dag gi ming 'di dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words that the gods say to each other are stated in the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúTheir names are. . . . ‚Äù

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of names, phrases, and letters‚Äù means by means of the collections of names, the collections of phrases, and the collections of letters.

original: de la ming ni gang gis chos rnams kyi rang bzhin tsam brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni gang gis chos rnams kyi rang bzhin tsam brjod pa'o //
translated: A name is that by means of which the mere nature of a thing is expressed.

original: dper na mig dang rna ba lha dang mi zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig dang rna ba lha dang mi zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, eye, ear, god, man, etc.

original: tshig ni khyad par gyi tshig ste 'du byed thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig ni khyad par gyi tshig ste 'du byed thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: A phrase is a particular expression, such as ‚Äúall conditioned things. . . . ‚Äù

original: yi ge rnams ni gnyi ga'i rten du gyur pa aa a'i au zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: yi ge rnams ni gnyi ga'i rten du gyur pa aa a'i au zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams so //
translated: Letters are the basis of both names and phrases, such as the letters a, ƒÅ, i, etc.

original: nye bar bstan cing zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i phyir brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan cing zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i phyir brtsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase having been taught means that the teaching was undertaken.

original: le'u 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: le'u 'di nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The phrase in this very chapter refers to the chapter on Purification.

original: yongs su dris shing yongs su zhus te zhes bya ba ni gyur to zhes bya ba'i sgras stong pa po ti rnying pa rnams la 'don pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dris shing yongs su zhus te zhes bya ba ni gyur to zhes bya ba'i sgras stong pa po ti rnying pa rnams la 'don pa'o //
translated: The phrase having asked questions and made requests is a reference to the old manuscripts that lack the word only.

original: de nyid rigs pa sta de ltar ba'i don nyid ni phan tshun du lha rnams kyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pa sta de ltar ba'i don nyid ni phan tshun du lha rnams kyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the meaning of that very reasoning refers to the fact that the gods were speaking to one another about the meaning of the teaching.

original: 'jig rten pa'i khams gzhan na de ltar sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa mthong nas phan tshun du rjod par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang sangs rgyas kyi mthus mthong nas phan tshun du brjod par gyur ces bya ba gsungs pa ni sa phyogs 'di nyid duüîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i khams gzhan na de ltar sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa mthong nas phan tshun du rjod par byed pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yang sangs rgyas kyi mthus mthong nas phan tshun du brjod par gyur ces bya ba gsungs pa ni sa phyogs 'di nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase having seen the Buddha's teaching in other world systems, they spoke to one another about it refers to the fact that, through the Buddha's power, they saw the Buddha's teaching in other world systems and spoke to one another about it.

original: 'dir yang ming 'di dag nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ming 'di dag nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ltos par bya'o //
translated: The phrase in this very place refers to the fact that they saw the Buddha's teaching in this very place.üîΩThe phrase having seen the Buddha's teaching refers to the fact that they saw the Buddha's teaching in this very place.üîΩThe phrase having seen the Buddha's teaching refers to the fact that they saw the Buddha's teaching in this very place.

original: ma byon pa'i @153b sangs rgyas kyi dbang du mdzad nas yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mthong nas 'di brjod par gyur ces gsungs pa ni byams pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: ma byon pa'i @153b sangs rgyas kyi dbang du mdzad nas yang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis mthong nas 'di brjod par gyur ces gsungs pa ni byams pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: And from the perspective of the future Buddhas, it is said, Having seen this through the Buddha's blessing, they will say this. This is indicated by Maitreya, etc.

original: 'dis dus gsum la yang 'di nyid bstan pa yin zhes shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis dus gsum la yang 'di nyid bstan pa yin zhes shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that this is taught for all three times.

original: mthong nas phan tshun du brjod pa nyid shes pa'i don bshad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong nas phan tshun du brjod pa nyid shes pa'i don bshad par bya ba'o //
translated: Having seen, they will say this to each other. The meaning of knowing should be explained.

original: gzhan du na le'u phyi ma la rgyu gang gis byams pas gsung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi dri ba rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na le'u phyi ma la rgyu gang gis byams pas gsung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi dri ba rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, in the later chapters, it would not be appropriate for Maitreya to say, By what cause will Maitreya speak? up to The questions of the elder Subhuti will be in accord.

original: gal te byams pas gsung bar 'gyur zhes lha rnams kyis bsams pa tsam gyis de'i tshe ji ltar gnas brtan gyis shes par gyur ces brjod par bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te byams pas gsung bar 'gyur zhes lha rnams kyis bsams pa tsam gyis de'i tshe ji ltar gnas brtan gyis shes par gyur ces brjod par bya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said, Maitreya will speak, then it should be said, How did the elder know at that time merely by the thought of the gods?

original: rnam par dag pa gtso bo nyid du rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gtso bo nyid du rjod par byed pa'i le'u ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u ste le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: The chapter that is the chief expression of purity is the chapter on purity, the eighth.

original: // / gang zhig sngar gyi le'u'i mthar lha rnams kyis byams pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa da la srid pa bstan pa mi 'thad pa nye bar bstan nas //
analyzed: // / gang zhig sngar gyi le'u'i mthar lha rnams kyis byams pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa da la srid pa bstan pa mi 'thad pa nye bar bstan nas //
translated: Now, at the end of the previous chapter, the gods said, ‚ÄúEven by Maitreya,‚Äù and so on. Here, having shown the untenability of the teaching,

original: rnam pa gang zhig gis bstan pa de dri bar 'dod cing gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gang zhig gis bstan pa de dri bar 'dod cing gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: they want to ask in what way it was taught. The elder Subh≈´ti‚Äôs response is ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la gnyis nye bar dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la gnyis nye bar dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Here, in the teaching of the perfection of wisdom, two things are observed:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang de brjod bar bya ba'i dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang de brjod bar bya ba'i dngos po tsam mo //
translated: the name ‚Äúperfection of wisdom‚Äù and the mere thing that is the basis of that expression.

original: de la gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming de re zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i ming de re zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the statement that which is called the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is merely a name.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid don gyis stong ba ming gi rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid don gyis stong ba ming gi rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement the perfection of wisdom is empty of the nature of the perfection of wisdom is that the perfection of wisdom is empty of the nature of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe meaning of the statement the meaning is empty of the nature of the meaning is that the name is not apprehended as this is it.

original: ji ltar don gyi ngo bo stong pa zhes gsungs pa ni ming de yang 'di'o zhes mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni ming gi rang gi ngo bo nye bar dmigs pa la yang don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'di ni de'i dngos po zhes mi dmigs pa'o
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi ngo bo stong pa zhes gsungs pa ni ming de yang 'di'o zhes mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni ming gi rang gi ngo bo nye bar dmigs pa la yang don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'di ni de'i dngos po zhes mi dmigs pa'o
translated: The meaning of the statement the name is empty of the nature of the name is that even when the intrinsic nature of the name is apprehended, the intrinsic nature of the meaning is not apprehended as this is its entity.

original: // ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la gzugs nye bar dmigs pa de ltar sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la gzugs nye bar dmigs pa de ltar sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as visual consciousness does not apprehend sound when form is apprehended, but when form is not apprehended, it does not apprehend sound either. The meaning is that the intrinsic nature of the name is not apprehended as this is its entity.

original: @154a * // ci'i phyir zhe na med ces gsungs pa ni ngag gi dngos po nyid ming zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ste tshig gi ngo bo'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni ming zhes brjod kyi don gyi ngo bo ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @154a * // ci'i phyir zhe na med ces gsungs pa ni ngag gi dngos po nyid ming zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ste tshig gi ngo bo'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni ming zhes brjod kyi don gyi ngo bo ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why? Because the statement ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù means that the entity of speech is called a name. The meaning is that whatever is the entity of a word is called a name, not the entity of an object.

original: ming gi ngo bos don gyi rang gi ngo bo ma yin mod brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ni don dam pa bar yang yod de des na ming thos pas don gyi rtogs pa yod do //
analyzed: ming gi ngo bos don gyi rang gi ngo bo ma yin mod brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba ni don dam pa bar yang yod de des na ming thos pas don gyi rtogs pa yod do //
translated: Although the entity of a name is not the intrinsic reality of an object, the relationship of the expressed and the expresser exists even in the ultimate, and therefore the understanding of an object exists through hearing a name.

original: de la yang gsungs pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang gsungs pa ni de yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In that regard, the statement ‚Äúthat also‚Äù means

original: ma mchis pa ni don dam par brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ma mchis pa ni don dam par brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: that it does not exist ultimately, because it is the nature of the expressed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i ngo bos mi dmigs so /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i ngo bos mi dmigs so /
translated: Therefore, it is not perceived by that nature.

original: don ni 'di yin te gal te dngos po gang zhig ming gang gis brjod pa de dngos po nyid las de dang 'brel bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te gal te dngos po gang zhig ming gang gis brjod pa de dngos po nyid las de dang 'brel bar 'gyur na /
translated: This is the meaning: If any entity that is expressed by any name were related to it by the nature of an entity,

original: de'i tshe brda mi shes pa rnams kyang sgra thos pa nyid kyis dngos po 'di sgra 'dis brjod par bya ba zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe brda mi shes pa rnams kyang sgra thos pa nyid kyis dngos po 'di sgra 'dis brjod par bya ba zhes shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, even those who do not know the conventional would understand that this thing is to be expressed by this sound, just by hearing the sound.

original: 'di gnyis ni ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi ngo bo dang don gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni ming gi ngo bo dang don gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: These two are said to be non-existent, namely the nature of the name and the nature of the object.

original: re zhig brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kun tu brtags pas yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kun tu brtags pas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the nature of the expressible and the nature of the expression do not exist at all due to imagination.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo gzhan dbang zhes bya bas gal te yod par gyur pa yang de yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo gzhan dbang zhes bya bas gal te yod par gyur pa yang de yod pa yin na /
translated: If it were to exist, it would be the other nature called dependent.

original: de lta na yang des bstan par rung ba ma yin zhes de la de'i 'dir dngos po med pa nye bar dgod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang des bstan par rung ba ma yin zhes de la de'i 'dir dngos po med pa nye bar dgod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even so, it is not suitable to be indicated by that. Therefore, here non-existence is not posited as that.

original: de lta na yang don ji lta bar de ltar ming yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang don ji lta bar de ltar ming yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the name does not exist in the same way as the object.

original: ming ji lta ba de ltar don yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ming ji lta ba de ltar don yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The object also does not exist in the same way as the name.

original: de bas na gnyis ni ma mchis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis ni ma mchis zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the two are non-existent.

original: de ltar yod pa na ci'i slad du rnam pa gang gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ming la sogs pa 'di rnams nyid kyis byams pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa na ci'i slad du rnam pa gang gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ming la sogs pa 'di rnams nyid kyis byams pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par 'gyur /
translated: If that is so, why would Maitreya, having fully awakened to buddhahood by means of any aspect, teach the perfection of wisdom by means of just those names and so on?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te gal te sgra dang don dag la 'brel ba dngos po ba yod na /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te gal te sgra dang don dag la 'brel ba dngos po ba yod na /
translated: The thought is this: If there were a real relationship between words and their referents,

original: de'i tshe don gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis mig la sogs pa gang dag gis bstan pa'i mig la sogs pa de rnams nyid kyis don de nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang bstan par 'gyur /üîΩgal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams /
analyzed: de'i tshe don gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gis mig la sogs pa gang dag gis bstan pa'i mig la sogs pa de rnams nyid kyis don de nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyis kyang bstan par 'gyur / gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams /
translated: then just as the one tathƒÅgata taught eyes and so on by means of those eyes and so on, which he fully awakened to, other tathƒÅgatas would also teach just those referents by means of just those eyes and so on.üîΩIf the referents of the perfection of wisdom were not related to the words such as perfection of wisdom,

original: @154b dang lhan cig tu 'brel ba med na /
analyzed: @154b dang lhan cig tu 'brel ba med na /
translated: then the referents of the perfection of wisdom would not be related to the words such as perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i tshe bstan pa 'di don dang 'brel ba la mi ltos pa ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa rnams nges pa can du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan pa 'di don dang 'brel ba la mi ltos pa ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa rnams nges pa can du byed pa yin no //
translated: At that time, how do the collections of names and so on definitely come to be related to the meaning of this teaching?

original: 'dir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan gsungs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs intention in responding with ‚ÄúIt is like this‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos gang gi tshe snang ba de'i tshe byang chub ces bya ba sangs rgyas thams cad dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos gang gi tshe snang ba de'i tshe byang chub ces bya ba sangs rgyas thams cad dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: When the essence of emptiness, which is free from the imagined and dependent natures of form and so on, appears, at that time it is called ‚Äúawakening,‚Äù which is the same as all buddhas.

original: de yang chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ba sangs rgyas rnams la so sor rang gis rig par bya ba zhes don dam par gzhan rnams la bstan par mi nus pa srid pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas 'gro ba'i don du sangs
analyzed: de yang chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dra ba sangs rgyas rnams la so sor rang gis rig par bya ba zhes don dam par gzhan rnams la bstan par mi nus pa srid pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas 'gro ba'i don du sangs
translated: That is the nature of reality, which is similar to form and so on. It is to be known by each one individually. It is impossible to teach it to others ultimately.

original: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ston pa la 'jug par mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ston pa la 'jug par mdzad do //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn buddhas, in order to benefit migrating beings, enter into teaching by relying on the conventional reality of existence.

original: gzhan du na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi chos nyid de nyid la yang zhugs pa'i phyir mi nus na mngon du byed pa ltag la yod /
analyzed: gzhan du na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi chos nyid de nyid la yang zhugs pa'i phyir mi nus na mngon du byed pa ltag la yod /
translated: Otherwise, since it is not possible to enter into the reality of form and so on, how could one manifest it?

original: de bas na srid pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas ji ltar don rtogs pa de nyid ston pa zhes dus gsum la yang 'di nyid ming la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis bstan pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na srid pa'i kun rdzob la brten nas ji ltar don rtogs pa de nyid ston pa zhes dus gsum la yang 'di nyid ming la sogs pa 'di rnams kyis bstan pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of just that object which is realized in dependence on the conventional of cyclic existence is called the teaching.

original: byams pa yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ming la sogs pa 'di rnams nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro zhes rigs par gsungs so //
analyzed: byams pa yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ming la sogs pa 'di rnams nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro zhes rigs par gsungs so //
translated: Since this very perfection of wisdom is taught in the three times by these names and so on, Maitreya, having fully awakened to buddhahood, will teach this very perfection of wisdom by these names and so on.

original: ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i rgyu nye bar ston par byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i rgyu nye bar ston par byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why? shows the reason for the question. Subh≈´ti, it is like this shows the reason.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir spros pa thams cad kyi dri ma glo bur ba rnams kyis ma 'byor ba stong pa ma yin pa dang bcings pa ma yin pa dang grol ba yang ma yin zhes brjod par mi nus zhes
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir spros pa thams cad kyi dri ma glo bur ba rnams kyis ma 'byor ba stong pa ma yin pa dang bcings pa ma yin pa dang grol ba yang ma yin zhes brjod par mi nus zhes
translated: The form of reality is naturally pure, and it cannot be said that it is not empty, not bound, and not liberated by adventitious stains of conceptual thought.

original: gsungs pa ni stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúnot empty.‚Äù

original: kha cig gis rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i 'don pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i 'don pa byas pa'o //
translated: Some recite this as ‚Äúnot permanent, not impermanent.‚Äù

original: de yang don ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: de yang don ni 'di nyid do //
translated: But the meaning is the same.

original: gnas brtan dang ba skyes pa'i yang dag pa'i don can yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan dang ba skyes pa'i yang dag pa'i don can yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The elder Prasannendƒ´yasatyanandin, in the context of the perfection of qualities, says ‚Äúpurified,‚Äù

original: gzugs rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis snang ba ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam par @155a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs la sogs pa rnams ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis snang ba ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam par @155a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the purity of form‚Äù means that when form and so on do not appear by the nature of the imagined and the dependent, then they are said to be pure.

original: dag pa ma yin pa zhes brjod pa yin te stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo cam du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ma yin pa zhes brjod pa yin te stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo cam du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnot pure‚Äù because it appears as the mere nature of emptiness.

original: de nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams rnam par dag pas chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bdag nyid gcig pas rnam par gnas pa de'i phyir gzugs rnam par dag pas de'i rnam par dagüîΩpa brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag rnams rnam par dag pas chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bdag nyid gcig pas rnam par gnas pa de'i phyir gzugs rnam par dag pas de'i rnam par dag pa brjod do //
translated: In that very [emptiness], due to the purity of the distinctions of form and so forth, all phenomena have the characteristic of complete purity. Since it is of the same nature as the perfection of wisdom, it abides in that way. Therefore, due to the purity of form, its purity is expressed.

original: gzugs skye ba med pa dag zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs skye ba med pa dag zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Form is unborn and pure.

original: gang gi tshe chos nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis gzugs yongs su gyur pa yod pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rnams snang ba med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis gzugs yongs su gyur pa yod pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rnams snang ba med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When form, by its very nature, is transformed, the appearance of arising, ceasing, afflictions, and purification does not exist.

original: gzugs de ni yongs su dag pa zhes 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs de ni yongs su dag pa zhes 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, that form becomes completely pure, not otherwise.

original: 'gres 'di ni sngar gyi bcom ldan 'das ma rnams la med pa kho na ste chen mo bstan pa las mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du blangs nas bsnan pa zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'gres 'di ni sngar gyi bcom ldan 'das ma rnams la med pa kho na ste chen mo bstan pa las mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du blangs nas bsnan pa zhes smra'o //
translated: This is a repetition that was not in the previous Bhagavatƒ´s. It is said that it was added for the purpose of applying it to the realizations in the teaching of the Great One.

original: nam mkha' rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la glo bur ba'i sprin dang na bun yod kyang rnam par ma dag pa med de ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis de dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la glo bur ba'i sprin dang na bun yod kyang rnam par ma dag pa med de ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis de dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for pure like space, just as space is not impure due to the presence of adventitious clouds and mist, because it is pure by its very nature.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzugs dang ma gos pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang gzugs dang ma gos pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom is not defiled by form, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad kun du brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i dri ma nye bar gos pa log pa las yongs su dag par byed pa mthong ba de'i
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad kun du brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i dri ma nye bar gos pa log pa las yongs su dag par byed pa mthong ba de'i
translated: When one sees the perfection of wisdom purifying by the reversal of the defilement of the stains of conceptual elaborations of afflictions and thoughts that are imputed to all phenomena such as form,

original: tshe dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa yongs su dag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: tshe dmigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa yongs su dag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because life is free from all reference, it is said to be the pure aspect of non-apprehension.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sgra yang gzhan dag 'don pa yin te rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa nye bar bstan nas gos pa med pa nyid kyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sgra yang gzhan dag 'don pa yin te rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa nye bar bstan nas gos pa med pa nyid kyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: The sound of ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù is uttered by others, because of its purity. Having demonstrated its similarity to space, it is said to be ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù because of its non-attachment.

original: nam mkha' gos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste sngar glo bur ba'i sprin la sogs pa'i dri ma yod kyang nam mkha' rnam par dag par brjod do //
analyzed: nam mkha' gos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste sngar glo bur ba'i sprin la sogs pa'i dri ma yod kyang nam mkha' rnam par dag par brjod do //
translated: Although space is previously defiled by adventitious clouds and so on, it is said to be pure.

original: de ni de rnams kyis ma gos pa zhes bya ba'i don tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyis ma gos pa zhes bya ba'i don tha dad pa'o //
translated: That is the meaning of ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù by them.

original: gzhan dag ni nam mkha' dang brag ca smrar med cing brjod du med la dmigs su med pas zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nam mkha' dang brag ca smrar med cing brjod du med la dmigs su med pas zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
translated: Others utter the sound of ‚Äúunobstructed‚Äù because space and an echo are inexpressible and incommunicable, and cannot be apprehended.

original: de la don ni 'di yin te ji ltar nam mkha' la brag ca @155b gnyis kyi sgra thos pa yod kyang 'dir sgra dang sgra brnyan dag gi brag ca'i sgra gnas pa zhes nam mkha'i 'di sgra zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin la tha dad pa brjodüîΩpar 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don ni 'di yin te ji ltar nam mkha' la brag ca @155b gnyis kyi sgra thos pa yod kyang 'dir sgra dang sgra brnyan dag gi brag ca'i sgra gnas pa zhes nam mkha'i 'di sgra zhes smra bar nus pa ma yin la tha dad pa brjod par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is as follows: Just as when the sound of an echo is heard in space, one cannot say that this space is the sound of the echo of the sound and its reflection, because there is no desire to express a difference.

original: de bas na nam mkha'i brjod pa med pa nyid kyis brjod pas nye bar gos pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha'i brjod pa med pa nyid kyis brjod pas nye bar gos pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since space is inexpressible, it is not defiled by expression.

original: gzhan ni de lta na yang mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba la bde ba ma yin pa nyid rlom sems su byed cing nam mkha' dang brag ca smrar med cing brjod du med la dmigs su med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'don pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni de lta na yang mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba la bde ba ma yin pa nyid rlom sems su byed cing nam mkha' dang brag ca smrar med cing brjod du med la dmigs su med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba 'don pa byas pa yin no //
translated: Another person, even though it is like that, makes a conceit of the unpleasantness in the application to realization, and recites, ‚ÄúBecause space and echo are inexpressible, cannot be expressed, and cannot be apprehended.‚Äù

original: de la bshad pa ni 'di yin te nam mkha' la brag ca gang zhig des spyi'i ngo bos kyang mi brjod pas chos thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni 'di yin te nam mkha' la brag ca gang zhig des spyi'i ngo bos kyang mi brjod pas chos thams cad brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is as follows: Since any echo in space is not expressed even by its general nature, all phenomena are inexpressible.

original: brjod du med pa ni chos thams cad kyi khyad par brjod pa zhes bya bas kyang mchog tu brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni chos thams cad kyi khyad par brjod pa zhes bya bas kyang mchog tu brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inexpressible is also distinguished by the expression ‚Äúthe special quality of all dharmas.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i ngo bos dmigs pa med pas mi dmigs pa zhes bya bas khyad par du bsdu bar byas nas de rnams kyi ngo bo ni de nyid de des yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i ngo bos dmigs pa med pas mi dmigs pa zhes bya bas khyad par du bsdu bar byas nas de rnams kyi ngo bo ni de nyid de des yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is not an object of perception by way of its own-nature, it is distinguished by the expression ‚Äúnon-perception.‚Äù The nature of those is just that, and it is purified by that.

original: 'don pa 'di ni drang srong ba ma yin bar rang dga' ba mkhas par rlom pa rnams kyis brtsams pa de lta na yang po ti mang por dar ba de bas na bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'don pa 'di ni drang srong ba ma yin bar rang dga' ba mkhas par rlom pa rnams kyis brtsams pa de lta na yang po ti mang por dar ba de bas na bshad pa'o //
translated: This recitation is not by the sages, but by those who are self-indulgent and arrogant about their learning. Even so, since many texts have spread, it is explained.

original: nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúContaminated and uncontaminated‚Äù and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni nye bar gos pa'o //üîΩrnam par byad ba rnams ni nye bar ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni nye bar gos pa'o // rnam par byad ba rnams ni nye bar ma gos pa'o //
translated: The dharmas of affliction are contaminated.üîΩThe purified dharmas are uncontaminated.

original: nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa de rnams yin la nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa de rnams yin la nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: Those are the contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas.

original: thams cad kyang yin la de rnams kyang yin te de rnams kyis nye bar gos pa ma yin ba nyid ni ma gos pa nyid de gnyis ka mi dmigs pa'i phyir de rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la de rnams kyang yin te de rnams kyis nye bar gos pa ma yin ba nyid ni ma gos pa nyid de gnyis ka mi dmigs pa'i phyir de rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: All of them are, and they are not defiled by those, because both of them are not apprehended. That is their purity.

original: de ltar shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la dang ba mngon par 'phel ba'i gnas brtan gyis gsungs pa ni legs par rnyed pa lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu rnam par dag pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa la dang ba mngon par 'phel ba'i gnas brtan gyis gsungs pa ni legs par rnyed pa lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the Elder Subh≈´ti, who has increased his faith in the teaching of the Perfection of Wisdom which is extremely pure, says, It is a good gain, etc.

original: ci'i phyir rnyed pa legs par rnyed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnyed pa legs par rnyed ce na /
translated: Why is the gain good?

original: gsungs pa ni gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni gang dag gi rna lam du grag par gyur pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, Those in whose presence it is heard, etc.

original: slar yang dang ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon rnams gsungs pa ni de dag la mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang dang ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon rnams gsungs pa ni de dag la mig gi nad 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to generate faith again, the benefits in this life are stated: No eye disease will arise for them, etc.

original: tshes brgyad la zhes @156a * //
analyzed: tshes brgyad la zhes @156a * //
translated: On the eighth day of the lunar month, etc.

original: bya ba shin tu yang dag par sbyor ba la gnyis pa ste dus dang dngos po dang lam du 'gro ba la sogs pas las kyi ming byas pas las nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba shin tu yang dag par sbyor ba la gnyis pa ste dus dang dngos po dang lam du 'gro ba la sogs pas las kyi ming byas pas las nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is the correct performance of action, because it is action itself, since it is named action by way of time, entity, path, and so on.

original: gzhan dag la ni las rnams kyi don la 'gro bas tshes brgyad la'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni las rnams kyi don la 'gro bas tshes brgyad la'o //
translated: Others say: Since the meaning of action is to go, it is on the eighth day.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams kyis pho brang du srung bar byed pa ni tshes bcu bzhi la'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams kyis pho brang du srung bar byed pa ni tshes bcu bzhi la'o //
translated: The four great kings guard the palace on the fourteenth day.

original: de dag gi bu rnams ni bco lnga la'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bu rnams ni bco lnga la'o //
translated: Their sons guard on the fifteenth day.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi ni rang nyid kyis 'dzam bu'i gling du song nas rnam par 'tsham par byed de gang gi tshe dge ba byed pa mang ba rnams mthong na de'i tshe lha rnams kyi dga' ba'i sems 'phel bar byed de lha'i dbang po'i gan du song
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi ni rang nyid kyis 'dzam bu'i gling du song nas rnam par 'tsham par byed de gang gi tshe dge ba byed pa mang ba rnams mthong na de'i tshe lha rnams kyi dga' ba'i sems 'phel bar byed de lha'i dbang po'i gan du song
translated: The four great kings themselves go to Jambudvƒ´pa and investigate. When they see that those who engage in virtue are many, then the gods increase their delight and go to the lord of the gods

original: ste rig par byed de zhes mdo las so //
analyzed: ste rig par byed de zhes mdo las so //
translated: and inform him, as the sutras explain.

original: de lta na yang rtag tu mngon par sbyor ba med kyang tshes 'di dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pa la myur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang rtag tu mngon par sbyor ba med kyang tshes 'di dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brjod pa la myur bar bya'o //
translated: Even so, although not always applied, one should quickly proceed to the recitation of the Perfection of Wisdom on these lunar days.

original: de bas na 'dzam bu'i gling du 'jug pa'i lha la sogs pa'i sems can mang po la phan pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir bsod nams cher mang du skyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dzam bu'i gling du 'jug pa'i lha la sogs pa'i sems can mang po la phan pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir bsod nams cher mang du skyed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is the basis for the benefit of many beings, such as the gods who enter the Rose Apple Land, one generates much merit.

original: gang na med pa'i rin po che yin pa'i phyir 'di la bsod nams mang po skyed pa'i rten nyid do //
analyzed: gang na med pa'i rin po che yin pa'i phyir 'di la bsod nams mang po skyed pa'i rten nyid do //
translated: Because it is a jewel that is not found everywhere, it is the basis for the generation of much merit.

original: rab 'byor de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: rab 'byor de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Subhuti, for this very reason, etc. For this very reason,

original: legs rnams gegs ni mang ba ste //
analyzed: legs rnams gegs ni mang ba ste //
translated: the obstacles to the good are many,

original: zhes bya ba smras pas bar du gcod pa yang dag par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor 'on kyang bar chad mang du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras pas bar du gcod pa yang dag par 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa ni rab 'byor 'on kyang bar chad mang du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: he said. The arising of obstacles is stated as Subhuti, nevertheless, many obstacles will arise, etc.

original: dgra ni phongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra ni phongs pa'o //
translated: The enemy is poverty.

original: ji tsam dug ces par gyur pa ni ji ltar 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: ji tsam dug ces par gyur pa ni ji ltar 'phel ba'o //
translated: As much as it is poison means as much as it increases.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called unsurpassed.

original: ci'i phyir bla na med pa zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba ste 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bla na med pa zhe na de'i phyir gsungs pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba ste 'jug pa'o //
translated: Why is it unsurpassed? Therefore it is said: it is engaged for the sake of benefit and happiness.

original: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni chos thams cad mi skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi bshad pa ni chos thams cad mi skye ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of just this is: all phenomena are non-arisen, etc.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la snang ba ma yin zhes ston par byed pa ni mi 'jugs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la snang ba ma yin zhes ston par byed pa ni mi 'jugs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is taught that arising, ceasing, etc. do not appear in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba nyid de de yang g-yo ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i tshul zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba nyid de de yang g-yo ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i tshul zhes brjod do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúby the method of non-engagement‚Äù means that the nature of all phenomena is luminosity, and that is also called the method of non-engagement because it is the nature of non-movement.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Moreover, that is the nature of the perfection of wisdom as the consummate.

original: chos gang la yang mi gnas zhes bya ba ste kun du brtags pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang mi gnas zhes bya ba ste kun du brtags pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One should not settle down in any dharma means that one should not settle down in the imagined.

original: chos gang la yang mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnas @156b par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnas @156b par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One should not join any dharma means that one should not settle down in the other-dependent.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo gang la yang nye bar mi len te rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo gang la yang nye bar mi len te rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba nyid kyis dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-existence of those two, one does not take hold of any reality of the perfected, because of its natural freedom from defilement, since it abides at all times.

original: de nyid la rgyu gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu gsungs pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason for that is stated: Why is it so?

original: chos de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang rnams so //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang rnams so //
translated: All those dharmas are the imagined and the other-dependent.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su grub pa yin na de'i tshe kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dag la snang ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su grub pa yin na de'i tshe kun brtags dang gzhan dbang dag la snang ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Non-apprehension means that when the perfection of wisdom is perfected, at that time there is no appearance of the imagined and the other-dependent.

original: de bas na ma gos pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bas na ma gos pa ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma rnams kyis so //
translated: Therefore, unstained means by the stains of afflictions, karma, and conceptuality.

original: 'di la mi dmigs pa dang ma gos ba dag kyang ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa ni ma gos pa zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu la ste gang gi phyir ma gos pa de'i phyir 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyinüîΩpa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la mi dmigs pa dang ma gos ba dag kyang ci'i phyir yin zhe na gsungs pa ni ma gos pa zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu la ste gang gi phyir ma gos pa de'i phyir 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, why is it both non-apprehending and unstained? It is said: The word also is in the cause, because it is unstained, therefore this is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na gal te nye bar ma gos par gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de bas na gal te nye bar ma gos par gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, if it were not unstained, it would not be the perfection of wisdom.

original: / ji ltar ma gos pa zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar ma gos pa zhe na /
translated: How is it unstained?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this... and so on.

original: gal te de ltar yang dag par mi shes na zhes bya ba ni de ltar yon tan mang ba dang ldan pa ma gos pa'i rang bzhin zhes kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang dag par mi shes na zhes bya ba ni de ltar yon tan mang ba dang ldan pa ma gos pa'i rang bzhin zhes kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: If one does not know it like this, i.e., does not know it as having many such qualities, it is called the unstained nature, but it is also non-conceptual.

original: chos gang la yang 'jug par byed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang la yang 'jug par byed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNo dharma whatsoever is engaged,üîΩor definitely engaged, or revealed, or attained, or definitely attained, or ever non-existent.‚Äù

original: mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pas chos thams cad ni de'i tshe na yongs su grub pa nyid de la snang ba zhes khyad par can gyi chos gang la yang 'jug par byed pa ni skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pas chos thams cad ni de'i tshe na yongs su grub pa nyid de la snang ba zhes khyad par can gyi chos gang la yang 'jug par byed pa ni skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: At that time, all dharmas appear in that perfected nature, which is unchanging. No special dharma is engaged, that is, produced.

original: nges par 'jug par byed pa ni de nyid la rgyun gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'jug par byed pa ni de nyid la rgyun gyis 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Definitely engaged means engaging in a continuum in that very [perfected nature].

original: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni mngon du byas pas so //üîΩyongs su thob par byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos la phongs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni mngon du byas pas so // yongs su thob par byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos la phongs par byed pa'o //
translated: Revealed means manifesting.üîΩAttained means reaching the result.

original: nges par thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid mthar thug pa la 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: nges par thob par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid mthar thug pa la 'dren pa'o //
translated: Definitely attained means leading to the final [perfected nature].

original: thams cad du ni med pa zhes 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ni med pa zhes 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: Non-existent should be connected with all [of the above].

original: nye bar bstan pa 'di la gdul bya rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas chog shes pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa 'di la gdul bya rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas chog shes pa'i 'bras bu gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The result of satisfaction through disciples' attainment of forbearance with respect to the non-production of things in this teaching is stated in the passage beginning with Then.

original: ca co ni skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i dga' ba las skyes pa'i sgra chen po'o //
analyzed: ca co ni skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i dga' ba las skyes pa'i sgra chen po'o //
translated: A great cry is a great sound of joy from a great crowd of people.

original: de nyid ni ga zha ste shin tu che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni ga zha ste shin tu che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That itself is a great cry, because it is very great.

original: lan gnyis su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lan gnyis su zhes bya ba la /
translated: Twice,

original: gcig ni @157a * //
analyzed: gcig ni @157a * //
translated: one is

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag gi bdag med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas b'a r'a na s'ir chos kyi 'khor lo sngar rab tu bskor ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag gi bdag med pa'i dbang du mdzad nas b'a r'a na s'ir chos kyi 'khor lo sngar rab tu bskor ba'o //
translated: the first turning of the wheel of the doctrine by the Lord in VaÃÑra·πáasÃÅi, from the viewpoint of the selflessness of the person.

original: 'di ni chos kyi bdag med pa la ltos nas gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi bdag med pa la ltos nas gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is called the second in terms of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'di ni lan gnyis su bskor ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad kyi grangs las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni chos gang la yang rab tu bskor ba 'am ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni lan gnyis su bskor ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad kyi grangs las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa ni chos gang la yang rab tu bskor ba 'am ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is not turned twice is stated because ultimately, since it is beyond enumeration, it is said that there is no turning or reversal of any phenomenon.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba zhes bya bas ming gi rnam par rtog pa gsal bar mdzad de /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba zhes bya bas ming gi rnam par rtog pa gsal bar mdzad de /
translated: The expression the wheel of the Dharma is turned clarifies the conceptualization of names.

original: de ltar 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, this is stated in the passage beginning with thus.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kho na 'dzin par byed pa chos gang la yang rab tu bskor ba 'am ldog pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kho na 'dzin par byed pa chos gang la yang rab tu bskor ba 'am ldog pa med do //
translated: When the perfection of wisdom alone, which has the nature of the nonexistence of the entity of all phenomena, is apprehended, there is no turning or reversal of any phenomenon.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, this is the meaning of the statement this perfection of wisdom is expressed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab 'byor 'di la chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i rgyas pa bstan par byed de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rab 'byor 'di la chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i rgyas pa bstan par byed de /
translated: The phrase great perfection of wisdom and so forth indicate the extensive explanation of the engagement with phenomena for Subh≈´ti.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa chen po 'di zhes bya bas yul chen po nyid dang gsang ba'i yul chen po zhes bstan par byed pa ni 'di lta ste gsang ba ni rnam pa gsum las chos la 'jug pa'i gsang ba dang / mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gsang ba dang /
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa chen po 'di zhes bya bas yul chen po nyid dang gsang ba'i yul chen po zhes bstan par byed pa ni 'di lta ste gsang ba ni rnam pa gsum las chos la 'jug pa'i gsang ba dang / mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gsang ba dang /
translated: Therein, the phrase this great perfection of wisdom indicates the greatness of the object and the greatness of the secret object. The secret is threefold: the secret of engaging with phenomena, the secret of manifest complete enlightenment, and the secret of turning the wheel of Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i gsang ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i gsang ba'o //
translated: The secret of engaging with phenomena is stated as follows:

original: de la chos la 'jug pa'i gsang ba gsungs pa ni gang zhig chos thams cad la chags pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la chos la 'jug pa'i gsang ba gsungs pa ni gang zhig chos thams cad la chags pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase that which is unattached to all phenomena indicates the secret of engaging with phenomena.

original: gal te yang kun rdzob tu de'i chos thams cad snang ba de lta na yang 'di don dam par de rnams kyi ngo bo med pa mthong zhing chos gang la yang chags par mi byed de /
analyzed: gal te yang kun rdzob tu de'i chos thams cad snang ba de lta na yang 'di don dam par de rnams kyi ngo bo med pa mthong zhing chos gang la yang chags par mi byed de /
translated: Even though all the phenomena of the conventional appear, still, ultimately, he does not see any essence of those phenomena, and he does not become attached to any phenomenon.

original: des na thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang gis chos kyi ming yang dag par 'jug par byed pa dang chos ma yin pa'i 'du shes dang mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang bstan pa dang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang mthong zhes
analyzed: des na thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbang gis chos kyi ming yang dag par 'jug par byed pa dang chos ma yin pa'i 'du shes dang mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang bstan pa dang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang mthong zhes
translated: Therefore, he applies the names of phenomena and non-phenomena to all things, in terms of the conventional and the ultimate. He teaches the realization of perfect buddhahood, and he sees the realization of perfect buddhahood.

original: bya bas mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gsang ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bya bas mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi gsang ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: Thus, he teaches the secret of perfect buddhahood.

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @157b 'tshal bas chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @157b 'tshal bas chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhoever wishes to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening does not fully awaken to any phenomenon at all.‚Äù

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i gsang ba gsungs pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor yang zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i gsang ba gsungs pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor yang zhes bya bas so //
translated: The secret of the turning of the wheel of Dharma is stated in the passage beginning with ‚Äúeven though the wheel of Dharma is turned.üîΩ.üîΩ.no dharma is taught at all.‚ÄùüîΩ.

original: chos gang yang yang dag par mi ston pa ste /üîΩ'og tu ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rnam pa brgyad kyis 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: chos gang yang yang dag par mi ston pa ste / 'og tu ni chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba rnam pa brgyad kyis 'chad par byed de /
translated: He does not teach any dharma at all.üîΩüîΩThe following passage explains the wheel of dharma in eight aspects.

original: chos med pa dang / 'khor lo med pa dang / rab tu bskor ba med pa dang / bstan pa med pa dang / ston pa po med pa dang / thos pa med pa dang / rtogs pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa las so //üîΩde la chos med pa gsungs pa ni /üîΩgang zhig dmigs par bya ba de la ni chos med do //
analyzed: chos med pa dang / 'khor lo med pa dang / rab tu bskor ba med pa dang / bstan pa med pa dang / ston pa po med pa dang / thos pa med pa dang / rtogs pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa las so // de la chos med pa gsungs pa ni / gang zhig dmigs par bya ba de la ni chos med do //
translated: from the non-existence of the Dharma, from the non-existence of the wheel, from the non-existence of the turning, from the non-existence of the teaching, from the non-existence of the teacher, from the non-existence of the hearing, from the non-existence of the realization, and from the non-existence of the noble person.üîΩüîΩHere, the non-existence of the Dharma is stated:üîΩThere is no Dharma for one who is an object of apprehension.üîΩüîΩ

original: chos gang zhig bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos gang zhig bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: What is the Dharma that is to be taught?üîΩ

original: 'khor lo med pa gsungs pa ni 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig bskor bar bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo med pa gsungs pa ni 'ga' zhig gis 'ga' zhig bskor bar bya ba yang med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that there is no wheel means that there is no one who turns for anyone.üîΩ

original: 'ga' zhig med ces bya ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig med ces bya ba'i sgra'o //
translated: Some say that the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is the word.üîΩ

original: de ni 'khor lo 'dra bas na 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo 'dra bas na 'khor lo ste /
translated: It is a wheel because it is like a wheel,

original: de la gnas nas don la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas nas don la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one engages the meaning by abiding in it.

original: rab tu bskor ba med pa gsungs pa ni chos gang yang ldog par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu bskor ba med pa gsungs pa ni chos gang yang ldog par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement about not being turned well is ‚Äúno dharma is turned back‚Äù

original: 'di nyid la rgyu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la rgyu gsungs pa ni /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù and so on.

original: rab 'byor gyi tshig nyid bstan par byed pa ni de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi tshig nyid bstan par byed pa ni de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement that demonstrates Subh≈´ti‚Äôs own words is ‚ÄúJust so, Subh≈´ti‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid ni 'jug pa yang ma yin ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid ni 'jug pa yang ma yin ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because emptiness does not engage or disengage.

original: de ltar mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang / bstan pa med pa gsungs pa ni gang yang 'di ltar bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang / bstan pa med pa gsungs pa ni gang yang 'di ltar bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: The statement about signlessness, wishlessness, and non-display is ‚ÄúWhatever is taught as such‚Äù and so on.

original: ston pa po med pa gsungs pa ni sus kyang bstan pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa po med pa gsungs pa ni sus kyang bstan pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about the absence of a teacher is ‚ÄúIt is not taught by anyone.‚Äù

original: thos pa med pa gsungs pa ni sus kyang thos pa med la sus kyang mnos pa yang med ces bya ba'o //üîΩrtogs pa med pa gsungs pa ni sus kyang mngon sum du byas pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thos pa med pa gsungs pa ni sus kyang thos pa med la sus kyang mnos pa yang med ces bya ba'o // rtogs pa med pa gsungs pa ni sus kyang mngon sum du byas pa yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement that there is no understanding means that no one realizes it.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag med pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that there are no noble persons means thatüîΩno one becomes a stream-enterer, etc.üîΩThe statement that there is no attainment of results means that no one attains the result of stream-entry, etc.üîΩThe statement that there is no parinirvana means that no one passes into parinirvana.

original: 'dis ni su yang yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das zhes bya ba nas ji srid sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa yang med ces bya bas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni su yang yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das zhes bya ba nas ji srid sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa yang med ces bya bas so //
translated: The statement that there is no one who has gone to a wholesome state means that no one becomes a recipient of gifts.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i slad du 'di ni mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde bzhin @158a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas pa'i slad du 'di ni mtha' yas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ste / de bzhin @158a * //
translated: Because of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.
