analyzed: nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis nam mkha' bzhin du mu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.

original: nam mkha' ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: Because of the infinity of space, this is the perfection of the infinite.üîΩBecause

original: der ni nam mkha' bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid dang med pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni nam mkha' bzhin du mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid dang med pa'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There, it does not exist by way of the nature of non-apprehension, like space, and by way of the nature of non-existence.

original: 'di ni chen mo rnams kyi 'don pa mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du bsnan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chen mo rnams kyi 'don pa mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du bsnan pa'o //
translated: This is added for the purpose of applying the recitation of the Great Ones to the clear realizations.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis par mnyam pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad kun gyis dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyis mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis par mnyam pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad kun gyis dmigs pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyis mnyam pa'o //
translated: Because of the sameness of all dharmas in being unapprehendable, all dharmas are the same in being unapprehendable by nature.

original: dben pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their isolation, they are free from the proliferation of defilement, discursive thought, etc.

original: shin tu stong pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bos chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu stong pa zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bos chos thams cad stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of their emptiness, all dharmas are empty of the natures of the imagined and the relative.

original: mi brdzi ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid chos thams cad sgro 'dogs pa la yang dag par ldang ba'i skyon rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos rnams thams cad kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis stong pa de bzhin nyid dang rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ba yin na de'i phyir gang gis kyang zil gyis non
analyzed: mi brdzi ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid chos thams cad sgro 'dogs pa la yang dag par ldang ba'i skyon rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir ro // chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos rnams thams cad kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis stong pa de bzhin nyid dang rang bzhin gcig par 'gyur ba yin na de'i phyir gang gis kyang zil gyis non
translated: ‚ÄúUnconquerable‚Äù means that the natural purity is not overcome by the faults of the arising of superimpositions on all phenomena.

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause all phenomena are not apprehended‚Äù means that when all phenomena are empty of the imagined and dependent natures, they become the same in suchness and nature, and therefore they are not overcome by anything.

original: gnas pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos rnams 'di la gang gis kyang gnas su gyur ba yod pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rten med pas gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa dang / gang du yang 'gro ba med pa dang lus kyang cung zad kyang gang zag dang chos kyi bdag nyid med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos rnams 'di la gang gis kyang gnas su gyur ba yod pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir rten med pas gang nas kyang 'ong ba med pa dang / gang du yang 'gro ba med pa dang lus kyang cung zad kyang gang zag dang chos kyi bdag nyid med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a basis‚Äù means that because there is no basis for any phenomenon whatsoever, they do not come from anywhere, they do not go anywhere, and the body is also not even slightly the self of a person or phenomena.

original: 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa dang lus med pa dang skye ba med pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa dang lus med pa dang skye ba med pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that ‚Äúbecause they do not come or go, and because they have no body, and because they are unborn.‚Äù

original: ming ma mchis shing lus ma mchis pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: ming ma mchis shing lus ma mchis pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: In the recitation ‚Äúwithout a name and without a body,‚Äù a name is the formless aggregates.

original: lus ni gzugs kyi phung pa'o //
analyzed: lus ni gzugs kyi phung pa'o //
translated: A body is the form aggregate.

original: de dag med pas zhes bshad par byed de /
analyzed: de dag med pas zhes bshad par byed de /
translated: Because they do not exist, it is explained.

original: ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gzugs byed pa dang nyams su myong bar byed pa la sogs pa 'di de don dam par rang bzhin yod pa ma yin zhes des na stong pa dang ngo bo nyid medüîΩ@158b pa rnams so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gzugs byed pa dang nyams su myong bar byed pa la sogs pa 'di de don dam par rang bzhin yod pa ma yin zhes des na stong pa dang ngo bo nyid med @158b pa rnams so //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey are essenceless‚Äù means that the nature of phenomena, which is the object of form, experience, and so on, does not ultimately exist. Therefore, they are empty and essenceless.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs de la chos thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba phyin ci log spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrjod du ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs de la chos thams cad kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba phyin ci log spangs pa'i phyir ro // brjod du ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey do not come or go‚Äù means that in that state, the coming and going of all phenomena is abandoned.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThey are inexpressible‚Äù means that they are not the objects of expression.

original: rtog pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey are nonconceptual‚Äù means that they are not the conceptual objects of expression.

original: ming ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout name‚Äù means that the four aggregates that are not form, called feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, do not exist.

original: phung po bzhi po 'di rnams nyid la mi dmigs pa nyid kyi tshig gnyis kyi tshig gnyis ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po bzhi po 'di rnams nyid la mi dmigs pa nyid kyi tshig gnyis kyi tshig gnyis ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ma yin no //
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúnot apprehended‚Äù and ‚Äúnot non-apprehended‚Äù are not recited in some recitations of this text.

original: chos thams cad 'gro ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni 'gro ba las grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gro ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni 'gro ba las grol ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall phenomena are without going‚Äù means that all phenomena are free from going.

original: chos thams cad gzung ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos rnams ni chos rnams la mi 'dzin pa ste de bas na mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzung ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos rnams ni chos rnams la mi 'dzin pa ste de bas na mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall phenomena are ungraspable‚Äù means that phenomena do not grasp phenomena. Therefore, they are not lost.

original: mi bas pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi zad pa'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par snang ba de'i phyir mi zad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩchos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos mngon par ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i phyir 'di ni chos thams cad mi skye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bas pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi zad pa'i skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan par snang ba de'i phyir mi zad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos mngon par ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de'i phyir 'di ni chos thams cad mi skye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúendowed with the Dharma of the fearless‚Äù means that all dharmas appear to be endowed with the Dharma of the fearless, which is the non-production and non-cessation of all dharmas. Therefore, it is the perfection of the fearless.üîΩThe expression ‚Äúall dharmas are unproduced‚Äù means that all dharmas are by nature unproduced in the sense of being absolutely accomplished. Therefore, it is the perfection of the non-production of all dharmas.

original: byed pa po mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad byed pa pos stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad byed pa pos stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe non-apprehension of an agent‚Äù means that all dharmas are empty of an agent.

original: bdag ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag nyid kyis yod par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe 'di chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par 'gyur zhing mthong bas mthong bar 'gyur na de med pas na shes pa po ma mchis
analyzed: bdag ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gal te bdag nyid kyis yod par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe 'di chos thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par 'gyur zhing mthong bas mthong bar 'gyur na de med pas na shes pa po ma mchis
translated: Because there is no self means that if it were not to exist by way of its own nature, then at that time, since it would be the mental consciousness that knows all phenomena and sees all phenomena, it would be the seeing of this, but since it does not exist, there is no knower

original: pa dang mthong ba po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang mthong ba po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and no seer. This is the perfection of the absence of a self.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang mi skye ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag la mi skyed pa ni don dam pa rtog pa tsam du snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang mi skye ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dag la mi skyed pa ni don dam pa rtog pa tsam du snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Death, transmigration, and birth, and the absence of birth means that since the absence of birth is the ultimate, it appears as mere imagination.

original: gang la yang 'ga' zhig tu 'pho ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la yang 'ga' zhig tu 'pho ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no transmigration of anything anywhere.

original: 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de de yang 'jig pa med pa ste gcig gi ngo bo yin @159a * //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de de yang 'jig pa med pa ste gcig gi ngo bo yin @159a * //
translated: The absence of destruction means that since the nature of all phenomena is thusness, and that is also without destruction, it is of the nature of one.

original: pa'i phyir dus kyi dbye bas nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dus kyi dbye bas nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not perceived by the division of time.

original: sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i mtshan ma ni shing bu la sogs pa bkab nas glang po la sogs pa gzugs med pa nyid sgyu ma la snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i mtshan ma ni shing bu la sogs pa bkab nas glang po la sogs pa gzugs med pa nyid sgyu ma la snang ba yin no //
translated: The perfection of illusion is as follows: The sign of illusion is the appearance of an elephant, etc. in an illusion, which is not a form, by covering a stick, etc.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad ma rig pas btang bar byas pa don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog par byas pa'i ngo bo med pas snang zhes ston par byed pa la sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad ma rig pas btang bar byas pa don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog par byas pa'i ngo bo med pas snang zhes ston par byed pa la sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In the same way, all phenomena are made to appear by the nature of ultimate emptiness, which is made into the nature of conceptualization by being released by ignorance. The perfection of illusion teaches this.

original: de lta na yang chos rnams brdzun pa nyid kyis skyes ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang chos rnams brdzun pa nyid kyis skyes ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Even so, it is said that phenomena are not born because of their falsity.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa rnam par shes par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa rnam par shes par bgyid pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The perfection of non-arising is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das rmi lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du mthong ba'i dngos po rnams ni dngos po med par sad pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i bden pa'i don sems dang sems las byung bas bkab nas snang ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rmi lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du mthong ba'i dngos po rnams ni dngos po med par sad pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i bden pa'i don sems dang sems las byung bas bkab nas snang ba yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúThe perfection of dream‚Äù means that the things seen in a dream are not real, but are covered by the mind and mental factors and appear as if they were real.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis bsgribs par byas pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams thams cad bden pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis bsgribs par byas pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, all phenomena are covered by the reality of emptiness and appear as if they were not the nature of non-obstruction.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam du snang ba'i ngo bo 'di rnams la don dam pa cung zad yod pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par shes par bgyid pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam du snang ba'i ngo bo 'di rnams la don dam pa cung zad yod pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni rnam par shes par bgyid pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin order to make known‚Äù is that these appearances, which are the mere appearance of consciousness as emptiness, have no ultimate reality whatsoever.

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang rmi lam dang sgra brnyan dang mig yor dang smig rgyu dang sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'i 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang rmi lam dang sgra brnyan dang mig yor dang smig rgyu dang sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'i 'don pa'o //
translated: In some places, the text reads ‚Äúthis perfection of dream, echo, optical illusion, mirage, and magical creation.‚Äù

original: de la sgra brnyan ni mi bden pa'i sgra yang dag par snang ba'i ngo bo yang dag pa ma yin pa mi bden pa ma yin pa'i sgra nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: de la sgra brnyan ni mi bden pa'i sgra yang dag par snang ba'i ngo bo yang dag pa ma yin pa mi bden pa ma yin pa'i sgra nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: The echo is the manifestation of an unreal sound, which is not a real sound, but appears as a real sound.

original: mig yor ni dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi bden pa'i don yul la sogs pa bkab nas mi bden pa'i grong khyer la sogs pa nye bar ston par byed do //üîΩsmig rgyu ni yang dag pa ji lta bar rang gi ngo bo nye bar ma bstan pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chu bstan par byed pa de bzhin du chos thams cad ni don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su btang nas bden
analyzed: mig yor ni dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi bden pa'i don yul la sogs pa bkab nas mi bden pa'i grong khyer la sogs pa nye bar ston par byed do // smig rgyu ni yang dag pa ji lta bar rang gi ngo bo nye bar ma bstan pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chu bstan par byed pa de bzhin du chos thams cad ni don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su btang nas bden
translated: The optical illusion is the manifestation of an unreal city, etc., which is not a real city, etc., but appears as a real city, etc., by concealing the object, etc., which is not a real object, etc., in the form of a Gandharva city, etc.üîΩThe mirage is the manifestation of unreal water, which is not real water, because it does not manifest its own nature as it really is.

original: pa ma yin pa kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis snang zhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo dag gis snang zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, all dharmas should be understood as appearing with an unreal imagined and other-dependent nature, having abandoned the nature of ultimate emptiness.

original: 'don pa 'di yang chen mo rnams kyi 'gres yang dag par bsdus nas /
analyzed: 'don pa 'di yang chen mo rnams kyi 'gres yang dag par bsdus nas /
translated: This verse is also a summary of the great commentaries.

original: mngon rtogs sbyar @159b ba'i don du bsnan pa zhes bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la drang srong gi ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon rtogs sbyar @159b ba'i don du bsnan pa zhes bcom ldan 'das ma 'di la drang srong gi ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The Blessed Lady is not the mother of sages, because she is added for the sake of applying the realization.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rang bzhin nyid kyis chos rnams dag pa ste de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams med pa de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rang bzhin nyid kyis chos rnams dag pa ste de bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams med pa de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: As for defilement, since phenomena are pure by nature, therefore, since there is no attachment, etc., it is the perfection of non-defilement.

original: de bzhin du rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa dang nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: Similarly, in the recitation perfection of non-purification, non-apprehension, it is the perfection of non-apprehension of attachment, etc., and afflictions.

original: rnam par byang ba nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste rten no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste rten no //
translated: Non-apprehension is the basis of purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i sems can nyon mongs pa can rten te de rnams sems can la ma dmigs pas rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i sems can nyon mongs pa can rten te de rnams sems can la ma dmigs pas rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: The afflicted beings to be purified are the basis, and since they are not apprehended as sentient beings, there is no purification.

original: gos pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la gos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la gos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnstained‚Äù means that, like space, it is unstained by the realm of phenomena.

original: spros pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spros pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFree from conceptual elaboration‚Äù means

original: spros pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams te de rnams med pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams te de rnams med pa'o //
translated: that conceptual elaboration is conceptualization, and that is absent.

original: rlom sems thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: rlom sems thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from all mental activity‚Äù means that mental activity is the perception of form, etc.

original: rlom sems ni 'don pa ma yin te de bas na rlom sems thams cad las 'das pas so //
analyzed: rlom sems ni 'don pa ma yin te de bas na rlom sems thams cad las 'das pas so //
translated: It is not mental activity, and so it is free from all mental activity.

original: g-yo ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gang zhig g-yo bar byed pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis gang zhig g-yo bar byed pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from movement‚Äù means that there is no movement by any conceptualization or afflictive emotion.

original: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su ltung ba med pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su ltung ba med pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: ‚ÄúImmovable‚Äù means that it is not subject to falling away,

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi dbyings dus thams cad du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad kyi dbyings dus thams cad du gnas pa'o //
translated: because the realm of phenomena is present at all times.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúFree from desire‚Äù meansüîΩthat it is free from the desire for the three realms.

original: 'dod chags ni log pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba chos rnams la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni log pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba chos rnams la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment arises from false imagination and is the strong desire for things.

original: de med pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, the perfection of freedom from attachment is taught.

original: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log ba de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The reality of all things is called the undistorted thusness.

original: chos thams cad kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The undistorted reality of all things is the reality of emptiness.

original: der chags par bya ba'i dngos po'i mtshan ma rtag pa dang gtsang ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams la med pa nyid do //üîΩchos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis yang dag par ldang ba ste de med pa'i phyir ldang ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: der chags par bya ba'i dngos po'i mtshan ma rtag pa dang gtsang ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams la med pa nyid do // chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis yang dag par ldang ba ste de med pa'i phyir ldang ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The signs of things that are the bases of attachment, such as permanence, purity, and so on, do not exist.üîΩAll things are said to be nonconceptual because all things arise through the power of conceptualization. Since that does not exist, they do not arise.

original: chos thams cad nges par @160a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par @160a * //
translated: All things are said to be nonarisen and unceasing because they are not established by their own nature.

original: 'byed pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gis chos thams cad don dam pa'i ngo bos rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du don rtogs pas ji lta ba bzhin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //üîΩchos thams cad kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mtshan ma thams cad chos kyi snang ba rnams la mi dmigs pa'i phyir spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba mngon sum du byas pas chos thams cad zhi ba zhes byas ba'i shes
analyzed: 'byed pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gis chos thams cad don dam pa'i ngo bos rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin du don rtogs pas ji lta ba bzhin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mtshan ma thams cad chos kyi snang ba rnams la mi dmigs pa'i phyir spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba mngon sum du byas pas chos thams cad zhi ba zhes byas ba'i shes
translated: For the sake of differentiation means that when one realizes all dharmas by way of the nature of the ultimate, then, by realizing the meaning as it is, one has the perfection of the meaning as it is.

original: rab nye bar gnas pa de'i phyir zhi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rab nye bar gnas pa de'i phyir zhi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the signs of all dharmas means that, by directly realizing the pacification of all conceptual elaborations, one does not apprehend the signs of all dharmas, the appearances of dharmas, and therefore the knowledge called the pacification of all dharmas is present. For that reason, it is the perfection of pacification.

original: yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes byas ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zad pa ni yon tan no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes byas ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zad pa ni yon tan no //
translated: The perfection of qualities means that the exhaustion of attachment, aversion, and delusion is a quality.

original: de'i dbang gis skyon ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis skyon ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By virtue of that, it is the perfection of no fault, because there is no sign of attachment, aversion, or delusion.

original: nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yongs su rtog pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtogs par byas pa'i ngo bo med pa nyid la brten nas nyon mongs pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med pa'i
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yongs su rtog pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtogs par byas pa'i ngo bo med pa nyid la brten nas nyon mongs pa ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med pa'i
translated: This perfection of no affliction is called ‚Äúno conceptualization,‚Äù because, based on the non-entityness that is conceptualized, affliction does not arise, and so on, because there is no suffering.

original: phyir ro // yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // yang dag pa'i mtha' ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The limit of reality is the seeing of the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba'i rtsa ba can sems can gyi mngon par zhe na pa spong ba yin pa de'i phyir sems can ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba'i rtsa ba can sems can gyi mngon par zhe na pa spong ba yin pa de'i phyir sems can ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Since it abandons the manifest clinging to sentient beings that has the view of the transitory collection as its root, it is the perfection of no sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad ldang ba ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni tshad ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i dbang gis chos thams cad gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ldang ba ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni tshad ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i dbang gis chos thams cad gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The establishment of all phenomena is by means of valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir 'di chos thams cad kyi tshad mas ldang ba ni rgyu mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di chos thams cad kyi tshad mas ldang ba ni rgyu mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: Because this is the valid cognition of all phenomena, it is not established by seeing causes.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma mchis pa ldang ba ma mchis zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang ldang ba'i yang dag par ldang ba med pa zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma mchis pa ldang ba ma mchis zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang ldang ba'i yang dag par ldang ba med pa zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in the recitation ‚Äúimmeasurable, non-established,‚Äù one should understand ‚Äúnon-established, non-arisen.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the perfection of the way things are, because of the absence of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ji lta ba bzhin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rjes la skyes pa'i ye shes la brdzun pa'i snang ba tsam 'dir ji lta ba bzhin te
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du ji lta ba bzhin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rjes la skyes pa'i ye shes la brdzun pa'i snang ba tsam 'dir ji lta ba bzhin te
translated: In all phenomena, supramundane and subsequently attained wisdom are merely false appearances.

original: brdzun pa nyid la ji lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa nyid la ji lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the wisdom of the way things are in falsity.

original: sngar ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rtogs pa la ltos pas ji lta ba bzhin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa de bas na de las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes la don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo rtogs pa la ltos pas ji lta ba bzhin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa de bas na de las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Previously, it was said that the perfection of the way things really are is based on the realization of the nature of ultimate emptiness in supramundane wisdom. Therefore, it is different from that.

original: @160b rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i don dam pa'i ye shes la chos rnams kyi ngo bo 'di snang ba med pa de bas na brdzun par snang ba'i ngo bo nyid 'di don ji
analyzed: @160b rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i don dam pa'i ye shes la chos rnams kyi ngo bo 'di snang ba med pa de bas na brdzun par snang ba'i ngo bo nyid 'di don ji
translated: Because of the absence of conceptual thought, because of the non-appearance of the nature of things in non-conceptual ultimate wisdom, therefore, this nature which appears as false is not the way things really are.

original: lta ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the way things really are.

original: kha cig ni 'di 'don pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di 'don pa ma yin no //
translated: Some do not recite this.

original: chos thams cad mngon par ma zhen pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i cho rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa de bas na de rnams mngon par zhen par mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par ma zhen pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i cho rnams ni yod pa ma yin pa de bas na de rnams mngon par zhen par mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Because of the non-attachment to all phenomena, because forms and so on do not exist, therefore it is not suitable to be attached to them.

original: de bzhin du cho thams cad ni med pa zhes rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba de'i phyir mtha' gnyis dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du cho thams cad ni med pa zhes rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba de'i phyir mtha' gnyis dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Similarly, all dharmas are non-existent, free from the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism. Therefore, it is the perfection that does not follow the two extremes.

original: chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad phan tshun du tha dad pa ni sred pa'i ngo bor song ba ma yin te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad phan tshun du tha dad pa ni sred pa'i ngo bor song ba ma yin te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All dharmas are indivisible means that all dharmas are not essentially different from each other, because they do not exist.

original: de bas na tha mi dad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na tha mi dad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the perfection of non-difference.

original: mchog tu mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Not grasping the highest means being free from afflictions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gcig pur ma zad kyi 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gcig pur ma zad kyi 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: Not only afflictions, but also worldly fruits.

original: 'on kyang byang chub gzhan yang dag par bsdus pa rnams kyis kyang ste theg pa dman pa la mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub gzhan yang dag par bsdus pa rnams kyis kyang ste theg pa dman pa la mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, it is also not by the accumulations of other enlightenments, because it does not desire the lower vehicle.

original: 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the perfection of non-discrimination.

original: rtog pa ni khyad par gyi gnas skabs 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni khyad par gyi gnas skabs 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the apprehension of a particular state.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid spyi dang ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid spyi dang ro gcig pa'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady is of the same taste as the universal characteristic of emptiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhi ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pacification of conceptualization is the non-apprehension of conceptualization.üîΩThis is the perfection of the immeasurable, because the reality of phenomena is immeasurable.

original: chos nyid tshad ma mchis pa nyid kyi slad du 'di ni gzhal du ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshad ma ni yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ste gcig dang gnyis dang gsum zhes dmigs pa ma yin te med pa'i
analyzed: chos nyid tshad ma mchis pa nyid kyi slad du 'di ni gzhal du ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshad ma ni yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ste gcig dang gnyis dang gsum zhes dmigs pa ma yin te med pa'i
translated: Because measure is the cause of determination, such as one, two, three, etc., it is not apprehended, because it does not exist.

original: phyir ro // de'i phyir gzhal du ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ro // de'i phyir gzhal du ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is immeasurable.

original: gnas 'di la po ti rnying pa rnams la drang srong gi 'don pa 'di mthong ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas 'di la po ti rnying pa rnams la drang srong gi 'don pa 'di mthong ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, in the old editions, this verse of the sage is seen and explained.

original: 'don pa gzhan de ma thag tu bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'don pa gzhan de ma thag tu bstan par bya'o //
translated: The other recitation should be taught immediately.

original: chos nyid bdag ma mchis pa'i slad du skye ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams bdag dang bdag gi ba nyid kyi gnas skabs de la mi 'dzin pa de bas na @161a * //
analyzed: chos nyid bdag ma mchis pa'i slad du skye ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams bdag dang bdag gi ba nyid kyi gnas skabs de la mi 'dzin pa de bas na @161a * //
translated: The perfection of non-arising is called thus because of the non-existence of self in reality. Because one does not apprehend form etc. in the situation of self and being of self,

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams skye ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams skye ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: the dharmas of defilement which arise from the notional attachment to self do not arise.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rnam par rtog pa zhi ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid de rnam par rtog pa zhi ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-discrimination is called thus because of the non-discrimination of all dharmas. Because of the pacification of discrimination, means: because of the non-apprehension of discrimination.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi slad du mi dmigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di chos rnams kyi kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi slad du mi dmigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di chos rnams kyi kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni don dam par yod pa ma yin te de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-apprehension is called such because of the nature of phenomena. That which is the imagined and dependent natures of phenomena does not exist ultimately, and therefore is non-apprehended.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin ni yongs grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin ni yongs grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of phenomena is the perfected nature, and that also does not exist ultimately.

original: chos thams cad chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni chags pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni chags pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of non-attachment because of the non-attachment of all phenomena.

original: rten mi dmigs pa'i slad du rten ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la rten ni rten no //
analyzed: rten mi dmigs pa'i slad du rten ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la rten ni rten no //
translated: The perfection of non-support is called such because of the non-apprehension of support. Support is a basis.

original: de gal te bcom ldan 'das ma la yod par gyur na khyab par byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gal te bcom ldan 'das ma la yod par gyur na khyab par byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to exist in the Blessed Lady, it would be a pervader that does not exist.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the non-arising of all phenomena.

original: chos rnams thams cad ni don dam par ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ni don dam par ma skyes pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are ultimately non-arisen.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das ma skyes pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das ma skyes pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, it is unborn,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos mi skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos mi skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the nature of not producing afflicted phenomena.

original: de lta na ni spyod pa skyed pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni spyod pa skyed pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: In that case, it is the special quality called ‚Äúnot producing activity.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the perfection of impermanence because all phenomena are unconditioned.üîΩBecause all phenomena are produced, therefore they are not conditioned by causes and conditions.

original: chos thams cad 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du 'di ni mi rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad skyed pa de bas na rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus ma byas pa de'i phyir yod pa ma yin te med paüîΩnyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du 'di ni mi rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad skyed pa de bas na rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus ma byas pa de'i phyir yod pa ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they do not exist, and because they do not exist, they are impermanent.

original: med pa'i don ni mi rtag don zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: med pa'i don ni mi rtag don zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The meaning of nonexistence is the meaning of impermanence, as stated by the phrase ‚Äúthe meaning of nonexistence is the meaning of impermanence.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i slad du 'di ni sdug bsngal ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir nges par bya ba'i don dang gnas par bya ba'i don dang nye bar
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i slad du 'di ni sdug bsngal ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir nges par bya ba'i don dang gnas par bya ba'i don dang nye bar
translated: This is the perfection of suffering because the Bhagavatƒ´ is equal to space.üîΩThe meaning of this is that the Bhagavatƒ´ is not suitable as the object of ascertainment, the object of abiding, and the object of enjoyment, because she is the nature of phenomena.

original: longs spyod pa'i don du chos kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi rung ba de'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i don du chos kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir mi rung ba de'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, she is suffering.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are not observed.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are empty.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are empty.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are empty.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du 'di ni stong pa'i slad du 'di ni stong pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di chos thams cad gzugs su bya ba dang nyams su myong ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzugs dang tshor ba
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i slad du 'di ni stong pa'i slad du 'di ni stong pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di chos thams cad gzugs su bya ba dang nyams su myong ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo gzugs dang tshor ba
translated: This is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are empty.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are empty.üîΩThis is the perfection of emptiness because original: la sogs pa rnams @161b de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin te de'i phyir de'i ngo bos stong pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa rnams @161b de dag don dam par yod pa ma yin te de'i phyir de'i ngo bos stong pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of emptiness because all phenomena are empty.üîΩThis is the

original: chos thams cad mngon par ma chags pa'i slad du 'di ni bdag ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de rnams mngon par zhen pa'i don du mi rung
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par ma chags pa'i slad du 'di ni bdag ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de rnams mngon par zhen pa'i don du mi rung
translated: This is the perfection of non-self, because all dharmas are non-attached. This is the perfection of non-self, because form, etc., dharmas do not exist. Therefore, they are not suitable as objects of attachment.

original: ba'o // de ltar chos thams cad med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: ba'o // de ltar chos thams cad med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'o //
translated: Thus, all dharmas are said to be non-existent, which is non-self.

original: gal te yang stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa dag la don la tha dad pa med kyang de lta na yang rtog pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: gal te yang stong pa nyid dang bdag med pa dag la don la tha dad pa med kyang de lta na yang rtog pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa yod do //
translated: Even though emptiness and non-self are not different in meaning, still, by the power of conceptualization, there is a difference.

original: stong pa nyid dang gzhan gyis gzhan la bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang gzhan gyis gzhan la bral ba nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is the separation of one thing from another.

original: dper na chu dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir bum pa stong pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dper na chu dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir bum pa stong pa zhes brjod do //
translated: For example, because of being separated from water, a pot is said to be empty.

original: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir chos rnams de nyid stong pa zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir chos rnams de nyid stong pa zhes yongs su rtog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of being separated from the nature of its own characteristics, etc., dharmas are imagined to be empty of that suchness.

original: chos rnams kyi bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid de ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid de ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The so-called selflessness of phenomena is just non-existence, like the so-called illusory elephant, etc.

original: chos rnams de nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang bral ba brjod par 'dod pas stong pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams de nyid ni rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa dang bral ba brjod par 'dod pas stong pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The reality of phenomena is free from its own characteristics, etc., and is called emptiness by the one who wishes to express it.

original: yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba med pa brjod par 'dod pa la bdag med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin na zhes bya ba med pa brjod par 'dod pa la bdag med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: When it does not exist, he calls it selflessness, wishing to express non-existence.

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid mtshan ma ste gang gi phyir de med pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid mtshan ma ste gang gi phyir de med pa de'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Signless means signless, because it is the absence of that.

original: chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par rgyu dang rkyen gyis skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par rgyu dang rkyen gyis skyes pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are unproduced, because they are not produced ultimately by causes and conditions.

original: mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa'i slad du gzhal du ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa'i slad du gzhal du ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of the immeasurable is called the perfection of the infinite, because of the infinity of the ultimate.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ni chos nyid kyi ngo bo ste nam mkha' ltar khyab pa de'i phyir mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ni chos nyid kyi ngo bo ste nam mkha' ltar khyab pa de'i phyir mtha' yas mu ma mchis pa'o //
translated: The Transcendent Lord is the nature of reality, which is all-pervading like space. Therefore, he is infinite and boundless.

original: de bas na rgyang grags dang dpag tshad la sogs pa'i tshad rnams kyis yongs su gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyang grags dang dpag tshad la sogs pa'i tshad rnams kyis yongs su gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir gzhal du ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is immeasurable, because he cannot be measured by any measure such as a league or a yojana.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa bcu ye shes kyi spyod yul de rnams la spyod yul med par gyur pa'i rnam par yod pa'oüîΩ// gang gi phyir rnam pa de rnams don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir stobs bcu'i yul rnam pa rnams la med @162a * //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad dang gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa bcu ye shes kyi spyod yul de rnams la spyod yul med par gyur pa'i rnam par yod pa'o // gang gi phyir rnam pa de rnams don dam par yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir stobs bcu'i yul rnam pa rnams la med @162a * //
translated: The perfection of the powers is the sphere of the ten powers of knowledge, such as the knowledge of all the aspects and the possible and impossible in regard to all things. It is the existence of the non-existence of those aspects in the sphere of those powers.

original: par ston par byed pa ni stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: par ston par byed pa ni stobs bcu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Because those aspects do not exist ultimately, therefore, the perfection of the ten powers is the teaching of the non-existence of the aspects in the sphere of the ten powers.

original: mi brdzi ba zhes bya ba ni de ni stobs kyi don to //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba zhes bya ba ni de ni stobs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of power is that it is not overcome.

original: shin tu ma zhum pa'i slad du 'di ni mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid chos 'ga' zhig la brlan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu ma zhum pa'i slad du 'di ni mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid chos 'ga' zhig la brlan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of not being at all fainthearted, it is called the perfection of fearlessness. This is the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattvas, which is not fainthearted about any phenomenon.

original: de bas na thams cad du ma zhum pa'i ngo bo nyid lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid de ni mi 'jigs pa'i don de'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du ma zhum pa'i ngo bo nyid lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid de ni mi 'jigs pa'i don de'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, which is by nature not fainthearted in any respect, is the perfection of fearlessness, because of its meaning of fearlessness.

original: gang zhig yang lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs la 'ga' zhig tu sangs rgyas kyi chos ston pa de lam gyi rnam pa de shes pa nyid la yang de'i yon tan rjes su 'gro ba yang dag par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang zhig yang lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs la 'ga' zhig tu sangs rgyas kyi chos ston pa de lam gyi rnam pa de shes pa nyid la yang de'i yon tan rjes su 'gro ba yang dag par 'byung bas so //
translated: Moreover, in the context of the knowledge of the path, when the Buddha teaches the path, the knowledge of the aspects of the path is also the arising of the qualities that follow from it.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of all the qualities of the Buddha is called the perfection of wisdom, because it is the transcendence of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang gi phyir nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la med pa de bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la med pa de bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: Because they do not exist for the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., therefore they are the own-being of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: grangs kyi sbyor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i bsam pa ni grangs te de dang sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi sbyor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i bsam pa ni grangs te de dang sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: Because of the transcendence of the application of number, means that number is the intention of similarity, and application is the application with that.

original: de las yang dag par 'da' ba nyid ni de dang 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de las yang dag par 'da' ba nyid ni de dang 'da' ba'o //
translated: The transcendence of that is the transcendence of that.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa yang dag par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the unshared qualities of the Buddha do not arise for the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: The perfection of all the qualities of the Buddha is mentioned by some.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la de lta bur gyur pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la de lta bur gyur pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: The explanation is that because all the Buddhas have the distinction of that kind of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos ji lta ba de ltar brjod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni chos ji lta ba de ltar brjod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the Tathagata is so called because the Tathagata is so called because he has expressed things as they are in reality.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos thams cad rtogs pa dang gsal ba'i don dmigs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i chos thams cad rtogs pa dang gsal ba'i don dmigs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is so called because it is the realization and the manifestation of all things in their non-erroneous nature, and because it has the object of the ultimate.

original: 'di'i rgyu ni chos thams cad ma log pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu ni chos thams cad ma log pa ste /
translated: Its cause is the non-erroneous nature of all things.

original: de yang don dam par chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa chos kyi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don dam par chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa chos kyi bstan pa'o //
translated: And that is the teaching of the Dharma, which is the nature of all things in the ultimate sense and which is in conformity with that cause.üîΩThis is the perfection of self-originatedness, because all things are non-substantial.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni rang 'byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de chos thams cad rang nyid kyis zil gyis gnon pa de'i phyir rang 'byung gi pha rol @162b tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du 'di ni rang 'byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de chos thams cad rang nyid kyis zil gyis gnon pa de'i phyir rang 'byung gi pha rol @162b tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Because he has overcome all things by himself, therefore it is the perfection of self-originatedness.

original: ji ltar gnon zhe na chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnon zhe na chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How does he overcome them? He says: because all things are non-substantial.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pas rtogs pa de bas na de rnams zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pas rtogs pa de bas na de rnams zil gyis gnon pa yin no //
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic reality, they are realized. Therefore, they are surpassed.

original: chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa ma lus pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa ma lus pa'i rang bzhin yongs su shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge of all phenomena is omniscience through the complete understanding of the nature of all conventional and ultimate [phenomena].

original: de'i ye shes ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: That knowledge is not shared [by others].

original: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar zhe na rgyu gsungs pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhig de rnam pa thams cad
analyzed: de ni pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar zhe na rgyu gsungs pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhig de rnam pa thams cad
translated: How is that a perfection? The reason is stated: due to the complete understanding of the nature of all phenomena in all aspects. The nature of all phenomena is completely understood in all aspects.

original: kyis yongs su shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: kyis yongs su shes pa nyid do //
translated: That is the complete understanding itself.

original: de la kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams la kun rdzob pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams la ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gdod ma nas zhi ba la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams la kun rdzob pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyi yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i chos rnams la ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gdod ma nas zhi ba la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The conventional knowledge of all aspects of the imagined nature of phenomena and the knowledge of the unproduced, unceased, primordially peaceful, and so on, of the perfected nature of phenomena.

original: gnas 'di la sngon gyi po ti rnams las thams cad du ngag gcig pa nyid kyis tshig 'di rnams gnas pa de kho na bzhin du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas 'di la sngon gyi po ti rnams las thams cad du ngag gcig pa nyid kyis tshig 'di rnams gnas pa de kho na bzhin du bshad pa'o //
translated: In this context, since all the old editions of the text are identical in their reading, I have explained the passage in accordance with that reading.

original: gzhan dag ni tshig rnam pa mang po phyin ci log tu 'don pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshig rnam pa mang po phyin ci log tu 'don pa ste /
translated: Others have recited the passage with many different words.

original: der lhag pa phyin ci log tu 'don pa phal cher bshad pa'o //
analyzed: der lhag pa phyin ci log tu 'don pa phal cher bshad pa'o //
translated: I have explained the passage in accordance with the most common misreading.

original: lhag ma ni 'chad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'chad par bya ba ste /
translated: The rest of the passage is to be explained as follows.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas mu med pa zhes bya
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni nang stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtha' yas mu med pa zhes bya
translated: The phrase ‚Äúperfection of all emptinesses‚Äù refers to the perfection of inner emptiness, up to and including the perfection of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: ba'o // gang gi phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug la dus gsum du rgyas par yongs su gcod pa med par stong pa nyid thams cad la de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'o // gang gi phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug la dus gsum du rgyas par yongs su gcod pa med par stong pa nyid thams cad la de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the sixteen aspects of emptiness are not differentiated in the three times, all emptinesses are of one taste with that.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa tshogs bdun gcig tu rnam par 'byed pa ni sum cu rtsa bdun yin te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa tshogs bdun gcig tu rnam par 'byed pa ni sum cu rtsa bdun yin te /
translated: The seven groups beginning with the applications of mindfulness are distinguished as thirty-seven.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas re rer de'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid du yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas re rer de'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas ji srid du yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Among them, each one is a perfection that has the aspect of that application of mindfulness of the body, up to and including the perfection of correct meditative absorption.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya bas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bshad pa'o //üîΩrnam par thar pa brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs @163a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa zhes bya bas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bshad pa'o // rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs @163a * //
translated: The three doors of liberation are called emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The perfection of the eight deliverances is the first deliverance, which is the internal perception of form while seeing external forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second deliverance is the internal non-perception of form while seeing external forms.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa lus kyis mngon sum du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The third deliverance is the abiding in the realization and completion of the deliverance of beauty with the body.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba dgu'o /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa bzhi dang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba dgu'o /
translated: The perfection of the nine serial absorptions is the four dhyanas, the four formless states, and the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of the four noble truths. The four noble truths are called suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The ten perfections are

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus /
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus /
translated: generosity, morality, patience, diligence,üîΩmeditative concentration, wisdom, skillful means,

original: bsam gtan shes rab thabs nyid dang // smon lam stobs dang ye shes ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab thabs nyid dang // smon lam stobs dang ye shes ni //
translated: aspiration, strength, and knowledge.

original: 'di rnams pha rol phyin bcu'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams pha rol phyin bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten perfections.

original: 'di ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhas bya ba ni chos dang don dang nges tshig dang spobs pa ste so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhas bya ba ni chos dang don dang nges tshig dang spobs pa ste so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of the correct understandings. The four correct understandings are of the Dharma, meaning, etymological interpretation, and eloquence.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang yin la ma 'dres pa yang yin te gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang yin la ma 'dres pa yang yin te gzhan rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa
translated: The unshared qualities of a buddha are the qualities of a buddha and they are also unshared because they are not held in common with others.

original: rnams so // thams cad kyang de yin la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnams so // thams cad kyang de yin la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are all the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: 'khrul pa dang / ca co dang / dran pa bsnyel ba med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang /
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang / ca co dang / dran pa bsnyel ba med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang /
translated: The three perfections of being without error, without babbling and without forgetfulness, the three perfections of being without a mind that is not in equipoise, without a different kind of perception and without a non-analytical indifference,

original: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba rnams la nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba rnams la nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: The six perfections are: aspiration, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, and the absence of degeneration in liberation.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang zhes bya ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / dus gsum po thams cad la ma chags pa dang ma thogs pa'i ye shes kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa @163b gsum ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang zhes bya ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / dus gsum po thams cad la ma chags pa dang ma thogs pa'i ye shes kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa @163b gsum ste /
translated: The three perfections are: all the actions of body, speech, and mind are preceded by knowledge and follow after knowledge; and the engagement of knowledge is unobstructed and unimpeded in all three times.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are the perfections of the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.

original: grangs kyi sbyor ba las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i bsam pa ni 'grang ba ste de dang sbyor ba ni sbyar pa'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi sbyor ba las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i bsam pa ni 'grang ba ste de dang sbyor ba ni sbyar pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Transcending all enumerations‚Äù means that the mind that is similar to enumeration is an enumeration, and the application to that is an application.

original: de las yang dag par 'da' ba ni de las 'da' ba de yang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las yang dag par 'da' ba ni de las 'da' ba de yang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase to transcend it means to transcend that. The meaning of unmixed is that.

original: 'don pa 'di yang chen mo rnams kyi 'don pa las mdor bsdus nas mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du byas pa ste de yang sngon gyi po ti rnams la mi srid pa drang srong gi ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'don pa 'di yang chen mo rnams kyi 'don pa las mdor bsdus nas mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du byas pa ste de yang sngon gyi po ti rnams la mi srid pa drang srong gi ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: This recitation is made for the sake of condensing the recitation of the great ones and applying it to the clear realizations. Moreover, in the previous texts, it is impossible that it is not the sage's.

original: drang srong gi ma yin pa'i brjod pa mdor bsdus pa nyid du legs par shes so //
analyzed: drang srong gi ma yin pa'i brjod pa mdor bsdus pa nyid du legs par shes so //
translated: It is well known that the sage's non-expression is concise.

original: mdo 'di la stong pa nyid bcu drug blo nas 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di la stong pa nyid bcu drug blo nas 'don pa'o //
translated: In this sutra, the sixteen emptinesses are recited from memory.

original: dbye ba rnam pa bcu drug ni //
analyzed: dbye ba rnam pa bcu drug ni //
translated: The sixteen divisions

original: rim pa ji ltar stong nyid la /
analyzed: rim pa ji ltar stong nyid la /
translated: are in the order of the emptinesses.

original: brgyad stong pa las de bstan pa /
analyzed: brgyad stong pa las de bstan pa /
translated: They are taught in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines.

original: bstan pa gzhan du 'ang shes par bya //
analyzed: bstan pa gzhan du 'ang shes par bya //
translated: They should be known from other teachings as well.

original: zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas so //
translated: This is the statement of Master Dignaga.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bstan pa yang mdo 'di mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bstan pa yang mdo 'di mthong ba yin te /
translated: The teaching by the six perfections is also seen in this sutra.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni gang du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni gang du yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ten perfections are not anywhere. This is called ‚Äúunconnected.‚Äù

original: mtha' yas pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di rnams kyis bstod pa yin pa de bas na bstod pa'i mtha'i le'u ste le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di rnams kyis bstod pa yin pa de bas na bstod pa'i mtha'i le'u ste le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: These aspects beginning with ‚Äúinfinite‚Äù are the praise, therefore it is the ninth chapter, the chapter on praise.

original: // / da ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma'i thos pa la sogs pa la rim pa bsam par byed cing zhes bstan par byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / da ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma'i thos pa la sogs pa la rim pa bsam par byed cing zhes bstan par byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to contemplate the stages of hearing and so forth of the Bhagavatƒ´, which are extremely difficult to obtain, it is taught: ‚ÄúThen, the venerable ≈öƒÅriputra‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi brgyud pa la thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la byas par 'gyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi brgyud pa la thog ma med pa nyid kyi phyir sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la byas par 'gyur ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: ‚ÄúHaving served the Victors of the past‚Äù means that because the lineage of the Perfectly Awakened Ones is beginningless, the service performed to the past Buddhas is the perfection of wisdom.

original: thos pa des na da ltar byung ba nyid de rnams kyi thos pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa des na da ltar byung ba nyid de rnams kyi thos pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of that hearing, they are now hearers, etc.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zhin pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zhin pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: The reading of some is: having planted wholesome roots with many buddhas, and being assisted by spiritual friends.

original: lta ci smos te zhes bya ba ni lam du snang ba yang re zhig mang bar rlom sems su byed do //
analyzed: lta ci smos te zhes bya ba ni lam du snang ba yang re zhig mang bar rlom sems su byed do //
translated: How much more so for those who are on the path of vision! He is conceited even about the appearance of the path.

original: de bzhin nyid du slob pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du slob pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: Training in suchness refers to serenity.

original: de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
translated: Accomplishing suchness refers to transcendent insight.

original: rnal 'byor du byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dag gis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du byed pa zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga dag gis so //
translated: Engaging in yoga refers to both.

original: @164a * // ngan ngon tsam dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @164a * // ngan ngon tsam dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They will not be lacking in the mere essentials.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dri ba la sogs pa dang bral ba nyung ba ste rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rna lam du snang ba tsam gyi 'bras
