analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dri ba la sogs pa dang bral ba nyung ba ste rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rten yin pa'i phyir dang rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rna lam du snang ba tsam gyi 'bras
translated: The perfection of wisdom is rare because it is the support of perfect buddhahood and because it is the result of merely hearing the perfection of wisdom that is concordant with oneself.

original: bu nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ba khyad par du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don sgrub pa'i 'bras bu can zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩsangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bu nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dri ba khyad par du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don sgrub pa'i 'bras bu can zhes gsungs pa ni / sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The special question of the perfection of wisdom is said to be the result of accomplishing the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩHaving planted roots of virtue with many buddhas means

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur bya ba 'di la yod pas zhes bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur bya ba 'di la yod pas zhes bsdu ba'o //
translated: having served many buddhas.

original: yongs su zhus shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su zhus shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having asked questions means

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid ji ltar zhes rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis yongs su dris par byas par byas pa de'i 'thad pa gtong bas yongs su zhus par byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid ji ltar zhes rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis yongs su dris par byas par byas pa de'i 'thad pa gtong bas yongs su zhus par byas pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is asked about in terms of its mere nature, with the question ‚ÄúWhat is the defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: the tshom gyi gnas thams cad zhus pa lan gyi sgo nas yongs su dris par byas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag go //
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnas thams cad zhus pa lan gyi sgo nas yongs su dris par byas pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag go //
translated: The question is asked by the one who is ready to give the answer.

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba dang klog pa dang kun chub par byed pa dang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas de dang mi skrag pa la sogs pas da ltar byung ba'i skye ba la yang dag par byung ba'i 'bras bus
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang 'chang ba dang klog pa dang kun chub par byed pa dang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas de dang mi skrag pa la sogs pas da ltar byung ba'i skye ba la yang dag par byung ba'i 'bras bus
translated: ‚ÄúOne should know‚Äù means that by upholding, holding, reading, mastering, and properly paying attention to it, one should not be afraid and so forth. The result that arises in the present life is

original: skye pa gzhan du byas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pas rnag gi rgyu'i phun sum tshogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye pa gzhan du byas pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur bya ba la sogs pas rnag gi rgyu'i phun sum tshogs pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the perfection of the cause in other lives, by serving the buddhas and so forth.

original: 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach this, he declares, ‚ÄúThen, the Lord said to Subh≈´ti, etc.‚Äù

original: gang rnam pa ji ltar bshad pa'i rgyu de dang phyin ci log pa'i rgyu yang dag par blangs pa de rnams spong bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gang rnam pa ji ltar bshad pa'i rgyu de dang phyin ci log pa'i rgyu yang dag par blangs pa de rnams spong bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThose causes, as they have been explained, and the causes of error, are taken up and abandoned.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das yang gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, those who, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dun pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung dang don la nyan par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung dang don la nyan par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLacking aspiration, etc.‚Äù means that they do not desire the text and the meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs declaration,

original: dad pa ni yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni yid ches pa'o //
translated: faith is confidence.

original: srid pa ni gtong ba'i phyir 'dod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni gtong ba'i phyir 'dod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since existence is given up, it is not desired.

original: dang ba ni sems la the tshom la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams kyi rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dang ba ni sems la the tshom la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams kyi rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: Clarity is the absence of turbidity in the mind due to the stains of doubt, etc.

original: gzod pa ni gzung bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gzod pa ni gzung bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the desire to accept.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la spro ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la spro ba skyed pa'o //
translated: Exertion is the generation of enthusiasm for virtue.

original: bag mchis pa @164b ni bar chad byed pa le lo la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni bag mchis pa'o //
analyzed: bag mchis pa @164b ni bar chad byed pa le lo la sogs pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni bag mchis pa'o //
translated: Conscientiousness is the antidote to laziness, etc., which are obstacles.

original: mos pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshig rnams kyis nges par byas pa'i dngos po la de de bzhin zhes rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshig rnams kyis nges par byas pa'i dngos po la de de bzhin zhes rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Interest is the holding to the fact that what has been ascertained by means of direct perception, inference, and scriptural authority is just as it is.

original: de la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gang zhi 'di la mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de la ngo mtshar ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gang zhi 'di la mos par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: What is so amazing about that? is connected with who has interest in this.

original: de ltar 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, in this...

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag la phan tshun du rgyu nyid du rnam par nges pas 'di la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag la phan tshun du rgyu nyid du rnam par nges pas 'di la phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus refers to the certainty of the reciprocal causality of the perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of all aspects. The meaning of I pay homage to that is the same as before.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa'i rjes la brgya byin gyis sgrub pa nyan pa po rnams la spro pa bskyed pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa'i rjes la brgya byin gyis sgrub pa nyan pa po rnams la spro pa bskyed pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: After the Blessed One's teaching, ≈öakra spoke to encourage the listeners, saying:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then, etc.üîΩBy the power of the Buddha, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na de lta bu'i zab pa'i chos nyid kyi nye bar bstan pa'i bsam pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs la mi gnas pa de ltar na gzugs so zhes mi gnas pa de ltar na gzugs la rnal 'byorüîΩdu byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na de lta bu'i zab pa'i chos nyid kyi nye bar bstan pa'i bsam pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir gzugs la mi gnas pa de ltar na gzugs so zhes mi gnas pa de ltar na gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, because of not engaging in the thought of the demonstration of such a profound reality, not dwelling on form, in that way, he practices yoga on form.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is this.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the aspects of the path of the bodhisattva is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de chos gang la yang mi gnas pa de'i phyir mi gnas pa nyid de'i tshul thob pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de chos gang la yang mi gnas pa de'i phyir mi gnas pa nyid de'i tshul thob pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since that does not dwell on any phenomenon, therefore it is said to attain the mode of non-dwelling.

original: de la gzugs zhes bya ba ni da ltar brten gyi ngo bor gyur pa la gzugs mi gnas pa de'i phyir da ltar med par gyur pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la gnas pa med do //
analyzed: de la gzugs zhes bya ba ni da ltar brten gyi ngo bor gyur pa la gzugs mi gnas pa de'i phyir da ltar med par gyur pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la gnas pa med do //
translated: There, form is the entity that has become the present. Since it does not dwell on form, therefore it does not dwell on the past and future that have become non-existent.

original: gzugs so zhes mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas gzugs zhes bya ba rtogs pa ma yin pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs so zhes mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe brjod pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas gzugs zhes bya ba rtogs pa ma yin pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa'o //
translated: One does not apply form.

original: sngar ni gnas sel ba dang 'dir ni sgrub pa sel ba zhes bya ba khyad par ro //
analyzed: sngar ni gnas sel ba dang 'dir ni sgrub pa sel ba zhes bya ba khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that previously the elimination of the basis is mentioned, and here the elimination of the establishment is mentioned.üîΩOne does not abide in form.

original: gzugs so zhes mi gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs so zhes mi gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: This is a repetition of the previous.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa yin no /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa yin no /
translated: Similarly, feeling means that one does not abide in the perfection of wisdom in either way.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa dang rnal 'byor du byed pa nyid rnal 'byor du byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas pa med pa nyid gnas pa dang rnal 'byor du byed pa nyid rnal 'byor du byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One practices the perfection of wisdom means that non-abiding itself is abiding, and practicing itself is practice.

original: shes @165a * //
analyzed: shes @165a * //
translated: The meaning is that.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni zab pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni zab pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid ni zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The perfection itself is profound. This is the intention: because the suchness of form, etc. is profound.

original: gting dpag dka' ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid la gting dpag dka' ba nyid de de yang bsam pa dang shes rab dman pa rnams kyis gzung bar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid la gting dpag dka' ba nyid de de yang bsam pa dang shes rab dman pa rnams kyis gzung bar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to fathom. The suchness of form, etc. is difficult to fathom, because it cannot be grasped by those of inferior thought and wisdom.

original: gzung bar dka' ba la yang mtshan ma gang gis kyang de'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar mtshon par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar dka' ba la yang mtshan ma gang gis kyang de'i rang gi ngo bo nye bar mtshon par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to grasp, because its own nature cannot be illustrated by any sign.

original: tshad ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang dus la sogs pa'i dbye bas gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang dus la sogs pa'i dbye bas gzhal bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable, because it cannot be measured by a division of directions, time, etc.

original: zab pa 'di ni yod mod 'on kyang 'di yang mtshan mar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zab pa 'di ni yod mod 'on kyang 'di yang mtshan mar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: This profundity exists, but it also should not be taken as a sign.

original: gzhan du na zab pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni mi gnas te zhes bya ba ste mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zab pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni mi gnas te zhes bya ba ste mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The Lord has said that one should not dwell on the idea that it is profound, that is, one should not be attached to it.

original: de ltar yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba yang mtshan mar bya ba la mngon par zhen pa nyid yod par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa zhes bya ba yang mtshan mar bya ba la mngon par zhen pa nyid yod par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: And the idea that one should practice correctly would also be attachment to the idea that one should dwell on signs.

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs zab bo snyam du mi gnas pa de ltar na gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di ltar gzugs zab bo snyam du mi gnas pa de ltar na gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: As it is said, ≈öƒÅriputra, one should not dwell on the idea that form is profound, and so on. In this way, one practices yoga with regard to form.

original: de ltar yod na yang bde blag tu zab pa nyid de de yang bsrung bar bya ba zhes ston par byed pa ni de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yod na yang bde blag tu zab pa nyid de de yang bsrung bar bya ba zhes ston par byed pa ni de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And even if it were so, it would be easy to understand that it is profound. And that is what is to be protected. This is taught by the passage beginning with the words, When this had been said, Subh≈´ti replied to the Lord as follows.

original: 'dir zab pa nyid gtso bo ste gting dpag dka' ba la sogs pa rnams la de'i yan lag nyid kyis nye bar dgod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zab pa nyid gtso bo ste gting dpag dka' ba la sogs pa rnams la de'i yan lag nyid kyis nye bar dgod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, profundity is the main point. The difficulty of fathoming it and so on are presented as its branches. This is what is meant by the expression present them as its branches.

original: de rnams kyis slar brjod pa ni las dang po pa 'ga' zhig la bcom ldan 'das ma brjod pa lhag par mos pa'i rgyu yin pa zhes ston par byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis slar brjod pa ni las dang po pa 'ga' zhig la bcom ldan 'das ma brjod pa lhag par mos pa'i rgyu yin pa zhes ston par byed pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those statements are made in order to show that for some beginners, the cause of superior aspiration is the non-mention of the Bhagavati.

original: lung ma bstan pa'i mdun du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du lung bstan pas lung bstan pa'i phyir mi ldog pa zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa'i mdun du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du lung bstan pas lung bstan pa'i phyir mi ldog pa zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in front of the unpredicted means that one is not predicted to be irreversible by direct prediction.

original: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig la lhag par mos pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ci zhig bshad ces bya ba dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig la lhag par mos pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ci zhig bshad ces bya ba dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase what is the problem? means that one should not say anything, because the arising of superior aspiration is correct for some.

original: gzhan yang theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i lung ma bstan pa 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i lung ma bstan pa 'don pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the unpredicted one who is newly engaged in the vehicle is recited.

original: de la yang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung bas 'di med pas 'di phyir mi ldog pa dang 'dra bas 'di zhes gsungs pa ni yun ring po nas theg pa la yang dag par @165b zhugs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i skyon 'byung bas 'di med pas 'di phyir mi ldog pa dang 'dra bas 'di zhes gsungs pa ni yun ring po nas theg pa la yang dag par @165b zhugs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since faults such as desire arise for that one, it is said that this one is like the irreversible one, and this one refers to the one who has been correctly engaged in the vehicle for a long time.

original: sngon gyi skye ba'i brgyud pa la ltos nas gsar du zhugs pa'i 'di lta bu'i yon tan 'byung bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba'i brgyud pa la ltos nas gsar du zhugs pa'i 'di lta bu'i yon tan 'byung bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that these qualities arise for such a one who has newly entered, in dependence on the lineage of former lives.üîΩThis is the direct prophecy of the nearness of such qualities.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúirreversibility‚Äù is this: ‚Äúbefore long‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni de lta bu'i yon tan nye ba la dngos su lung bstan pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni 'di las ni da ring por mi thogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'di nyid gsungs pa ni bsnyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu'i yon tan nye ba la dngos su lung bstan pas phyir mi ldog pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni 'di las ni da ring por mi thogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'di nyid gsungs pa ni bsnyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthis very thing‚Äù is ‚Äúworship‚Äù and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum las mi 'da' ste /
translated: One does not pass beyond one or two or three Tathagatas.

original: phyis lung bstan pa so sor thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba de ltar ni ma yin te 'on kyang de rnams nyid las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyis lung bstan pa so sor thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba de ltar ni ma yin te 'on kyang de rnams nyid las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one does not attain the prophecy later on, but rather from those very ones.

original: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum las zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu dgag tshig gis stong pa'i 'don pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum las zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu dgag tshig gis stong pa'i 'don pa'o //
translated: One or two or three is a reading without the negative particle in some places.

original: der gcig dang gnyis dang de bzhin gshegs pa gsum las mi 'da' ba nyid du nye ba'o //
analyzed: der gcig dang gnyis dang de bzhin gshegs pa gsum las mi 'da' ba nyid du nye ba'o //
translated: There, one, two, or three tathƒÅgatas are not beyond being close.

original: brnyes par byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brnyes par byed par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will attain means they will obtain.

original: thugs 'byung bar byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mnyes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thugs 'byung bar byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mnyes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will not displease means they will please.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba na yang lung bstan pas 'bras bu yod par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mthong ba don yod pa nyid 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba na yang lung bstan pas 'bras bu yod par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mthong ba don yod pa nyid 'dir bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: When they see the tathƒÅgatas, they will make their seeing fruitful by receiving a prophecy. Here, the establishment of the fruitfulness of seeing is the establishment of the fruitfulness of seeing the tathƒÅgatas.

original: nges par lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par lung bstan pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they will obtain a prophecy.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba de las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rjes la ji srid du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ba de srid du don yod par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba de las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'di'i rjes la ji srid du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur ba de srid du don yod par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From that seeing of the tathƒÅgatas, they will make their seeing fruitful. After that, for as long as they will obtain a prophecy of perfect buddhahood, for that long they will make their seeing fruitful.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang phyag 'tshal ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba dang rim gro bya ba nas ji srid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang phyag 'tshal ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba dang rim gro bya ba nas ji srid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the TathƒÅgata, having seen him, having saluted him, having served him, having honored him, having worshipped him, and having received from him the prophecy of his own enlightenment, he will attain the supreme enlightenment.

original: rgyang ring po nas mchis pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsnyen pa la brten pa'i skye ba'i brgyud pa las so //
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas mchis pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa bsnyen pa la brten pa'i skye ba'i brgyud pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving come from afar‚Äù means that he has come from a far-off life-stream, having approached the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'di nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par mdzad pa ni de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par mdzad pa ni de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One has taught this very thing, saying, ‚ÄúSo it is, so it is!‚Äù

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i sbyor ba 'di la lung bstan pa'i 'bras bu nyid dpes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i sbyor ba 'di la lung bstan pa'i 'bras bu nyid dpes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The fruit of the prophecy in this kind of application is taught by the example.

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan ma rnams de dang ldan pa rnams la yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'i don du byang chub mtshon par byed pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnas brtan sh'a ri'i @166a * //
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i mtshan ma rnams de dang ldan pa rnams la yang dag par dga' ba bskyed pa'i don du byang chub mtshon par byed pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir gnas brtan sh'a ri'i @166a * //
translated: In order to generate true joy in those who possess these kinds of signs, the elder ≈öƒÅriputra is taught to be an indication of enlightenment.

original: bus gsungs pa ni dper gsol bar bdag spobs so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bus gsungs pa ni dper gsol bar bdag spobs so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The son said, ‚ÄúI am confident in giving an example.‚Äù

original: nye bar gnas na zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas na zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are present‚Äù means if they are correctly present.

original: skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste /üîΩphal cher ni phal che ba'o //üîΩmi mthun par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyab tu phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste / phal cher ni phal che ba'o // mi mthun par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni rgyab tu phyogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will arise‚Äù is a reading by some.üîΩ‚ÄúThey will be predominant‚Äù is the majority reading.üîΩ‚ÄúThey will be discordant‚Äù means they will turn away.

original: ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will turn away‚Äù means they will turn away.

original: rab tu mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor bas sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu mi 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor bas sbyar ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will not engage‚Äù means they will not engage through the application of irreversibility.

original: rab tu dad par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang le los so //
analyzed: rab tu dad par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang le los so //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will not have faith‚Äù means they will not have faith due to comfort and laziness.

original: dpag tshad brgya'i tshad 'di la yod pas dpag tshad brgya pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya'i tshad 'di la yod pas dpag tshad brgya pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne hundred yojanas‚Äù means it has the measure of one hundred yojanas.

original: dpag tshad brgya'i don ni tha na'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya'i don ni tha na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne hundred yojanas‚Äù means at least.

original: grong zhes bya ba ni zhing pas rab tu rgyas pa dang rab la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: grong zhes bya ba ni zhing pas rab tu rgyas pa dang rab la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúVillage‚Äù means it is filled with farmers and is free from the worst and so on.

original: grong khyer zhes bya ba ni phyug pa mang ba'i skye bo'i tshogs mang po'i rten no //
analyzed: grong khyer zhes bya ba ni phyug pa mang ba'i skye bo'i tshogs mang po'i rten no //
translated: A city is a place where many rich people live.

original: grong rdal ni grong bas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: grong rdal ni grong bas lhag pa'o //
translated: A town is larger than a city.

original: 'dun khang ni phal cher tshong pa rnams kyi gnas so //
analyzed: 'dun khang ni phal cher tshong pa rnams kyi gnas so //
translated: An assembly hall is a place where merchants gather.

original: gnas 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This place is called

original: yang dag par 'os pa'i dpe gzhan gyis kyang gdul bya rnams la bstan pa'i don du nye bar lung bstan pa'i 'bras bu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'os pa'i dpe gzhan gyis kyang gdul bya rnams la bstan pa'i don du nye bar lung bstan pa'i 'bras bu brjod pa'o //
translated: . In order to teach the meaning of the scriptures to those to be trained, the result of the prophecy is stated by another example.

original: sdong po ni shing ngo //
analyzed: sdong po ni shing ngo //
translated: A tree is a plant.

original: shing dang ri dvags kyi mtshan ma ni de'i rtse mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shing dang ri dvags kyi mtshan ma ni de'i rtse mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The signs of a tree and an animal are its top, etc.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even so, means even if.

original: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: The end, means the certainty.

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni thob pa'o //
translated: To go, means to attain.

original: slar zhes bya ba ni slar ro //
analyzed: slar zhes bya ba ni slar ro //
translated: Again, means back.

original: bdag gis bsnyen te zhes bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa'i nye ba'i mtshan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis bsnyen te zhes bya ba ni ji skad gsungs pa'i nye ba'i mtshan ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having approached, means because of seeing the signs as described.

original: lhags pa ni brul ba'o //
analyzed: lhags pa ni brul ba'o //
translated: The wind is the one that scatters.

original: lo ma rnying pa rnams ni 'dab ma rnying pa gang la yod pa de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma rnying pa rnams ni 'dab ma rnying pa gang la yod pa de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: The one with old leaves is the one who has old leaves.

original: sbrum ma ni mngal lci bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sbrum ma ni mngal lci bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is pregnant is the one who has a heavy womb.

original: dper na pa kshi ni ni bya mo ste bhi kshu ni ni dge slong ma lta bu'o //üîΩbskyod na ni ral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dper na pa kshi ni ni bya mo ste bhi kshu ni ni dge slong ma lta bu'o // bskyod na ni ral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For example, a hen is a pakshini, and a nun is a bhikshuni.üîΩWhen shaken, it is torn.

original: snyoms par 'gyur ba ni glal ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'gyur ba ni glal ba'o //
translated: When it is stretched, it yawns.

original: lus nyon mongs ba ni lus la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: lus nyon mongs ba ni lus la gnod pa'o //
translated: The body is afflicted when the body is harmed.

original: smra ba nyid ni smra ba 'am smra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba nyid ni smra ba 'am smra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Speech is speech or speech that has occurred.

original: stobs ni stobs so //
analyzed: stobs ni stobs so //
translated: Strength is strength.

original: sdug bsngal ni gzer ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gzer ba'o //
translated: Pain is a stab.

original: 'grogs pa la dad che bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grogs pa la dad che bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skyes pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not become greatly devoted to companionship means that one turns away from union with a man.

original: ci'i phyir 'grogs pa la dad che bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'grogs pa la dad che bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does one not become greatly devoted to companionship?

original: @166b gsungs pa ni sngon gyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bgyid pas 'dod chags kyi rgyu la kun tu rtog pa'o //
analyzed: @166b gsungs pa ni sngon gyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bgyid pas 'dod chags kyi rgyu la kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúdue to previous improper mental activity, one conceives of the cause of desire‚Äù means that one conceives of the cause of desire.

original: bsten pa ni de bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsten pa ni de bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne relies on it‚Äù means that one generates it.

original: nges par bsten pa ni 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par bsten pa ni 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne definitely relies on it‚Äù means that one generates desire.

original: bsgoms pa ni yang dag par sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa ni yang dag par sbyor bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne cultivates it‚Äù means that one applies oneself to it.

original: mang du byas pa ni yang dang yang du yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang du byas pa ni yang dang yang du yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne does it a lot‚Äù means that one applies oneself to it again and again.

original: 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni bu 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'tshal bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni bu 'byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should know‚Äù means that one should know that a son will be born.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba tsam 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba tsam 'don pa yin no //
translated: In some places, only ‚Äúa son will be born‚Äù is recited.

original: de la dga' zhing zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' zhing zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne delights in that‚Äù means that one is very pleased.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su rlom sems su mdzad cing gsungs pa ni legs so legs so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su rlom sems su mdzad cing gsungs pa ni legs so legs so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One‚Äôs statement ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent‚Äù is his approval.

original: ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is amazing‚Äù means that it is astonishing.

original: ngo mtshar ba ni ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ngo mtshar ba ni ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is astonishing?

original: gsungs pa ni 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The these refers to the following.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas legs par yongs su bzung ba dang legs par sbyangs pa dang legs par yongs su gtad pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas legs par yongs su bzung ba dang legs par sbyangs pa dang legs par yongs su gtad pa'o //
translated: The disciples are also well-taken-care-of, well-trained, and well-entrusted by the Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni legs par yongs su bzung ba dang ji srid du legs par yongs su gtad pa de ni 'dir ngo mtshar ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni legs par yongs su bzung ba dang ji srid du legs par yongs su gtad pa de ni 'dir ngo mtshar ba'i gnas so //
translated: The bodhisattvas are well-taken-care-of and well-entrusted for a long time. This is the basis of the marvel here.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba'i don la 'jug pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shin tu yang khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i don la 'jug pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shin tu yang khyad par ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas are especially well-entrusted by the Blessed Ones who are engaged in the meaning of going to the special.

original: de la legs par yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba'i phyir yang dag par bdag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la legs par yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba'i phyir yang dag par bdag tu byas pa'o //
translated: Among them, well-taken-care-of means being made one's own for the sake of being accepted.

original: legs par sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la lung bstan pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba rnams la rab tu dga' ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du chos ston pas so //
analyzed: legs par sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la lung bstan pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba rnams la rab tu dga' ba yang dag par bskyed pa'i don du chos ston pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWell trained‚Äù means that they teach the Dharma in order to generate great joy in those who have seen the signs of their own prediction.

original: legs par yongs su gtad pa zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rjes su gzud par bya'o zhes nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la dka' ba rab tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par yongs su gtad pa zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rjes su gzud par bya'o zhes nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la dka' ba rab tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWell entrusted‚Äù means that they are entrusted to the disciples and so on, in order to destroy the difficulty of teaching the Dharma.

original: yongs su gtad pa ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i yon tan mi nyams pa'i rgyu dge ba'i bshes gnyen la nye bar dgong pa'i don du 'ga' zhig tu legs par yongs su gtad pa zhes tshig gcig nyid du 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa ni thob pa dang ma thob pa'i yon tan mi nyams pa'i rgyu dge ba'i bshes gnyen la nye bar dgong pa'i don du 'ga' zhig tu legs par yongs su gtad pa zhes tshig gcig nyid du 'don pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEntrusted‚Äù means that they are entrusted to spiritual friends, in order to preserve the causes of the virtues of attainment and non-attainment.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rjes su bzung ba sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bas lhag par gnas pa'i phyir thams cad du sems mnyam pa nyid @167a * //
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rjes su bzung ba sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bas lhag par gnas pa'i phyir thams cad du sems mnyam pa nyid @167a * //
translated: Now, the Lord, in order to show the equality of his mind toward all beings, because of his special abiding in the benefit and happiness of all beings, through his acceptance of the bodhisattvas, says,

original: 'dis nye bar bsags pa ston par byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis nye bar bsags pa ston par byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This shows his accumulation. It is thus, Subhuti, that the bodhisattvas, the great beings, should train, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje ni rnam pa gsum las nyes par spyod pa mang ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / rkyen mtshang bas rnam par ma grol ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje ni rnam pa gsum las nyes par spyod pa mang ba'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can la dmigs pa dang / rkyen mtshang bas rnam par ma grol ba'i sems can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The compassion of the bodhisattvas is threefold: focused on beings who are full of misdeeds, focused on beings who are full of suffering, and focused on beings who are not liberated due to the lack of conditions.

original: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa dang rnam par dben pa la phyi ma'i bde ba nyid kyis phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa dang rnam par dben pa la phyi ma'i bde ba nyid kyis phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase for the benefit of the multitude means for the benefit of those who are free from misdeeds through the happiness of the future.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can la ltos pas gsungs pa ni skye bo mang po la bde ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can la ltos pas gsungs pa ni skye bo mang po la bde ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement for the happiness of many people is in consideration of sentient beings who possess suffering.

original: sdug bsngal bsal bas de rnams la bde ba nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal bas de rnams la bde ba nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by removing their suffering, one brings them happiness.

original: rnam par ma grol ba'i sems can la ltos nas gsungs pa ni 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma grol ba'i sems can la ltos nas gsungs pa ni 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement out of compassion for the world is in consideration of sentient beings who are not liberated.

original: de la 'jig rten la snying brtse ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten la snying brtse ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, compassion for the world is the brief presentation.

original: skye bo phal po che'i don zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i don zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The statement for the sake of the great multitude is the extensive explanation.

original: de la yang don dang zhes bya ba ni don ni dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang don dang zhes bya ba ni don ni dgos pa ste /
translated: There, for the sake means for the purpose.

original: de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of is stated.

original: don gyi khyad par du byas nas gsungs pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la phan pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid de dus thams cad du sman yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par du byas nas gsungs pa ni phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de la phan pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa nyid de dus thams cad du sman yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement for the benefit and happiness is the special purpose. There, benefit is nirvƒÅ·πáa, because it is medicine for all time.

original: bde ba ni gtan du ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni gtan du ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Happiness is because of being free from all suffering forever.

original: rnam par grol ba'i bde ba la lha dang mi rnams nyid snod yin zhes gsungs pa ni lha dang mi rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i bde ba la lha dang mi rnams nyid snod yin zhes gsungs pa ni lha dang mi rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement that gods and humans are the vessels for the happiness of liberation is ‚Äúgods and humans.‚Äù

original: snying rje rnam pa gsum pa yang nye bar bsdus nas bstan par byed de /
analyzed: snying rje rnam pa gsum pa yang nye bar bsdus nas bstan par byed de /
translated: The three types of compassion are also summarized and taught.

original: snying brtse ba nas ji srid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ba nas ji srid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: From ‚Äúcompassion‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe desire to fully awaken‚Äù

original: snying rje rnam pa gsum gyi 'bras bu sgrub pa'i rgyu gtan du gsungs pa ni chos ston par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje rnam pa gsum gyi 'bras bu sgrub pa'i rgyu gtan du gsungs pa ni chos ston par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cause for accomplishing the result of the three types of compassion is taught as being permanent, which is ‚Äúthe desire to teach the Dharma.‚Äù

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa thams cad 'di gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung ba mthong zhing 'dri bar byed pa ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa thams cad 'di gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nges par 'byung ba mthong zhing 'dri bar byed pa ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom
translated: Now, all the accomplishments of the aims of the bodhisattvas are based on the elder Subh≈´ti, who has attained certainty in the perfection of wisdom. Seeing this, he asks, ‚ÄúHow should the perfection of wisdom be cultivated?‚Äù

original: pa yongs su rdzogs par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa yongs su rdzogs par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The chapter is called ‚ÄúThe Complete Fulfillment of the Great Vehicle.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'phel ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'phel ba ste /
translated: The perfection of the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the increase.

original: gzugs la @167b sogs pa rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa mthong ba dang chos rnams ma mthong ba ni rtags so //
analyzed: gzugs la @167b sogs pa rnams 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa mthong ba dang chos rnams ma mthong ba ni rtags so //
translated: The non-seeing of the increase and decrease of form, etc. is the sign.

original: gzugs kyi 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi bdag nyid yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyi 'phel ba rab tu 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi bdag nyid yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyi 'phel ba rab tu 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: The increase of form is the increase of the form of the perfected nature, which is reality.

original: gzugs kyi 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni kun du brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi gzugs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'grib pa'i rim gyis srab pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'grib pa zhes bya ba ni kun du brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi gzugs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos 'grib pa'i rim gyis srab pa nyid do //
translated: The decrease of form is the decrease of the defiled dharmas of imagined and interdependent form.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid mi mthong ba ste med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid mi mthong ba ste med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-seeing of dharmas is the non-seeing of the imagined and interdependent natures because they do not exist.

original: chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo yongs su grub pa'i chos kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis med pa'i ngo bo yongs su grub pa'i chos kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: The so-called non-dharmas are also not seen as the nature of non-duality, which is the accomplished dharma.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo mnyam pas mnyam pa dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo'i ye shes spangs nas gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo mnyam pas mnyam pa dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bo'i ye shes spangs nas gzhan gyis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the equality of the nature of the grasped and grasper, the wisdom of the nature of the object of observation and the observer is abandoned and is not seen by any other.

original: slar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i sgrub pa dang bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la rtags ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slar bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i sgrub pa dang bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la rtags ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The sign of the perfection of the meditation of the non-engagement of the non-conceptualized practice and the non-conceptualized thought is the inconceivability of form.

original: mtha' gcig tu yod ces bya ba dang / med ces bya ba yang bsam par nus pa ma yin bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu yod ces bya ba dang / med ces bya ba yang bsam par nus pa ma yin bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Because it is not possible to think of it as either existent or nonexistent in one extreme, it is inconceivable.

original: de la kun brtags kyi gzugs ni shin tu med pa'i ngo bo yang yod pa nyid du gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de la kun brtags kyi gzugs ni shin tu med pa'i ngo bo yang yod pa nyid du gzung ba ste /
translated: Among those, the imagined form is the nature of complete non-existence that is apprehended as existent.

original: des na yod pa zhes bya ba 'am med pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa zhes bya ba 'am med pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to posit it as existent or nonexistent.

original: gzhan dbang gi gzungs ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bor yod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbang gi gzungs ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bor yod pa ste /
translated: The dependent characteristic exists as the nature of error.

original: de yang ji ltar rig pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rig pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it does not exist as it is cognized.

original: thams cad nas thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad nas thams cad du med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent in every way,

original: 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists as mere error.

original: de ni yod pa zhes bya ba'am med pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni yod pa zhes bya ba'am med pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to posit it as existent or nonexistent.

original: yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa kho na ste rang nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i gzugs kyang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa kho na ste rang nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The perfected characteristic also exists as the nature of nonduality, which is its own nature of nonduality.

original: de bas na de yang yod pa zhes bya ba'am med pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bas na de yang yod pa zhes bya ba'am med pa zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to posit it as existent or nonexistent.

original: gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang dmigs pas spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes gsungs pa ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar yang mi shes na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang dmigs pas spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes gsungs pa ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar yang mi shes na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And one who practices by observing the inconceivable form does not practice the perfection of wisdom means if one does not know the inconceivable form, one does not practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rtags gzhan yang chos thams cad @168a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i rtags gzhan yang chos thams cad @168a * //
translated: Another sign of practicing the perfection of wisdom is as follows:

original: la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One does not conceptualize any phenomena.

original: de bshad pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par gyur ba de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bshad pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par gyur ba de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In order to explain that, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚Äú≈öƒÅriputra, a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who has practiced the perfection of wisdom‚Äù and so on.

original: yun ring por gang zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring por gang zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa ni spyod pa'o //
translated: One who has practiced for a long time the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of non-conceptuality, is a practitioner.

original: de bsrung ba'i don du ngang tshul 'di la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de bsrung ba'i don du ngang tshul 'di la spyod pa na /
translated: In order to protect that, one who practices in this way

original: yun ring por spyad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring por spyad par gyur pa'o //
translated: has practiced for a long time.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la 'bras bu 'di nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la 'bras bu 'di nyid de /
translated: This is the result of the practice of the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: gang zhig chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that all phenomena are nonconceptual.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni stobs rnams la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni stobs rnams la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is stated as ‚Äúnonconceptuality regarding the powers.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa lta zhog gi gang zhig yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo stobs la sogs pa de rnams kyang mi rtog ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa lta zhog gi gang zhig yang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo stobs la sogs pa de rnams kyang mi rtog ste /
translated: Not only is there no conceptualization of afflicted form and so on, but also there is no conceptualization of the purified essence of the powers and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo rnam par bsal bas de rnams rnam par rtog pa dang / spros pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i stong pa nyid tsam du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo rnam par bsal bas de rnams rnam par rtog pa dang / spros pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i stong pa nyid tsam du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the meditative absorption of emptiness eliminates the imagined and dependent natures, and so they appear as just emptiness, empty of all conceptualization and elaborations.

original: 'di la rgyu ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of this is said to be ‚Äúinconceivable.‚Äù

original: de ltar spyod par gyur pa'i zhes brjod de gsar du spyod par byed pa la 'di lta bu'i lhag par mos pa mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar spyod par gyur pa'i zhes brjod de gsar du spyod par byed pa la 'di lta bu'i lhag par mos pa mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one who has practiced is said, because one who newly practices cannot bear such an excessive devotion.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid la de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzung bar dka' ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma zab pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams nyid la de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzung bar dka' ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma zab pa'o //
translated: Because form, etc. themselves are difficult to grasp due to the nature of suchness, the Blessed One is profound.

original: rin po che'i phung po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa bskyed pa las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che'i phung po zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos gzhal du med pa bskyed pa las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The heap of jewels is so called because it produces the immeasurable qualities of a Buddha.

original: dge ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos chos rnams thams cad la nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i phung po zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos chos rnams thams cad la nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The heap of virtue is so called because, by the perfected nature, one sees all phenomena as pure like space.

original: bar chad bgyid pa mang po 'byung ba 'di ni ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni legs pa bgegs ni mang ba can zhes bya bas gang zhig bar chad mi 'byung ba de ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: bar chad bgyid pa mang po 'byung ba 'di ni ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni legs pa bgegs ni mang ba can zhes bya bas gang zhig bar chad mi 'byung ba de ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: This is a great wonder, that there are so many obstacles means that the obstacles are many, and that it is a great wonder that there are no obstacles.

original: 'ga' zhig tu bcom ldan 'das bar chad mang ngo zhes bya ba'i dgag tshig gis stong pa'i 'don pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu bcom ldan 'das bar chad mang ngo zhes bya ba'i dgag tshig gis stong pa'i 'don pa ste /
translated: In some places, the Blessed One is empty of the negative particle in the phrase there are many obstacles.

original: der bar chad kyi gnyen por gyur pa 'di sgrub pa la bar chad yang dag par 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: der bar chad kyi gnyen por gyur pa 'di sgrub pa la bar chad yang dag par 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: There, the establishment of this as the antidote to obstacles is a great wonder, that obstacles do not arise.

original: de de bzhin te @168b zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bar du gcod pa'i rgyu yod kyang bar du gcod pa mi 'byung ba 'di ni ngo mtshar ba nyid do //
analyzed: de de bzhin te @168b zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bar du gcod pa'i rgyu yod kyang bar du gcod pa mi 'byung ba 'di ni ngo mtshar ba nyid do //
translated: It is so means that it is a great wonder that obstacles do not arise even when there are causes for obstacles.

original: gang gi phyir bar chad mang du 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bar chad mang du 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because of the many obstacles, this is the intention.

original: gang gi tshe dgag tshig gis stong pa'i 'don pa de'i tshe de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis phongs pa'i las bsags pa'i dbang gis bar du gcod pa yang dag par 'byung ba de'i phyir bag yod par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dgag tshig gis stong pa'i 'don pa de'i tshe de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis phongs pa'i las bsags pa'i dbang gis bar du gcod pa yang dag par 'byung ba de'i phyir bag yod par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the recitation is not negated by the word ‚Äúno,‚Äù then it is just as it is said. Because the obstacle arises correctly through the power of accumulating the karma of despising the true Dharma, therefore one should be heedful.

original: gal te zla bas bris na yang bri bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni 'di ni zla bas bri bar nus zhes bya ba gal te srid par gyur na bri bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te zla bas bris na yang bri bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni 'di ni zla bas bri bar nus zhes bya ba gal te srid par gyur na bri bar bya ba yin te /
translated: If it is written by Candra, it should be written. This means that if it were possible that this could be written by Candra, it should be written.

original: bri ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //üîΩmi nus pa srid pas lhod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bri ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o // mi nus pa srid pas lhod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One should strive to write it.üîΩBecause it is possible that one is incapable, one should not be lax.

original: bar chad yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir yid ches par mi bya mi bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir yid ches par mi bya mi bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the obstacle arises correctly, one should not believe it.

original: gal te bdud kyis byas pa'i bar chad de'i gnyen po zhes dgongs nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te bdud kyis byas pa'i bar chad de'i gnyen po zhes dgongs nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is thought that the obstacle made by MƒÅra is its antidote, the elder Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir bar chad dam srid pa'i bar chad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba nyid gnyen po zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni 'di ltar yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir bar chad dam srid pa'i bar chad la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba nyid gnyen po zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni 'di ltar yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the BhagavƒÅn has said that the application of the perfection of wisdom to the obstacles or the obstacles of existence is the antidote, because it arises correctly.

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also said that ‚Äúif‚Äù means ‚Äúeven if.‚Äù

original: mi nus so zhes bya ba ni nus par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi nus so zhes bya ba ni nus par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne cannot‚Äù means that one does not become able.

original: yi dam ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni yi dam nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yi dam ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni yi dam nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout violating one‚Äôs commitment‚Äù means without violating one‚Äôs commitment.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi gsung la sogs pa la the tshom gyis yang dag par rtsom pa'i 'dzin pa la sogs pa la lhod pa ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas kyi gsung la sogs pa la the tshom gyis yang dag par rtsom pa'i 'dzin pa la sogs pa la lhod pa ni nyams pa'o //
translated: Here, the laxity of grasping at correct composition, etc. due to doubt about the Buddha‚Äôs speech, etc. is a violation.

original: gal te de ltar yin na yi dam nyams pa med pa nyid du 'dzin pa la sogs pa la ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na yi dam nyams pa med pa nyid du 'dzin pa la sogs pa la ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
translated: If that is so, how does one practice without violating one‚Äôs commitment to grasping, etc.?

original: gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, when, etc.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni nus pa dman pa la yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi mthus zhes bya ba ni nus pa dman pa la yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: By the power of the Buddhas means that even those of inferior capacity will accomplish retention and so on by the blessing of the Tathagatas.

original: chos nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos nyid de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That reality means

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzhan gyi don la rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzhan gyi don la rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: the Buddhas' one-pointedness on the welfare of others.

original: dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dran par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dran par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: To be mindful means to be aware.

original: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To be retained means to be present in accordance with that.

original: sh'a ri'i bu mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa shes par byed pa'o //üîΩbar chod med pa nyid kyi @169a * //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa shes par byed pa'o // bar chod med pa nyid kyi @169a * //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, it is not possible and so on shows the knowledge of the Buddhas' intention.

original: phyir sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa shes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa shes pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is no obstruction, it is the knowledge of the Buddhas' intention. This is the meaning.

original: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa ni gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa ni gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To teach just this very meaning, he says, Those who think, 'I will know the Buddhas' intention,' and so on.

original: mthu ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni nus pa'o //
translated: Power is ability.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni nus pa lhag par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni nus pa lhag par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Blessing is the establishment of ability.

original: yongs su bzung ba ni bdag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba ni bdag tu byas pa'o //
translated: Possession is the making of one's own.

original: de ltar sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu brtsams pa mthar phyin pas so //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu brtsams pa mthar phyin pas so //
translated: Thus they will be accomplished means that the undertaking will be completed.

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba ni de de bzhin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba ni de de bzhin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the permission of the Lord is Thus it is, just as you have said.

original: de rnams la ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa zhes na gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de rnams la ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa zhes na gsungs pa ni /
translated: Why are they called blessed by the Buddha, etc.?

original: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Shariputra, the Tathagata knows is said.

original: mkhyen pa ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is intention.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni bdag tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni bdag tu byas pa'o //
translated: Blessing is the making of one's own.

original: gzigs pa ni sha'i spyan gyis so //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni sha'i spyan gyis so //
translated: Seeing is with the fleshly eye.

original: rnam par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis so //
translated: Beholding is with the eye of the Buddha.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de dag gi zhes bya ba ni nus pa dman pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de dag gi zhes bya ba ni nus pa dman pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Shariputra, those refers to those of inferior ability.

original: don chen po zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: don chen po zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams kyis so //
translated: Great benefit refers to the bodhisattva stages in the future.

original: phan yon chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phan yon chen po zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Great benefit refers to the perfection of enlightenment.

original: 'bras bu chen po zhes bya ba ni phyis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po zhes bya ba ni phyis bla na med pa'i byang chub kyis so //
translated: Great result refers to the later unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: rnam par smin pa chen po zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma las byung ba'i rigs brgyud dang rigs kyi mtshan ma la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa chen po zhes bya ba ni srid pa tha ma las byung ba'i rigs brgyud dang rigs kyi mtshan ma la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Great evolutionary development refers to the perfection of family, lineage, and signs, etc., in the final life.

original: 'bad pa ni ngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa ni ngal ba'o //
translated: Exertion is fatigue.

original: yongs su g-yo ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su g-yo ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: Exertion is activity.

original: de ltar na brtson 'grus dang nus pa dman pa rnams kyis yang 'bad pa byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid yod mod ces bstan pa yin la dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na brtson 'grus dang nus pa dman pa rnams kyis yang 'bad pa byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid yod mod ces bstan pa yin la dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Thus, it is shown that even those of weak effort and ability can attain the result of enlightenment through exertion. The idea is this:

original: gal te yang dngos po rnams la dmigs pa las skyes pa'i bar chos rnams la chos rnams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das ma gnyen por gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po rnams la dmigs pa las skyes pa'i bar chos rnams la chos rnams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das ma gnyen por gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If, however, one is born from the observation of things, then the Blessed Lady, the non-observation of all things, is the antidote.

original: de ltar na yang ma dad pa dang the tshom la sogs pa'i skyon mang ba'i bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bar chad kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ma dad pa dang the tshom la sogs pa'i skyon mang ba'i bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bar chad kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: But even so, there is the obstacle of the many faults of lack of faith, doubt, etc., which are the blessings of Mara.

original: der yang de zhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis kho bo'i 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chad pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes rigs kyi bus le lo mi bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der yang de zhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis kho bo'i 'di 'dzin pa dang 'chad pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur zhes rigs kyi bus le lo mi bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There, too, by the blessing of the Tathagatas, this will be accomplished for me, namely, the retention, the explanation, etc. of this. Thus, the son of good lineage should not be lazy.

original: da ni dus thams cad du yul thams cad na dar ba @169b bcom ldan 'das ma ma yin te /
analyzed: da ni dus thams cad du yul thams cad na dar ba @169b bcom ldan 'das ma ma yin te /
translated: Now, the Blessed Lady is not spread out in all places at all times.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig tu dus gang la yang de'i phyir de don du gnyer bas de'i yul nyid la tshol bar bya zhes bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig tu dus gang la yang de'i phyir de don du gnyer bas de'i yul nyid la tshol bar bya zhes bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni /
translated: But in some places, at some times, she is. Therefore, one who seeks her should seek her in those very places. In order to teach this, he says:

original: sh'a ri'i bu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning Moreover, Sariputra, etc.

original: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The sutra is the Bhagavatf, etc.

original: 'das nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su bzung ba'i don du mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'das nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su bzung ba'i don du mya ngan las 'das pa bstan pas so //
translated: After the nirvana of the Teacher, in order to care for the disciples who were taught the nirvana, he demonstrated nirvana.

original: pa ra ta ni ra zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs dang yul dbus pa rnams kyi dad pa dang shes rab la sogs pa lhag pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma la lhag par mos pa yang dag par 'byung ba de'i phyir yul dbus nyid du bcom ldan 'dasüîΩma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa ra ta ni ra zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs dang yul dbus pa rnams kyi dad pa dang shes rab la sogs pa lhag pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ma la lhag par mos pa yang dag par 'byung ba de'i phyir yul dbus nyid du bcom ldan 'das ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The paradisiacal region is the eastern region and the central region, because faith, wisdom, etc. are predominant there. The perfect emergence of the devotion to the Bhagavatf is due to that. Therefore, the Bhagavatf was taught in the central region alone.

original: de bas na byang phyogs su yang 'di dar ba phal cher de nyid du yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang phyogs su yang 'di dar ba phal cher de nyid du yang dag par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also predominant in the northern region, and it is also perfect there.

original: dus nam gyi tshe na lho phyogs la sogs pa la dar bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i dus kyi tshe chos 'dul ba snying po sar pa thob pa na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe na lho phyogs la sogs pa la dar bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni dam pa'i chos 'jig pa'i dus kyi tshe chos 'dul ba snying po sar pa thob pa na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When the time has come for the destruction of the true Dharma, when the Vinaya of the Dharma has obtained a new core.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na lnga brgya pa phrag bcur dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na lnga brgya pa phrag bcur dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus so //
translated: When the Blessed One has passed into parinirvƒÅ·πáa, the true Dharma will remain for ten five-hundred-year periods.

original: de la phyi ma'i lnga brgya ni dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de la phyi ma'i lnga brgya ni dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus so //
translated: The latter five hundred years is the time of the disappearance of the true Dharma.

original: rtog pa po rnams gnas kyang dam pa'i chos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa po rnams gnas kyang dam pa'i chos gnas pa'o //
translated: The time of the disappearance of the true Dharma is also the time when those who speculate will abide.

original: de bas na rtog pa po yang dag par gnas pa dang yang dag par gnas pa ma yin pa dag gi dam pa'i chos la gnas pa dang nub pa dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa po yang dag par gnas pa dang yang dag par gnas pa ma yin pa dag gi dam pa'i chos la gnas pa dang nub pa dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the abiding and disappearance of the true Dharma of those who speculate, whether they abide correctly or not, should be explained.

original: dam pa'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The true Dharma is twofold:

original: yang dag pa'i bka' las byung ba ni bka' dang don dam pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bka' las byung ba ni bka' dang don dam pa ste /
translated: The true Dharma that arises from the true word is the word and the ultimate.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa rnams so //üîΩde la 'di 'don pa la rtse gcig pa'i rtog pa po rnams de rnams kyi rgyud la lung nub pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa rnams so // de la 'di 'don pa la rtse gcig pa'i rtog pa po rnams de rnams kyi rgyud la lung nub pa'o //
translated: the uncontaminated faculties, powers, limbs of enlightenment, etc.üîΩAmong them, those who are absorbed in the first concentration have the disappearance of initial mental application in their continuum.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa la rtse gcig pa'i rtog pa po rnams ni de rnams kyi rgyud la rtogs pa nub pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa la rtse gcig pa'i rtog pa po rnams ni de rnams kyi rgyud la rtogs pa nub pa'o //
translated: Those who are absorbed in the second concentration have the disappearance of investigation in their continuum.

original: chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba la chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba la chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The term Dharma-Vinaya means that nirvana is the Dharma.

original: de thob pa 'dul ba gang zhig nyon mongs pa 'dul ba nye bar bstan pa chos 'dul ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o //üîΩ@170a * // de ji lta bur gyur pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni snying po sar pa thob pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de thob pa 'dul ba gang zhig nyon mongs pa 'dul ba nye bar bstan pa chos 'dul ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'o // @170a * // de ji lta bur gyur pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni snying po sar pa thob pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Vinaya is that which subdues the afflictions, and the Blessed One taught the Dharma-Vinaya to demonstrate that subduing of the afflictions.üîΩAs for what it is like, it is said to be the attainment of a new essence.

original: snying po thob pas na snying po ste mdzes pa thob pa zhes byed pa po lta'o //
analyzed: snying po thob pas na snying po ste mdzes pa thob pa zhes byed pa po lta'o //
translated: Since it is the attainment of an essence, it is called essence, just as one says the attainment of beauty.

original: snying po sar pa 'thob pa ni nyams su myong bar gyur ba de'i phyir snying po sar pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: snying po sar pa 'thob pa ni nyams su myong bar gyur ba de'i phyir snying po sar pa thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of a new core is the experience of that. Therefore, it is the attainment of a new core.

original: gang gi phyir lnga brgya pa phrag bcu pa la bstan pa mdzes pa sar 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lnga brgya pa phrag bcu pa la bstan pa mdzes pa sar 'das pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, the ten-thousand-year period is the period of the beauty of the teaching.

original: de bas na lnga brgya pa phrag bcu pa la snying po sar pa 'thob pa chos 'dul ba la zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lnga brgya pa phrag bcu pa la snying po sar pa 'thob pa chos 'dul ba la zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ten-thousand-year period is called the period of the core of the discipline of the teaching.

original: 'di skad du slob dpon rnams kyis brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du slob dpon rnams kyis brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what the masters say.

original: gang zhig 'dir lo stong phrag lnga dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus de rnams lo stong phrag lnga ni lnga brgya'i dbang gis phyed du gyur pa lnga brgya phrag bcur 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir lo stong phrag lnga dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus de rnams lo stong phrag lnga ni lnga brgya'i dbang gis phyed du gyur pa lnga brgya phrag bcur 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The period of five thousand years is the period of the duration of the true teaching. Those five thousand years become five hundred by the power of five hundred, and become ten times five hundred.

original: de la dang por re zhig rtogs pa'i dus dang / sgrub pa'i dus dang / de nas lung gi dus zhes bya ba'i dus gsum mo //
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig rtogs pa'i dus dang / sgrub pa'i dus dang / de nas lung gi dus zhes bya ba'i dus gsum mo //
translated: There, first, there are three periods: the period of realization, the period of practice, and then the period of scripture.

original: de la rtogs pa'i dus ni rnam pa gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: de la rtogs pa'i dus ni rnam pa gsum du phye ste /
translated: The period of realization is divided into three.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i dus dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i dus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i dus dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i dus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the period of the Arhats, the period of the Non-Returners, and the period of the Stream-Winners.

original: sgrub pa'i dus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The period of practice is threefold:
