original: lhag mthong gi dus dang / zhi gnas kyi dus dang / tshul khrims kyi dus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi dus dang / zhi gnas kyi dus dang / tshul khrims kyi dus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the period of insight, the period of calm, and the period of morality.

original: lung gi dus kyang rnam pa gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: lung gi dus kyang rnam pa gsum du phye ste /
translated: The period of the Scriptures is threefold:

original: chos mngon pa'i sde snod dang / mdo sde'i sde snod dang / 'dul ba'i sde snod do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i sde snod dang / mdo sde'i sde snod dang / 'dul ba'i sde snod do //
translated: the period of the Abhidharma, the period of the Sutras, and the period of the Vinaya.

original: dus 'di rnams rtags tsam gyi dus dang / lhan cig bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus 'di rnams rtags tsam gyi dus dang / lhan cig bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: These periods are divided into periods of the mere signs.

original: de la dus re re'i lnga brgya phrag lnga dang lnga brgya phrag lnga ni dus so //
analyzed: de la dus re re'i lnga brgya phrag lnga dang lnga brgya phrag lnga ni dus so //
translated: Five hundred years of each period make one period.

original: de bzhin du dus bcu la lnga brgya phrag bcu ni lo stong phrag lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus bcu la lnga brgya phrag bcu ni lo stong phrag lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in ten periods, there are ten times five hundred years, or five thousand years.

original: de la thams cad kyi dang po lnga brgya'i phrag la dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi dang po lnga brgya'i phrag la dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: In the first five hundred years of the first period, there are Arhats.

original: gnyis pa la phyir mi 'ong ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la phyir mi 'ong ba rnams so //
translated: In the second five hundred years, there are Non-Returners.

original: gsum pa la rgyun du zhugs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa la rgyun du zhugs pa rnams so //
translated: In the third, those who have entered the stream.

original: bzhi pa la lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzhi pa la lhag mthong ngo //
translated: In the fourth, insight.

original: lnga pa la ting nge 'dzin rnam so //
analyzed: lnga pa la ting nge 'dzin rnam so //
translated: In the fifth, concentration.

original: drug pa la tshul khrims so //
analyzed: drug pa la tshul khrims so //
translated: In the sixth, morality.

original: bdun pa la chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la chos mngon pa'o //
translated: In the seventh, Abhidharma.

original: brgyad pa la mdo sde'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la mdo sde'o //
translated: In the eighth, Sutra.

original: dgu pa la 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la 'dul ba'o //
translated: In the ninth, Vinaya.

original: lnga brgya pa phrag bcu pa la rtags tsam mo //
analyzed: lnga brgya pa phrag bcu pa la rtags tsam mo //
translated: In the tenth, only the signs.

original: de la lnga brgya pa phrag phyin ma dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de la lnga brgya pa phrag phyin ma dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus so //
translated: In the last five hundred years, the time of the disappearance of the true Dharma,

original: dus de la snying po dgu pa ni mdzes pa'i rab tu dbye ba dgra bcom pa nyid @170b nas brtsams nas 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi mthar thug pa dgu bstan nas sngar thob par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus de la snying po dgu pa ni mdzes pa'i rab tu dbye ba dgra bcom pa nyid @170b nas brtsams nas 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi mthar thug pa dgu bstan nas sngar thob par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in that time, the nine essences are the divisions of the beautiful, beginning with arhatship and ending with the Vinaya Pi·π≠aka. It is said that they will be obtained earlier.

original: phyi ma'i lnga brgya phrag la snying po dgu 'thob pa chos 'dul ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma'i lnga brgya phrag la snying po dgu 'thob pa chos 'dul ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: In the latter five hundred years, the nine essences are obtained, which is the expression of the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: da yang phyi ma'i lnga brgya'i phrag rim gyis 'das pa'i dgu la 'byung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da yang phyi ma'i lnga brgya'i phrag rim gyis 'das pa'i dgu la 'byung par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, in the latter five hundred years, the nine will arise gradually in the past.

original: da ltar ni lnga brgya phrag bzhi pa la 'jug pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni lnga brgya phrag bzhi pa la 'jug pa zhes zer ro //
translated: The present period is said to be the fourth five hundred years.

original: phyi ma de yang rtags tsam gyi dus zhes gang zhig brjod pa de 'dzam bu'i gling la khyab par byed pa'i rigs pa'i //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pas yul 'ga' zhig tu dam pa'i chos dar bar yang 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi ma de yang rtags tsam gyi dus zhes gang zhig brjod pa de 'dzam bu'i gling la khyab par byed pa'i rigs pa'i // de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs pas yul 'ga' zhig tu dam pa'i chos dar bar yang 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The latter period is also called the time of mere signs.üîΩThe intention of the Tathagata is that the true Dharma will spread in some places.üîΩThe intention of the Tathagata is that the true Dharma will spread in some places means that the true Dharma, which has spread for hundreds of years, will be contracted in some places, because it is the time when the true Dharma is declining.

original: brgya phrag tu dar ba de 'ga' zhig tu bskum par 'os pa dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir de sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis rgyas par 'gyur lags sam zhes sh'a ri'i bus 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brgya phrag tu dar ba de 'ga' zhig tu bskum par 'os pa dam pa'i chos nub pa'i dus yin pa'i phyir de sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis rgyas par 'gyur lags sam zhes sh'a ri'i bus 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: This is what Shariputra asks, Will it spread through the Buddha's blessings?

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ste /

original: rgyas par spyod pas na rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par spyod pas na rgyas pa'o //

original: byang gi phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan rnams rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan rnams rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: The northern direction excludes other directions.

original: byang gi phyogs kyi char zhes bya ba ni de las kyang cha gzhan rnams phyogs zhes bya ba'i tshig de lho phyogs la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa'i don du'o //

analyzed: nyung ngu 'am 'on te mang ba ste zhes bya ba la mang ba nyid mthar thug pa'i don du'o //

translated: The meaning is this: Even if the practice is rare in this time of the disappearance of the teaching, still, by the power of the TathƒÅgata, at such a time, the Bhagavatƒ´ will spread among those who focus on it.

analyzed: de ltar byas pas yongs su zhus pa'o //

analyzed: de dag ni tshe rabs 'phos kyang zhes bya ba ni de dang de'i phyi ma'i skye ba las 'das pa rnams so //

analyzed: spyod pa ni sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúPractice‚Äù refers to the applications.

analyzed: de nyid kyi gtam byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang so sor yang dag par ldan pa'o //

analyzed: legs par gnas shing zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsam pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste /

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la lhag par mos pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la lhag par mos pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are teaching the Blessed Lady.

original: mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa ste /

original: lhag par mos pa nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are able to have devotion.

original: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i cha lugs kyis sgyu ma las so //
analyzed: 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i cha lugs kyis sgyu ma las so //
translated: ‚ÄúAspiration‚Äù means through the guise of the Buddha and so on, like an illusion.üîΩ‚ÄúThrough the gateway of mantras‚Äù means

original: sngags kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase through the mantra approach refers to the following.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa sba bar brjod pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa sba bar brjod pas so //
translated: This is not the word of the Buddha, etc.

original: dga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma thob pa'i rgyus dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma thob pa'i rgyus dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the joy of not obtaining the Bhagavatƒ´.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni yon tan khyad par du bsam pas chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni yon tan khyad par du bsam pas chog shes pa'o //
translated: Extreme joy is the satisfaction of thinking of the special qualities.

original: rab tu dang ba ni ma dad pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba ni ma dad pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is the confidence that is the antidote to lack of faith.

original: yang dag par gzhag par bya ba ni 'jug pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: yang dag par gzhag par bya ba ni 'jug pa tsam gyis so //
translated: One should be established is by mere engagement.

original: yang dag par rab tu dbye bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgom pa mthar thug par yang dag par skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dbye bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgom pa mthar thug par yang dag par skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should be perfectly differentiated is for the sake of the perfect arising of meditation up to the end.

original: gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtan par bya ba'o //
translated: One should abide is for the sake of stability.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go bar sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go bar sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: sh'a ri'i bu rjes su yi rang bar byas so zhes bya ba ni gzhan don gyi smon lam la don chen po nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams la mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu rjes su yi rang bar byas so zhes bya ba ni gzhan don gyi smon lam la don chen po nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams la mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, having rejoiced means that for the sake of others, the aspiration prayer has a great purpose, because it is desired by the buddhas.

original: mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgya chen po'i 'dod pa la rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgya chen po'i 'dod pa la rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: He has a vast aspiration means he has a single-pointed desire for the extremely vast.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa ni gzhan dang gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa ni gzhan dang gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said in other and other places.

original: gang na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir la'o //
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir la'o //
translated: Where means for what reason.

original: 'gro bar bya ba ni yang @171b dag par 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya ba ni yang @171b dag par 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: Going means going correctly.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa la chen po nyid de 'dir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mi zad pa ston par byed pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgrub pa la chen po nyid de 'dir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mi zad pa ston par byed pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The greatness of the practice of the perfection of wisdom is taught here through the imperishability of the Tathagata's wisdom, which is the antidote to all afflictive obstructions.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said When this was said... and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'das pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'das pa la sogs pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagata's past, etc. through the power of the perfection of wisdom is called amazing.

original: ma gzigs pa'am zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: ma gzigs pa'am zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Not seeing is by the eye consciousness.

original: ma gsan pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: ma gsan pa ni rna ba'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Not hearing is by the ear consciousness.

original: mngon par mi mkhyen pa ni sna la sogs pa dbang po gsum gyis skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi mkhyen pa ni sna la sogs pa dbang po gsum gyis skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Not directly knowing is by the three sense consciousnesses born from the nose and so on.

original: rnam par mi mkhyen pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi mkhyen pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: Not fully knowing is by the mental consciousness.

original: gang dag yang 'di la tshol bar byed pa zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gang dag yang 'di la tshol bar byed pa zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: And those who seek this are connected.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi slad du gcig pur ma zad kyi 'on kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa dang lhan cig tu song ba'i sbyin pa'i pha
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi slad du gcig pur ma zad kyi 'on kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa dang lhan cig tu song ba'i sbyin pa'i pha
translated: These six perfections are not just one because of the perfection of wisdom itself, but also because of the perfection of wisdom that accompanies the practice of generosity and so on.

original: rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi slad du rang dang gzhan yongs su smin pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba de'i don du de rnams la yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi slad du rang dang gzhan yongs su smin pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba de'i don du de rnams la yongs su dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of that, for the sake of ripening oneself and others, they are purified in those.

original: don du zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In reality means for the sake of benefit.

original: tshol ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pa la'o //
analyzed: tshol ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pa la'o //
translated: Seeking is in the perfection of wisdom, unstained by afflictions.

original: yongs su tshol ba ni de dang der song nas so //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba ni de dang der song nas so //
translated: Thorough seeking is having gone to this and that.

original: tshol bar 'gyur ba ni 'dir rnyed par 'gyur zhes thos nas so //
analyzed: tshol bar 'gyur ba ni 'dir rnyed par 'gyur zhes thos nas so //
translated: Seeking will occur is having heard, ‚ÄúIt will be found here.‚Äù

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni de ngo mtshar ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni de ngo mtshar ba'i tshig go //
translated: That is so is the word of wonder.

original: de de bzhin te zhes rjes su gnang nas dri ba sel zhing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes rjes su gnang nas dri ba sel zhing gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having assented with ‚ÄúThat is so,‚Äù he spoke to remove the question.

original: sh'a ri'i bu yang de'i tshe de'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu yang de'i tshe de'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, at that time, on that occasion, etc.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma nyid dge ba la sbyor ba'i rgyu gsungs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma nyid dge ba la sbyor ba'i rgyu gsungs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the statement of the cause of engaging in virtue previously, beginning with ‚ÄúThus those bodhisattvas,‚Äù is ‚Äúother s≈´tras.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstan kyang gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par brjod ces gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstan kyang gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par brjod ces gsungs pa ni //
translated: Although the six perfections are taught, the perfection of wisdom is the principal one.

original: rang nyid nye bar 'ong bar 'gyur zhes nye bar gnas pa las so //
analyzed: rang nyid nye bar 'ong bar 'gyur zhes nye bar gnas pa las so //
translated: Approaching means that it is present in the sense of coming near.

original: nye bar gzhol ba ni 'bad pa yod na rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gzhol ba ni 'bad pa yod na rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Approaching closely means that it is attained when there is effort.

original: nye bar phyogs pa ni 'bad pa med pa nyid kyis rnyed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskye ba @172a * //
analyzed: nye bar phyogs pa ni 'bad pa med pa nyid kyis rnyed pa'i phyir ro // skye ba @172a * //
translated: Approaching fully means that it is attained without effort.

original: 'phos shing zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan la lha la sogs pa'i skye ba gzhan gyis yang dag par bsdus pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'phos shing zhes bya ba ni skye ba gzhan la lha la sogs pa'i skye ba gzhan gyis yang dag par bsdus pa yang ngo //
translated: Transmigrating means that it is included in other rebirths, such as those of gods, etc.

original: tshe rabs brjes kyang zhes bya ba las ni mi la sogs pa'i tshogs dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs brjes kyang zhes bya ba las ni mi la sogs pa'i tshogs dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid las skyes pa'o //
translated: Even after changing lives means that it is born from the homogeneity of humans, etc.

original: yang gi sgras ni skye ba 'di nyid la ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni skye ba 'di nyid la ma yin no //
translated: Also means that it is not just in this life.

original: 'di dag nyid ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma bstan pa mthar thug pas gang zhig bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma bstan pa mthar thug pas gang zhig bstan pa rnams so //
translated: These very ones means those that are taught, because the teaching of the Blessed One is complete.

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bcom ldan 'das ma bstan pa de ma thag tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par ston par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bcom ldan 'das ma bstan pa de ma thag tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar thug par ston par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Other than that means that which is not taught by the Lord, but will be taught at the end of the ultimate nirvana.

original: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi mi dmigs pa ston pa po rnams so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi mi dmigs pa ston pa po rnams so //
translated: Possessing nonapprehension means those who teach the nonapprehension of duality.

original: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis dang gnyis kyi rnam par bral bas yongs su grub pa'i gnyis med pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis dang gnyis kyi rnam par bral bas yongs su grub pa'i gnyis med pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Possessing emptiness means those who teach emptiness, the nondual nature of the perfected, which is free from the duality of the imagined and the relative.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa ni /
translated: As it is said:

original: dmigs pa yang dag brten nas ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang dag brten nas ni //
translated: On the basis of the correct apprehension of an object,

original: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni rab tu skye //
translated: Nonapprehension arises.

original: mi dmigs pa la brten nas kyang //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la brten nas kyang //
translated: And on the basis of nonapprehension,

original: dmigs pa med pa rab tu skye //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rab tu skye // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nonexistence of the object arises.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dmigs pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa skye'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dmigs pa la brten nas mi dmigs pa skye'o //
translated: Nonapprehension arises on the basis of the apprehension of the object that is mere representation.

original: don mi dmigs pa la brten nas rnam par rig pa tsam la yang mi dmigs pa skye zhes bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don mi dmigs pa la brten nas rnam par rig pa tsam la yang mi dmigs pa skye zhes bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Based on the non-apprehension of objects, the non-apprehension of mere representation also arises.

original: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ni /
translated: In order to teach just this meaning, he says:

original: gnyis ka yang ni ma dmigs pas //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang ni ma dmigs pas //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of both,

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa rnam par 'gro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa rnam par 'gro //
translated: the aspects of duality cease.

original: de bral bas ni yongs grub pa //
analyzed: de bral bas ni yongs grub pa //
translated: By being free from that, the perfected

original: gnyis med pa ni rtogs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni rtogs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is realized as non-dual.

original: gnyis med pa 'di ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du gnyis med pa tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis med pa 'di ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du gnyis med pa tsam ma yin te /
translated: This non-duality is not just non-duality like the horn of a rabbit,

original: dngos po med pa'i mthar ltung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mthar ltung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would fall into the extreme of non-existence.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa dang 'phags pa'i skye bo'i spyod yul dang so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa dang 'phags pa'i skye bo'i spyod yul dang so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: However, it is the ultimate emptiness that transcends all conventions, the domain of the noble ones, and the meaning to be understood by oneself.

original: 'di yang bstan pa gnyis rim gyis 'jug pa la dgongs pas mdo gcig la des na mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa rnams las gzhan stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang bstan pa gnyis rim gyis 'jug pa la dgongs pas mdo gcig la des na mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa rnams las gzhan stong pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mdo sde ni ma yin no //
translated: This also is intended for those who enter the two teachings in sequence. Therefore, the sutras that have emptiness are not the same as those that have nonapprehension.

original: 'on kyang bstan pa'i rim pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bstan pa'i rim pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: However, this is the sequence of the teachings.üîΩThus, in the noble Lankavatara Sutra,

original: de ltar na yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: it says:

original: sems tsam la ni mi gnas kyang //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni mi gnas kyang //
translated: Even though one does not dwell in mind only,

original: phyi rol don ni 'da' bar bya //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni 'da' bar bya //
translated: one transcends external objects.

original: de nyid dmigs pa @172b la gnas nas //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa @172b la gnas nas //
translated: Dwelling in the object of that very [mind only],

original: sems tsam las kyang 'da' bar bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems tsam las kyang 'da' bar bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one transcends mind only.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sems la gzhag pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sems la gzhag pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the perfection of wisdom in the mind is grasping.

original: de'i yon tan rnams ni phan yon rnams so //
analyzed: de'i yon tan rnams ni phan yon rnams so //
translated: Its qualities are the benefits.

original: de rnams yongs su brjod pa yang yin la le'u yang yin te le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: de rnams yongs su brjod pa yang yin la le'u yang yin te le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: This is the chapter that fully explains them, the tenth.

original: // / de nas bdud kyi las yongs su spang ba'i phyir bdud kyi las rnams rgyas par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: // / de nas bdud kyi las yongs su spang ba'i phyir bdud kyi las rnams rgyas par bshad pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to completely abandon the works of Mara, the works of Mara are explained in detail:

original: sngar gyi le'u las bdud sdig can shin tu rnam pa mang bas bar chad kyi las bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngar gyi le'u las bdud sdig can shin tu rnam pa mang bas bar chad kyi las bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the previous chapter, it was stated that the evil Mara will remain close by in order to create obstacles through many different forms.

original: de nas ci nas kyang bar chad yongs su bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ci nas kyang bar chad yongs su bsal bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should completely remove obstacles.

original: bdud kyi las yongs su shes pa med na de yongs su bsal bar bya bar sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyi las yongs su shes pa med na de yongs su bsal bar bya bar sla ba ma yin no //
translated: If one does not understand the deeds of Mara, it is not easy to completely remove them.

original: de'i phyir de'i don du yon tan 'di dag ni zhes bya ba nye bar gzhag pa sngon du 'gro bas dri ba ni yon tan 'di dag ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i don du yon tan 'di dag ni zhes bya ba nye bar gzhag pa sngon du 'gro bas dri ba ni yon tan 'di dag ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, for that purpose, these qualities are stated.üîΩIf the qualities do not exist, there is no need to accomplish them. If there are no obstacles to be removed, how do these qualities arise? This is the expression of purpose.

original: yon tan rnams med na de sgrub pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir bar chad yongs su bsal ba med na ji ltar yon tan 'di dag 'byung zhes pa ched du brjod par rig pa'i ngo bo de'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa ni ci tsam dag ces bya
analyzed: yon tan rnams med na de sgrub pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir bar chad yongs su bsal ba med na ji ltar yon tan 'di dag 'byung zhes pa ched du brjod par rig pa'i ngo bo de'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa ni ci tsam dag ces bya
translated: Therefore, the question is asked: What are these qualities?

original: ba ste / 'ga' zhig tu ni kha cig ces bya ba'i 'don pa la /
analyzed: ba ste / 'ga' zhig tu ni kha cig ces bya ba'i 'don pa la /
translated: In some places, it is recited as some of these.

original: der ni ci dang ci zhes bya ba don gyi 'gro ba la dri ba'o //
analyzed: der ni ci dang ci zhes bya ba don gyi 'gro ba la dri ba'o //
translated: Here, what? and how? are questions about the meaning of the goal.

original: bar chad byed pa zhes bya bas bdud kyi las rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: bar chad byed pa zhes bya bas bdud kyi las rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid gsungs so //
translated: The word obstruction indicates the general characteristic of the activities of Mara.

original: tshul ji lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bas te khyad par gyi mtshan nyid 'dri bar byed de /
analyzed: tshul ji lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bas te khyad par gyi mtshan nyid 'dri bar byed de /
translated: The question in what way will they occur? asks about the specific characteristics.

original: 'dir ji srid du cung zad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la bar du gcod par byed pa de thams cad bdud kyi las yin no //üîΩde yang dpag tu med pa zhes mdor bsdus pa bstan pas ji tsam yang bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'dir ji srid du cung zad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub pa la bar du gcod par byed pa de thams cad bdud kyi las yin no // de yang dpag tu med pa zhes mdor bsdus pa bstan pas ji tsam yang bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Here, all that obstructs the practice of the perfection of wisdom in any way is the activity of Mara.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And that is taught in brief as incalculable. In order to teach just that, the Lord said, Those... and so on.

original: 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa chos spyod rnam pa bcu nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba dang mchod pa la sogs pa chos spyod rnam pa bcu nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The word explain indicates the ten Dharma activities such as asking questions and making offerings.

original: spobs pa yun ring mo zhig na zhes bya ba ni yi ge dang don dang nges tshig la yun ring pos spobs pa bskyed pas rtogs pa po rnams 'bad pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: spobs pa yun ring mo zhig na zhes bya ba ni yi ge dang don dang nges tshig la yun ring pos spobs pa bskyed pas rtogs pa po rnams 'bad pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: The phrase for a long time means that one's eloquence is generated after a long time, and so the understanding is that those who are eloquent must exert themselves. This is the work of Mara.

original: skyes na yang zhes bya ba ni mi brtan pa'i phyir gang gi 'bras bu smra ba la sogs pa ma byas nas g-yengs @173a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes na yang zhes bya ba ni mi brtan pa'i phyir gang gi 'bras bu smra ba la sogs pa ma byas nas g-yengs @173a * // par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase even if it does arise means that it is unstable, and so one is distracted before one has completed the results of eloquence, such as speaking.

original: 'on te bar du yang dag par rgyu ba ma yin na rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te bar du yang dag par rgyu ba ma yin na rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not continue to flow, it will be destroyed.

original: glal ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: glal ba zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase yawning means pride.

original: kho bo cag gis bri ba la sogs pa 'di la shin tu mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal gyis gus pas 'dri ba la sogs pa yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis bri ba la sogs pa 'di la shin tu mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal gyis gus pas 'dri ba la sogs pa yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: One does not properly accomplish the practice of asking questions and so on with the pride that thinks I am very skilled at writing and so on.

original: rgod pa dang steg cing zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: rgod pa dang steg cing zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: The phrase with haughtiness and conceit is an alternative reading.

original: de la ston pa ni rgod pa'am phan tshun du nye bar rgod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni rgod pa'am phan tshun du nye bar rgod pa'o //
translated: Here, teacher means one who is excited or who is excited by others.

original: steg cing zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du yongs su rgod pa 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: steg cing zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du yongs su rgod pa 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Proud means one who is excited by others and has increased excitement.

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa la rtogs pas yid gzhan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa la rtogs pas yid gzhan nyid kyis so //
translated: Distracted mind means by conceptualizing objects, etc., with another mind.

original: kun chub par byed ces pa ni mtha' bstan pa'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: kun chub par byed ces pa ni mtha' bstan pa'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One who is intent on should be understood as one who is intent on explaining in order to indicate the end, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gzhan la song ba'i lta ba can no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos gzhan la song ba'i lta ba can no //
translated: One who is associated with another consciousness means one who has a view that goes to another treatise.

original: rnam par shes pa phan tshun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la phan tshun du sems bsrung ba'i don du bri bar byed kyi dad pas ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phan tshun dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la phan tshun du sems bsrung ba'i don du bri bar byed kyi dad pas ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One who is associated with other consciousnesses in the recitation means one who writes for the sake of protecting the mind from others, not out of faith. This is the meaning.

original: dran pa mi thob na zhes bya ba ni bri ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa mi thob na zhes bya ba ni bri ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: If mindfulness is not obtained means the object of writing, etc.

original: phan tshun bzhad gad byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun bzhad gad byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: They laugh and joke with each other, etc.

original: sngar ni kun chub par byed ces bya ba bstan pas bri ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa thams cad gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar ni kun chub par byed ces bya ba bstan pas bri ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa thams cad gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In the previous verse, they should be made to memorize indicates that all the activities of writing, memorizing, etc. are to be included.

original: 'dir ni bri ba gcig pu zhes bya ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: 'dir ni bri ba gcig pu zhes bya ba'i bye brag go //
translated: Here, writing is a particular case.

original: gang du yang sngar rgod pa dang co 'dri ba zhes mi 'don pa de shin tu 'brel ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang du yang sngar rgod pa dang co 'dri ba zhes mi 'don pa de shin tu 'brel ba nyid do //
translated: Where it is not recited as they should be made to memorize, that is a very good connection.

original: mi g-yang zhing yi ger 'dri na zhes bya ba ni 'di dang der ro //
analyzed: mi g-yang zhing yi ger 'dri na zhes bya ba ni 'di dang der ro //
translated: Writing, etc. is here and there.

original: tshogs pa dang mi mthun par gyur na zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang mi mthun par gyur na zhes bya ba ni //
translated: When there is a disagreement in the assembly,

original: ji tsam tshogs pa la po ti 'gugs par byed pa de tsam la ma tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji tsam tshogs pa la po ti 'gugs par byed pa de tsam la ma tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: as much as the assembly is summoned to the book, that much is the disagreement.

original: gting zhing zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: gting zhing zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: Deeply, means with superior aspiration.

original: myang ba pa ni don rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: myang ba pa ni don rtogs pa'o //
translated: Tasting, means understanding the meaning.

original: lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni grong dang ming la sogs pa rnams kyis grong la sogs pa 'di zhes bya ba la skye ba rnyed nas byang chub thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni grong dang ming la sogs pa rnams kyis grong la sogs pa 'di zhes bya ba la skye ba rnyed nas byang chub thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The prediction is the prediction of the name of the city, etc. You will attain enlightenment after obtaining birth in such and such a city, etc.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dir ma smos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni 'dir ma smos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is clarified by it is not mentioned here, etc.

original: bskal pa de snyed du zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa la nye @173b bar gyur pa de tsam gyi bskal pa rnams so //
analyzed: bskal pa de snyed du zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa la nye @173b bar gyur pa de tsam gyi bskal pa rnams so //
translated: For so many eons means for just so many eons as the generation of the thought is proximate.

original: slar rnal 'byor nyid du bya bar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni slar de tsam gyi bskal pa rnams kyis yongs su smin pa thob par 'gyur te shes rab nyam chung bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slar rnal 'byor nyid du bya bar 'gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni slar de tsam gyi bskal pa rnams kyis yongs su smin pa thob par 'gyur te shes rab nyam chung bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For so many eons again, one must be engaged in yoga means for just so many eons again, one will attain maturity, due to the weakness of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang rjes su mthun pa rnams la'o //
translated: The mundane and supramundane refers to those that are in accord with omniscience.

original: nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will not attain deliverance‚Äù means they will not be born there.

original: brjod 'dod pa'i sems kyis bor nas lus ngag dag gis nges 'byung gi mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: brjod 'dod pa'i sems kyis bor nas lus ngag dag gis nges 'byung gi mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Having cast aside the mind that desires to speak, they go to the end of deliverance with their bodies and speech.

original: de ltar blo chung ba de dag zhes bya bas nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar blo chung ba de dag zhes bya bas nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, those of little intelligence‚Äù is the summary.

original: yal ga zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yal ga zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBranches‚Äù means

original: phyogs gcig pa'i ye shes don du gnyer pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas mdo la sogs pa rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa'i ye shes don du gnyer pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas mdo la sogs pa rigs pa yin te /
translated: the s≈´tras and so on are reasonable for those who seek the wisdom of one part.

original: 'di nyid la dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: The example for this is stated:

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is like this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: zan gong ni bza' ba'o //
analyzed: zan gong ni bza' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFood‚Äù is what is eaten.

original: zan kham ni kham zan no //
analyzed: zan kham ni kham zan no //
translated: ‚ÄúA morsel of food‚Äù is a mouthful of food.

original: btsal bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa slong ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: btsal bar sems pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa slong ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThinking of searching‚Äù means because of the power of begging for inferior food.

original: de yang khyi ni rnyed par sla ba dang mngar ba bdag po'i zan chang rnam par spangs nas /
analyzed: de yang khyi ni rnyed par sla ba dang mngar ba bdag po'i zan chang rnam par spangs nas /
translated: Moreover, a dog, having easily found food, abandons the sweet food of its master,

original: las byed pa'i zan kham 'dod par gyur ba rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las byed pa'i zan kham 'dod par gyur ba rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: and does not find the morsel of food that is desired by the one who works.

original: chung ba'am mngar ba ma yin pa rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ba'am mngar ba ma yin pa rnyed pa yin te /
translated: The root is the great fruit, the attainment of the great, or the attainment of the sweet.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied here.

original: rtsa ba 'di bor te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar shing gi rtsa ba la sbyar ba'i shing thams cad kyi 'bras bu la dbang ba nyid do //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'di bor te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar shing gi rtsa ba la sbyar ba'i shing thams cad kyi 'bras bu la dbang ba nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Having abandoned the root‚Äù means that, just as the root of a tree is the source of all the fruits of the tree,

original: gang zhig rtsa ba bor nas yal ga 'dzin par byed pa de rnams kyi phyogs ni phyogs gcig pa'i 'bras bu'i skal ba can zhes de rnams kyis gtso bo'i 'bras bu ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rtsa ba bor nas yal ga 'dzin par byed pa de rnams kyi phyogs ni phyogs gcig pa'i 'bras bu'i skal ba can zhes de rnams kyis gtso bo'i 'bras bu ma thob pa'o //
translated: those who abandon the root and grasp the branches are partial to the fruit, and they do not obtain the fruit of the main part.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i rtsa ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i rtsa ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma ste /
translated: In the same way, the root of obtaining all the fruits is the Bhagavatƒ´.

original: de dor nas yal ga dang 'dra ba'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la dmigs pas sangs rgyas nyid la thob pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dor nas yal ga dang 'dra ba'i nyan thos kyi theg pa la dmigs pas sangs rgyas nyid la thob pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having abandoned that, those who grasp the branches, which are the objects of the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna, do not obtain buddhahood.

original: lo ma dang 'dab ma lta bu ni lo ma'i tshogs te /
analyzed: lo ma dang 'dab ma lta bu ni lo ma'i tshogs te /
translated: The leaves are the collection of leaves.

original: 'dab ma lta bu'i mdo sde rnams la mngon par brtson pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dab ma lta bu'i mdo sde rnams la mngon par brtson pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are diligent in the s≈´tras that are like leaves.

original: dul bar bya ba ni dbang po lnga 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dul bar bya ba ni dbang po lnga 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Subduing is for the sake of subduing the five faculties.

original: zhi bar bya ba ni sems 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi bar bya ba ni sems 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pacifying is for the sake of subduing the mind.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba ni srid pa gzhan zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba ni srid pa gzhan zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Complete nirvana is for the sake of exhausting other existences.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis mngon par 'du byed pa ni @174a * //üîΩsgrub pa rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis mngon par 'du byed pa ni @174a * // sgrub pa rnams so //
translated: All wholesome roots are the practices.

original: de'i don du sbyor ba ni bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: de'i don du sbyor ba ni bya ba rnams so //
translated: For their sake, the applications are the activities.

original: de rlom sems su yang mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de rlom sems su yang mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not become conceited about them.

original: de rnams dang bdag nyid ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams dang bdag nyid ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they and oneself are not observed.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs tshol te zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang rnam pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs tshol te zhes bya ba ni dbyibs dang rnam pa'o //
translated: Seeking color and shape means shape and appearance.

original: snang ba ga la ba der zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba ga la ba der zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Where there is light means together with light.

original: brtags so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: brtags so zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Investigated means seen.

original: glang po che'i rjes zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i rjes kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i rjes zhes bya ba ni glang po che'i rjes kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The ‚Äúelephant‚Äôs footprint‚Äù is the sign of the elephant‚Äôs footprint.

original: bdag gcig pu dul ba dang zhi bar gnas pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu dul ba dang zhi bar gnas pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúI alone will be tamed, peaceful, and will attain nirvana.‚Äù

original: brjod pa ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo speak‚Äù means to engage in.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù and so on.

original: nang du yang dag gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: nang du yang dag gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: ‚ÄúInner correct placement‚Äù is meditative stabilization.

original: tshe 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni skye ba thob pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid las zhes bya ba ni skye ba thob pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this very life‚Äù means in the very attainment of birth.

original: len pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yongs su mi 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: len pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yongs su mi 'dzin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout grasping‚Äù means without grasping anything at all.

original: spro ba chung ba la sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba ni don chung ngu la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: spro ba chung ba la sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba ni don chung ngu la sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not generate your mind toward those of little enthusiasm‚Äù means do not apply yourself to those of little purpose.

original: dus rtag tu zhes bya ba ni ji srid byang chub kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dus rtag tu zhes bya ba ni ji srid byang chub kyi bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means until enlightenment.

original: rgyun ni rgyun yang yin la skye ba re rer 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun ni rgyun yang yin la skye ba re rer 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúStream‚Äù means a stream, because it occurs in each birth.

original: mi 'chad pa yang yin te zhag rer 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'chad pa yang yin te zhag rer 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also not interrupted, because it occurs every day.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni mtha' yas pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i mdo sde ni ma yin zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ni mtha' yas pa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu yin gyi nyan thos la sogs pa'i mdo sde ni ma yin zhes ston to //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom itself is the cause of the knowledge of all aspects, which has the form of infinite good qualities, but not the s≈´tras of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: de nyid gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That itself is stated with ‚ÄúIt is thus, etc.‚Äù

original: shing mkhan ni shing gi bzo bo'o //
analyzed: shing mkhan ni shing gi bzo bo'o //
translated: A carpenter is a woodworker.

original: ri rab kyi rgyab tu brgya byin gyi blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba'i gser las byas pa'i grong khyer ro //
analyzed: ri rab kyi rgyab tu brgya byin gyi blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba'i gser las byas pa'i grong khyer ro //
translated: Behind Mount Meru is ≈öakra‚Äôs city called Lovely, made of gold.

original: de'i dbus su rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i khang bzangs te /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i khang bzangs te /
translated: In the middle of that is a palace called Victorious,

original: logs re rer dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: logs re rer dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: with two hundred and fifty yojanas on each side.

original: gcig tu bsdus na dpag tshad stong ngo //
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus na dpag tshad stong ngo //
translated: When added together, it is one thousand yojanas.

original: ri rab kyi phyed nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi gzhal yas khang zlum po rim pa ji lta bar dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang lnga bcu dbus kyi thig gis de'i dbus su de dag gi khang bzangs ni sa chen po ste /
analyzed: ri rab kyi phyed nas nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi gzhal yas khang zlum po rim pa ji lta bar dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang lnga bcu dbus kyi thig gis de'i dbus su de dag gi khang bzangs ni sa chen po ste /
translated: The celestial mansion of the gods is the great earth.

original: de bas na 'dir de dag gi khang bzangs brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir de dag gi khang bzangs brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the celestial mansion of the gods will be described here.

original: de yang rnam par rgyal ba las shin tu yang nyung ba'i tshad do //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rgyal ba las shin tu yang nyung ba'i tshad do //
translated: It is much smaller than the one described in the Abhidharma.

original: mngon par ston pa ni thob par @174b byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ston pa ni thob par @174b byed pa'o //
translated: The word display means to attain.

original: 'jig rten du 'khor los sgyur bas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'khor los sgyur bas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: One who turns the wheel in the world is a wheel-turner.

original: 'khor lo de yang skyes bus ma byas pa rtsibs stong lte ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo de yang skyes bus ma byas pa rtsibs stong lte ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That wheel is not made by a person, has a thousand spokes, and a hub.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba skye ba med pa la chos bzangs lha'i 'dun sa na 'chang ba yod do //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba skye ba med pa la chos bzangs lha'i 'dun sa na 'chang ba yod do //
translated: The wheel-turning king is not born, but it exists in the assembly hall of the gods called SudharmƒÅ.

original: gang gi tshe 'khor los sgyur ba 'dzam bu'i gling du skyes na de'i tshe des legs par khrus byas pa dang bsnyen gnas bzung ba'i mdun du chos bzangs nas 'ongs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khor los sgyur ba 'dzam bu'i gling du skyes na de'i tshe des legs par khrus byas pa dang bsnyen gnas bzung ba'i mdun du chos bzangs nas 'ongs te /
translated: When a universal monarch is born in Jambudvƒ´pa, he first bathes well and then takes up the one-day precepts.

original: nam mkha' la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, while in the sky, he is approached by the deity of good fortune.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba ni lnga ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of universal monarchs:

original: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang gling bzhi la dbang ba rnams dang mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang gling bzhi la dbang ba rnams dang mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du 'gro ba'o //
translated: those who rule over one, two, three, or four continents, and those who go to the world of the gods.

original: 'di rnams kyi 'khor lo yang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du lcags dang / zangs dang / dngul dang / gser dang / gser mdog la sogs pa skyes pa 'dzam bu'i chu bo dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi 'khor lo yang rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du lcags dang / zangs dang / dngul dang / gser dang / gser mdog la sogs pa skyes pa 'dzam bu'i chu bo dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Their wheels are made of iron, copper, silver, gold, and gold with a golden rim, respectively.

original: dbyibs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa gzi brjid ni mi thams cad zil gyis gnon pa mthu dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ni rdzu 'phrul dang phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa gzi brjid ni mi thams cad zil gyis gnon pa mthu dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ni rdzu 'phrul dang phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Their shapes are those of great beings endowed with the thirty-two marks. Their splendor surpasses that of all others. Their power and halo of light are perfect.

original: khyad par du mi rin po che bdun te /
analyzed: khyad par du mi rin po che bdun te /
translated: In particular, there are seven kinds of precious human beings:

original: 'khor lo dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / bud med dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag dang / nor bu rin po che rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / bud med dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag dang / nor bu rin po che rnams so //
translated: the precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious steward, and the precious minister.

original: 'ching bar byed pa ni rmongs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching bar byed pa ni rmongs par byed pa'o //
translated: They are fettered by delusion.

original: yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir dang gzhan nyid kyi phyir 'ching bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir dang gzhan nyid kyi phyir 'ching bar byed pa'o //
translated: They are fettered because they are not clear and because they are different.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub pa de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is established in the cause of the establishment of the bodhisattva.

original: thob cing zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: thob cing zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa tsam gyis so //
translated: Having obtained means having merely found.

original: bsgrubs nas ni thob pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas ni thob pa la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Having accomplished means having attained and so on.

original: bor te zhes bya ba ni dor nas so //
analyzed: bor te zhes bya ba ni dor nas so //
translated: Having abandoned means having rejected.

original: rnam par 'gyur nas zhes bya ba ni rgyab phyogs su byas nas so //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur nas zhes bya ba ni rgyab phyogs su byas nas so //
translated: Having changed means having turned away.

original: ro ni drug ste /
analyzed: ro ni drug ste /
translated: There are six tastes:üîΩsweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: rdzas kyi dbye ba dang phan tshun du 'dres par brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas kyi dbye ba dang phan tshun du 'dres par brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: They become one hundred through the division of substances and their mutual mixture.

original: de bas na kha zas ro brgya pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na kha zas ro brgya pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the food is of a hundred flavors.

original: zhag drug cu pa'i zhes bya ba ni nub drug cus smin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhag drug cu pa'i zhes bya ba ni nub drug cus smin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The sixty-day is that which is ripened by sixty nights.

original: de rnams kyi 'bras chan ni drug cu pa'i 'bras chan te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'bras chan ni drug cu pa'i 'bras chan te /
translated: The rice of those is the rice of the sixty-day.

original: sha kan rgyu la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir 'og tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sha kan rgyu la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir 'og tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since the veins, etc. are seen, it is below.

original: zhu na phan pa zhu na bde pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du de'i mthar thug par zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhu na phan pa zhu na bde pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du de'i mthar thug par zhes snga ma dang 'brel to //
translated: If it is asked, it is beneficial; if it is asked, it is pleasant.

original: bor te @175a * //üîΩzhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: bor te @175a * // zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: Having abandoned it,üîΩhaving rejected it,

original: rnam par spangs nas zhes bya ba ni lus kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par spangs nas zhes bya ba ni lus kyis so //
translated: having rejected it,

original: zab mo ni don dam pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: zab mo ni don dam pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: the profound is the peak of the ultimate.

original: 'od gsal ba ni mchog tu dri ma dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni mchog tu dri ma dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid kyis snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is luminous because it is the nature of light due to the appearance of suchness that is supremely free from stains.

original: mang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: mang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa mang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: It becomes manifold means the many types of conceptual thoughts.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa la da ltar yang dag par shes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa la da ltar yang dag par shes so //
translated: He knows that the mind is distracted because of the non-conceptuality of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma bris pa la bar chad mang bas de bri ba la mngon par zhen ba bdud kyi las zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩde skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma bris pa la bar chad mang bas de bri ba la mngon par zhen ba bdud kyi las zhes gsungs pa ni / de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Lord has said that the work of Mara is the strong attachment to writing when there are many obstacles to what is not written.

original: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam gyi 'bras su'i rang bzhin te gzugs kyi khyad par gyi tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lam gyi 'bras su'i rang bzhin te gzugs kyi khyad par gyi tha snyad kyi mtshan nyid can ni ma yin te /
translated: When this had been said, Subhuti said to the Lord: How, O Lord, does the work of Mara arise when the perfection of wisdom is being written?üîΩ The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the work of Mara is the strong attachment to writing when the perfection of wisdom is being written.

original: yi ge 'brur 'dri bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge 'brur 'dri bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: For the perfection of wisdom is not something that can be written in letters.

original: rab 'byor gang su dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yi ge 'brur bris nas zhes bya ba ste /üîΩyi ge med pa'o snyam nas yi ge med pa'o zhes bya ba rlom sems su 'gyur pa de thams cad bdud kyi las te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang su dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yi ge 'brur bris nas zhes bya ba ste /üîΩyi ge med pa'o snyam nas yi ge med pa'o zhes bya ba rlom sems su 'gyur pa de thams cad bdud kyi las te /
translated: Subhuti: When someone, O Lord, writes the perfection of wisdom, how much merit does he thereby create?üîΩ The Lord: If, Subhuti, a son or daughter of good family would establish all the beings of Jambudvipa, as many as they are, in the ten paths of wholesome action, would he on the strength of that create a great deal of merit?

original: gang gi phyir de 'dri ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'dri ba med pa ste /
translated: Because it is not an object of inquiry.

original: gzugs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not an object of inquiry because it is free from form.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent,

original: don dam par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists ultimately.

original: yi ge yang ma yin te brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge yang ma yin te brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a letter, because it is inexpressible.

original: yi ge med pa yang ma yin te kun rdzob tu yi ge rnams nyid de'i don gyis dmigs nas de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yul ni ma la ba la sogs pa ste brgya'am stong ngam 'bum gyis grangs byas pa'i khyim mo //
analyzed: yi ge med pa yang ma yin te kun rdzob tu yi ge rnams nyid de'i don gyis dmigs nas de rtogs pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yul ni ma la ba la sogs pa ste brgya'am stong ngam 'bum gyis grangs byas pa'i khyim mo //
translated: It is not without letters, because letters themselves are the means of understanding it, since they are the conventional symbols for its meaning.üîΩA country is a collection of villages, towns, cities, forests, and wildernesses.

original: grong ni phyug po ma yin pa rnams kyi gnas so //
analyzed: grong ni phyug po ma yin pa rnams kyi gnas so //
translated: A village is a collection of houses, either a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand in number.

original: stong ngam 'bum gyis grangs byas pa'i khyim ni gnas so //
analyzed: stong ngam 'bum gyis grangs byas pa'i khyim ni gnas so //
translated: A town is a collection of houses, either a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand in number.

original: skyed mos tshal ni phal cher grong khyer ro //üîΩgrong rdal ni grong khyer nyid tshong pas mang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal ni phal cher grong khyer ro // grong rdal ni grong khyer nyid tshong pas mang bar byas pa'o //
translated: A forest is a collection of trees.üîΩA wilderness is a place where there are no human habitations.

original: ljongs ni rdo 'jog la sogs pa'o //üîΩde'i tshogs ni yul 'khor ro //
analyzed: ljongs ni rdo 'jog la sogs pa'o //üîΩde'i tshogs ni yul 'khor ro //
translated: A country is a collection of villages, towns, cities, forests, and wildernesses.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang ni rgyal pos bsten par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang ni rgyal pos bsten par byas pa'o //
translated: The king's palace is the king's residence.

original: kun tu ston pa ni tshig lhug pa'i snyan dngags so //
analyzed: kun tu ston pa ni tshig lhug pa'i snyan dngags so //
translated: Exposition is poetry in prose.

original: ba shi kh'a ni lam mo //
analyzed: ba shi kh'a ni lam mo //
translated: Bashfulness is the path.

original: shi pi ka ni shi ba khur ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: shi pi ka ni shi ba khur ba'i phyogs so //
translated: A ship is a side that carries a load.

original: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang mi ldan pa yid la byed pa ni dga' ba rnams dang yang @175b dag par sbyor bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba dang mi ldan pa yid la byed pa ni dga' ba rnams dang yang @175b dag par sbyor bar 'dod pas so //
translated: The attention of the friend, the enemy, and the neutral is the desire to unite with the loved ones,

original: mi dga' ba dang bral bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: mi dga' ba dang bral bar 'dod pas so //
translated: the desire to separate from the unloved,

original: mi ldan pa ni nges par phangs pa'i gang zhig yid la byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi ldan pa ni nges par phangs pa'i gang zhig yid la byed pa rnams so //
translated: and the desire to remain as one is with those who are neither loved nor unloved.

original: 'tsho ba'i don du yo byad rnams ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i don du yo byad rnams ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad do //
translated: The necessities of life are the requisites of life.

original: bzhad gad ni sngon gyi gtam mo //
analyzed: bzhad gad ni sngon gyi gtam mo //
translated: A joke is a story of the past.

original: la gcan gyi cho lo ni cho lo ste lta ba ni tha snyad du de lta ba'o //
analyzed: la gcan gyi cho lo ni cho lo ste lta ba ni tha snyad du de lta ba'o //
translated: Dice are the play of dice.

original: bar chad byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par grags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par grags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: To be a hindrance means to be notorious.

original: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Gain is the acquisition of robes, etc.

original: bkur sti ni gus pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni gus pa'o //
translated: Respect is reverence.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //
translated: Verse is fame.

original: de rnams kyi ro myang ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ro myang ba ni khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The taste of those is superior.

original: chog shes med pa dang 'dod pa che ba la sogs pa la sbyor bas bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: chog shes med pa dang 'dod pa che ba la sogs pa la sbyor bas bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: Lack of contentment and great desire, etc. are obstacles.

original: sems la gdung ba ni chos gos la sogs pas phongs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sems la gdung ba ni chos gos la sogs pas phongs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Mental anguish is from the lack of Dharma robes, etc.

original: zab mo zab pa dag ces bya ba ni 'dir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid zab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zab mo zab pa dag ces bya ba ni 'dir chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid zab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The profound and the very profound means that here, the profundity of the emptiness of all phenomena is not the profundity.

original: 'on kyang gang zag gi bdag med pa bstan pa nyid de mu stegs pa rnams la de'i dbang gis 'os pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zag gi bdag med pa bstan pa nyid de mu stegs pa rnams la de'i dbang gis 'os pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: However, the teaching of the selflessness of persons is profound because of the suitability of that for the tƒ´rthikas.

original: dge slong gi cha byad kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i ngag blang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi cha byad kyis zhes bya ba ni de'i ngag blang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in the guise of a monk means that they are to be accepted.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa la yang ji ltar rnyed pa rnams la 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa nye bar bstan pa la yang ji ltar rnyed pa rnams la 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Also, in the teaching of emptiness, etc., it is said that those who have attained have desire.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la yang gang zag gi bdag med pa la sogs ltos pas 'du byed thams cad bdag dang bral ba nyid kyis yid la byed cing stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin las mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba nyid du yid
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnams la yang gang zag gi bdag med pa la sogs ltos pas 'du byed thams cad bdag dang bral ba nyid kyis yid la byed cing stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin las mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba nyid du yid
translated: One focuses on nirvana as peace by way of the concentration of emptiness.

original: la byed cing de'i 'du byed mtshan ma med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: la byed cing de'i 'du byed mtshan ma med pa nyid kyi phyir mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Since the formative forces of that concentration are signless, it is the concentration of signlessness.

original: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi smon pa'i yul zhes smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi smon pa'i yul zhes smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Since the object of aspiration is the suffering of all formations, it is the concentration of aspirationlessness.üîΩThese concentrations also arise.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams kyang 'byung ba yin nom / chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni las dang po pa la skyon dang bcas pa ste rang gi dman pa'i byang chub la ltung ba yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di rnams kyang 'byung ba yin nom / chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ni las dang po pa la skyon dang bcas pa ste rang gi dman pa'i byang chub la ltung ba yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is flawed for beginners because it causes them to fall to the lower vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyis so sor kun tu rtog pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang snying rjes sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa de byang chub chen po thob pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa ste /üîΩde rnams la med ces dman pa'i @176a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid kyis so sor kun tu rtog pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang snying rjes sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa de byang chub chen po thob pa'i phyir thabs la mkhas pa ste / de rnams la med ces dman pa'i @176a * //
translated: When the bodhisattva, by means of the perfection of wisdom itself and the emptiness of all dharmas, individually understands the perfection of generosity and so on through conventional knowledge and compassion, that is skill in means for attaining great enlightenment.

original: byang chub la ltung ba'i dogs pas rnam pa thams cad du de rnams bsal ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub la ltung ba'i dogs pas rnam pa thams cad du de rnams bsal ba'o //
translated: They do not exist means that the bodhisattva, fearing a fall into inferior enlightenment, completely eliminates them all.

original: 'di'i 'og tu bral ba rnams ni phal cher brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i 'og tu bral ba rnams ni phal cher brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: After this, the separations are mostly to be expressed.

original: de rnams chos smra ba pos chos thos pa rnams dang lhan cig tu tshogs pa dang bral ba'i chos kyi smra ba po ni smra ba po'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: de rnams chos smra ba pos chos thos pa rnams dang lhan cig tu tshogs pa dang bral ba'i chos kyi smra ba po ni smra ba po'i bla ma'o //
translated: The Dharma teacher who is separated from the assembly of those who have heard the Dharma together with the Dharma teacher is the teacher's guru.

original: chos nyan pa dag ni chos thos pa la dgos pa 'di la yod pas na chos thos pa ste slob ma'o //
analyzed: chos nyan pa dag ni chos thos pa la dgos pa 'di la yod pas na chos thos pa ste slob ma'o //
translated: The listeners are the disciples who listen to the Dharma, because they have a need for listening to the Dharma.

original: tshogs pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshogs pa dang bral bas zhes bya ba la /
translated: The absence of an assembly is due to the absence of a collection.

original: tshogs rnams kyi ngo bo ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs rnams kyi ngo bo ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: An assembly is the nature of a collection.

original: de log pa las tshogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de log pa las tshogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of an assembly is due to the absence of a collection.

original: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni 'dod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Desire is the possession of desire.

original: snyom las ni le lo'o //
analyzed: snyom las ni le lo'o //
translated: Laziness is the possession of laziness.

original: phal cher khyim pa rnams la bya ba mang ba nyid do //
analyzed: phal cher khyim pa rnams la bya ba mang ba nyid do //
translated: For the most part, householders have many activities.

original: tha na zhes bya ba ni lhag pa med pa la bri bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: tha na zhes bya ba ni lhag pa med pa la bri bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù indicates that he wishes to reduce the number.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sgra shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sgra shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúunderstanding‚Äù is used because of the knowledge of sound.

original: dran pa dang ldan pa ni gnyi ga 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa ni gnyi ga 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúremembrance‚Äù is used because of the retention of both.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni las dang byed pa po la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni las dang byed pa po la sbyor ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúgoing‚Äù is used because of the connection between action and agent.

original: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he goes.

original: 'dis ni nyan pa po'i 'dun pa'i yul las ston pa po'i 'dun pa tha dad pa'i yul nyid mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan pa po'i 'dun pa'i yul las ston pa po'i 'dun pa tha dad pa'i yul nyid mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: This shows that the object of the teacher's intention is different from the object of the listener's intention.

original: mgo smos pas go ba ni spyir brjod pa la khyad par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgo smos pas go ba ni spyir brjod pa la khyad par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Understanding through a mere indication is understanding the specific meaning from the general expression.

original: spros te go ba ni cung zad rnam par phye nas ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros te go ba ni cung zad rnam par phye nas ma lus pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Understanding through elaboration is understanding the whole from a partial explanation.

original: mngon par shes pa ni tshig la rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni tshig la rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Understanding through superknowledge is understanding the words through concentration.

original: de ni gang zhig brjod pa de nyid shes pa ste lhag ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang zhig brjod pa de nyid shes pa ste lhag ma ni ma yin no //
translated: That is, one understands only what is expressed, not the rest.

original: zang zing lhur byed pa ni zang zing ni rdzas te de lhur byed pa ni mang bar rlom sems 'di la yod pas na zang zing lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing lhur byed pa ni zang zing ni rdzas te de lhur byed pa ni mang bar rlom sems 'di la yod pas na zang zing lhur byed pa'o //
translated: One who is devoted to material things is one who is devoted to material things, i.e., goods, because of the conceit of abundance.

original: de bzhin du chos gos la sogs pa lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos gos la sogs pa lhur byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, one who is devoted to robes, etc.

original: 'dod pa chung ba ni ci tsam gyis rang nyid 'jug pa de tsam 'dod pas na 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba ni ci tsam gyis rang nyid 'jug pa de tsam 'dod pas na 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: One who has few desires is one who has few desires because he desires only what is necessary for himself.

original: chog shes pa ni lhag pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chog shes pa ni lhag pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who is content is one who does not desire more.

original: rab tu dben pa ni mang ba dang lhan cig tu mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa ni mang ba dang lhan cig tu mi rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very secluded means not beginning together with many.

original: dad par gyur cing 'di brtsam par 'dod pa ni sgra las so //
analyzed: dad par gyur cing 'di brtsam par 'dod pa ni sgra las so //
translated: One who has faith and wishes to begin this is from the sound.

original: don khong du chud par 'dod pa ni don las so //
analyzed: don khong du chud par 'dod pa ni don las so //
translated: One who wishes to understand the meaning is from the meaning.

original: nor yongs su btang bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su btang bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: nor yongs su btang bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su btang bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: One who wishes to give up wealth is from giving up.

original: ltos pa med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because one gives without regard.

original: chos smra ba po ni 'chad par mi 'gyur te dad pa dang @176b mi ldan pa'i phyir dang nor don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir dang chos la ser sna yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos smra ba po ni 'chad par mi 'gyur te dad pa dang @176b mi ldan pa'i phyir dang nor don du mi gnyer ba'i phyir dang chos la ser sna yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma teacher will not explain because of lack of faith, lack of interest in wealth, and stinginess with the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, furthermore, etc.

original: mdo sde de rnams ni nyan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde de rnams ni nyan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Those s≈´tras are what is wished to be heard.

original: chos kyi bar chad du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi bar chad du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Regarding obstructions to the Dharma,

original: chos kyi bar chad ni tshogs pa dang mi ldan pas nyan pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi bar chad ni tshogs pa dang mi ldan pas nyan pa med pa'o //
translated: obstructions to the Dharma are not listening due to lack of assembly.

original: de 'di la yod pas na chos kyi bar chad du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de 'di la yod pas na chos kyi bar chad du gyur pa ste /
translated: Since that exists here, it is obstructions to the Dharma.

original: de'i dngos pos so //
analyzed: de'i dngos pos so //
translated: by its reality.

original: med pa'am zhes bya ba ni yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'am zhes bya ba ni yod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Not existing means not becoming existent.

original: mi 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan nas 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan nas 'ong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Not entering means not coming from elsewhere.

original: ma rnyed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba ma thob pa'o //
translated: The Dharma that is not found is the non-attainment of the Dharma preacher.

original: mi mthun pa brjod pa ni mi mthun pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa brjod pa ni mi mthun pa brjod pa'o //
