translated: The expression of disagreement is the expression of disagreement.

original: sdug bsngal thos pas yid mi 'byung zhing bar chad gsungs pa ni /üîΩrab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩsems can dmyal ba'i mi bsngags pa brjod ces bya ba ni shin tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thos pas yid mi 'byung zhing bar chad gsungs pa ni / rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / sems can dmyal ba'i mi bsngags pa brjod ces bya ba ni shin tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dmyal ba'o //
translated: The expression of the suffering that is heard is the expression of the suffering that is heard.üîΩThe expression of the obstacles is the expression of the obstacles.üîΩThe expression of the suffering of the hells is the expression of the suffering of the hells.

original: phan tshun du zab la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas so //
analyzed: phan tshun du zab la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dud 'gro'i skye gnas so //
translated: The expression of the suffering of the animals is the expression of the suffering of the animals.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yi dgas rnams so //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yi dgas rnams so //
translated: The expression of the suffering of the hungry ghosts is the expression of the suffering of the hungry ghosts.

original: nga rgyal gyis mnan pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa lha ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis mnan pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa lha ma yin no //
translated: The expression of the suffering of the demigods is the expression of the suffering of the demigods.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa 'du byed rnams thams cad do //üîΩrab 'byor 'di yang zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa 'du byed rnams thams cad do // rab 'byor 'di yang zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: All formations are endowed with the suffering of birth, etc.üîΩThis also, Subhuti, is a deed of Mara, which Mara, the Evil One, has done and caused to be done, in order to deprive a Bodhisattva,

original: bdud kyi las zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yid 'byung bas so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yid 'byung bas so //
translated: a great being, of the supreme enlightenment.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir lha'i bdag nyid kyi longs spyod rnams la yang slar 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid nye bar bstan nas bde blag tu yid 'byung zhing bar chad gsungs pa ni gzhan yang
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir lha'i bdag nyid kyi longs spyod rnams la yang slar 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid nye bar bstan nas bde blag tu yid 'byung zhing bar chad gsungs pa ni gzhan yang
translated: Having taught the suffering of the formative forces in regard to the enjoyments of the gods, etc. through the arising of disgust with suffering, he now teaches the suffering of suffering in regard to the hells, etc. in order to easily generate disgust and in order to ward off the obstacles.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He says, and so on.

original: srid par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbye ba khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: srid par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i dbye ba khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The establishment of existence refers to the differentiation of existence, which is characterized by the realms, destinies and modes of birth.

original: rab 'byor de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdud kyi las rnams ni mang ba nyid dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyis yongs su dor ba nyid dang / bdud kyis de rnams la mngon par brtson pa'i rgyu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdud kyi las rnams ni mang ba nyid dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyis yongs su dor ba nyid dang / bdud kyis de rnams la mngon par brtson pa'i rgyu gsungs pa ni /
translated: The causes of Mara's striving in those are stated by the Buddha.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: bdud dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs nas the tshom za pas spong ba'i skyon @177a * //
analyzed: bdud dge sbyong gi cha byad du 'ongs nas the tshom za pas spong ba'i skyon @177a * //
translated: Mara, having come in the guise of an ascetic, causes doubt and thus the fault of abandoning.

original: no // rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: no // rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: dge slong gi cha byad du sprul pa'i bdud kyis byas pa'i chos spyod pa rnams la dman pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ni skyon no //
analyzed: dge slong gi cha byad du sprul pa'i bdud kyis byas pa'i chos spyod pa rnams la dman pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ni skyon no //
translated: The fault is that Mara, having emanated in the guise of a monk, prophesies the lesser enlightenment of those who practice the Dharma.

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis don bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis don bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The four topics are stated by Thus, Subhuti, etc., up to the end of the chapter.

original: bdud kyi las rnams kyi mang ba nyid dang / de'i rgyu dang / de rnams la 'jigs par gyur pa na blo chung ba nyid la sogs pa dang / ji ltar yang bdud kyis de rnams la mngon par brtson ba ni de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams kyi mang ba nyid dang / de'i rgyu dang / de rnams la 'jigs par gyur pa na blo chung ba nyid la sogs pa dang / ji ltar yang bdud kyis de rnams la mngon par brtson ba ni de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa' yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The many kinds of activities of Mara, their causes, and the fearfulness of them, and the small-mindedness, etc., and the way in which Mara is intent on them, and the way in which all the Buddhas protect the bodhisattvas, all this is the subject matter of this chapter.

original: le'u 'di la yang tshig rnams ji snyed kho bo cag gis bshad pa de rnams thams cad ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: le'u 'di la yang tshig rnams ji snyed kho bo cag gis bshad pa de rnams thams cad ni sngon gyi po ti rnams la mthong ba yin no //
translated: And in this chapter, all the words that we have explained are found in the old manuscripts.

original: skyon drug yang ni rtogs par bya //
analyzed: skyon drug yang ni rtogs par bya //
translated: The six faults should be understood

original: bcu ba bzhi dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: bcu ba bzhi dang lhan cig tu //
translated: together with the ten and the four.

original: zhes bya ba ni chen po rnams kyis bshad pa mthong ba'i phyir 'dir bsnan pa de de lta bu zhes rnam pa mang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chen po rnams kyis bshad pa mthong ba'i phyir 'dir bsnan pa de de lta bu zhes rnam pa mang ba'o //
translated: This is added here because it is seen in the explanations of the great ones. Such is the variety.

original: bdud kyi las rnams dang de nyid ni bar du gcod pa ste de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u ste le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: bdud kyi las rnams dang de nyid ni bar du gcod pa ste de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u ste le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: The chapter that clarifies the deeds of Mara and the obstacles is the chapter on that, the eleventh.

original: // / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: // / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom gives birth to all the Buddhas.

original: de bas na 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dgongs pas kyang ci'i phyir bar du gcod pa zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir dang lhag par mos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dpe gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dgongs pas kyang ci'i phyir bar du gcod pa zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir dang lhag par mos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dpe gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, here, in order to establish the obstacles, and in order to teach the special faith, an example is stated by the intention of all the Tathagatas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, etc.

original: bu mang du yod de zhes bya bas gcig dang mang po rnams kyi ma'i dgongs pa la mnyam pa'i ma'i sdug pa'i rgyu ston par byed pa ni ma de na bar gyur na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bu mang du yod de zhes bya bas gcig dang mang po rnams kyi ma'i dgongs pa la mnyam pa'i ma'i sdug pa'i rgyu ston par byed pa ni ma de na bar gyur na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The intention of the mother of the one and the many is shown by she has many sons, and the cause of the mother's suffering is shown by if that mother should fall ill.

original: ma na bar gyur ba na'o //
analyzed: ma na bar gyur ba na'o //
translated: If the mother should fall ill.

original: reg par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni reg pa rab tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: reg par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni reg pa rab tu spyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase they would attend to her means they would serve her.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: What is unpleasant is not pleasant.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of suffering.

original: 'dir yang sdug pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid gsungs pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang sdug pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid gsungs pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, the cause of what is pleasant is stated: ‚Äúbecause of this, one experiences pleasure.‚Äù

original: legs par gzung bas 'dzin zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgyas pa rgyas par gyur na'o //
analyzed: legs par gzung bas 'dzin zhes bya ba ni shin tu rgyas pa rgyas par gyur na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy proper care‚Äù means by extensive care.

original: ji ltar rgyas par gyur ba ni ji ltar rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyas par gyur ba ni ji ltar rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow it is extended‚Äù means how it is extended.

original: sbed pa ni srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbed pa ni srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConcealment‚Äù means protection.

original: 'chos pa ni sbyang ba de nad 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'chos pa ni sbyang ba de nad 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCorrection‚Äù means the treatment that removes the disease.

original: @177b 'chos pa'i sgra ni gand'a  la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @177b 'chos pa'i sgra ni gand'a  la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcorrection‚Äù is used for a musical instrument such as a flute.

original: sdug bsngal gyis reg pa zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i reg pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis reg pa zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa las skyes pa'i sems las byung ba'i reg pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúContact with suffering‚Äù means the contact of mind that arises from the union of object, sense faculty, and consciousness.

original: de yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas na sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas na sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Since that is the cause of suffering, it is suffering.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: The classification of that is stated:

original: mig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mig gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eye and so on.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la lnga ba ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la lnga ba ste /
translated: In the old manuscripts, five is omitted.

original: mig gi'am rna ba'i zhes bya ba 'don pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi'am rna ba'i zhes bya ba 'don pa'o //
translated: It is recited as of the eye, of the ear, and so on.

original: de la rgyu'i dbye ba gsungs pa ni rlung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu'i dbye ba gsungs pa ni rlung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among them, the statement of the causal classification is wind and so on.

original: kun du 'bab pa ni mi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: kun du 'bab pa ni mi rnams kyi'o //
translated: The universal is that of humans.

original: nyam thag pa ni glo la sogs pas so //
analyzed: nyam thag pa ni glo la sogs pas so //
translated: The desperate is by means of the lungs and so on.

original: ye 'drog ces bya ba ni mi 'dod pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ye 'drog ces bya ba ni mi 'dod pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The misfortune is the connection with the undesirable.

original: bdag gir byed pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pas de la cher 'phangs pa dang gus par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gir byed pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pas de la cher 'phangs pa dang gus par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Belonging to oneself is because of the excessive attachment to that by making it one's own and the respect.

original: dpe don la sbyar bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: dpe don la sbyar bar byed pa ni /
translated: The application of the example and meaning is

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this and so on.

original: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir shes par 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir shes par 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa ni /
translated: If it is asked, Why is it called the intention?

original: gang dag de dag yi ge 'dri ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag de dag yi ge 'dri ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, Those who write those letters and so on.

original: de nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la'o //
translated: It is just that.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa med pas 'dri ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa med pas 'dri ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no intention of the Buddha, there is no asking, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata, the Bhagavat ≈öƒÅkyamuni,üîΩhowever many there are, not only the one Bhagavat ≈öƒÅkyamuni,

original: gang ji snyed ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa gcig pur ma zad kyi bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang ji snyed ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa gcig pur ma zad kyi bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: abides, because he does not pass into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'tsho zhing zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po'i rgyun gyis gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho zhing zhes bya ba ni srog gi dbang po'i rgyun gyis gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Living means remaining by the continuity of the life faculty.

original: gzhes pa zhes bya ba ni tshe ji srid gnas pa'i phyir dus gzhes pas so //
analyzed: gzhes pa zhes bya ba ni tshe ji srid gnas pa'i phyir dus gzhes pas so //
translated: Remaining means remaining for a long time because of remaining for as long as life lasts.üîΩIn order that means in whatever way.

original: ci nas kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhes gsungs pa ni 'di nyid ci nas kyang ring du gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhes gsungs pa ni 'di nyid ci nas kyang ring du gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is stated: in order that it may remain for a long time.

original: 'chos shing zhes bya ba ni snod du gyur pa'i sems can rnams la gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang bral bas rnam par dag pa'i don ring du gnas pa'i dgongs pas so //
analyzed: 'chos shing zhes bya ba ni snod du gyur pa'i sems can rnams la gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang bral bas rnam par dag pa'i don ring du gnas pa'i dgongs pas so //
translated: The phrase having created refers to the intention of abiding for a long time in the pure meaning for the sake of those sentient beings who are fit vessels, by means of the image, etc.

original: bdag gir mdzad de zhes bya ba ni 'di ni kho bo cag gi ma zhes ming mi 'jig pa'i dgongs pas so //
analyzed: bdag gir mdzad de zhes bya ba ni 'di ni kho bo cag gi ma zhes ming mi 'jig pa'i dgongs pas so //
translated: The phrase having made it his own refers to the intention of not abandoning the name mother.

original: sbed do zhes bya ba ni bar chad yongs su bsal ba'i don du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbed do zhes bya ba ni bar chad yongs su bsal ba'i don du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having concealed it refers to the intention of removing obstacles.

original: ma ji lta bu yin zhes gsungs pa ni skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ste /üîΩthams cad mkhyen @178a * //
analyzed: ma ji lta bu yin zhes gsungs pa ni skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ste / thams cad mkhyen @178a * //
translated: The question, What kind of mother? is answered by the phrase the one who gives birth.

original: pa 'di ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa 'di ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase this is the teacher of omniscience refers to the one who causes attainment.

original: 'di nyid la rgyu gsungs pa ni 'di las skyes pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid la rgyu gsungs pa ni 'di las skyes pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is stated in the phrase born from this,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: which refers to the knowledge of omniscience.

original: 'dis ni don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa zhes ston par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa skyed par byed pa zhes ston par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the ultimate tathƒÅgata as the one who gives birth. The phrase in that way refers to the one who teaches.

original: skyed par byed pa nyid kyi 'jig rten 'di kun du ston pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid kyi 'jig rten 'di kun du ston pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The entire world is shown to be the agent of production.

original: phyis bcom ldan 'das nyid rnam pa mang por ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis bcom ldan 'das nyid rnam pa mang por ston par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Later, the Blessed One will show it in many ways.

original: don gsungs pa nyid dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu gcig pa nyid kyis gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: don gsungs pa nyid dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu gcig pa nyid kyis gsungs pa ni /
translated: The meaning is stated by the Thus-Gone One of the three times, speaking with one voice:

original: rab 'byor 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, in the past, and so on.

original: 'jig rten 'di kun du ston pa zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di kun du ston pa zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it is said, The entire world is shown.

original: de bas na dri ba gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: de bas na dri ba gsungs pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the question is stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Then, and so on.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan no //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan no //
translated: Having been thus addressed, and so on, is the answer.

original: phung po lnga ji ltar bstan zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams stong pa'i phyir mthong ba mi srid cing 'dri bar byed pa ni ci zhig bstan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga ji ltar bstan zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams stong pa'i phyir mthong ba mi srid cing 'dri bar byed pa ni ci zhig bstan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How are the five aggregates to be shown? means that because the aggregates are empty, seeing is impossible. The questioner asks, What is to be shown?

original: phung po rnams spangs nas gzhan ci zhig ston /
analyzed: phung po rnams spangs nas gzhan ci zhig ston /
translated: Having abandoned the aggregates, what else is to be shown?

original: gal te gzhan cung zad ston par 'gyur na de'i phyir phung po rnams kyi yang mthong ba srid pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan cung zad ston par 'gyur na de'i phyir phung po rnams kyi yang mthong ba srid pa yin no //
translated: If it were to show something else, then it would be possible to see the aggregates.

original: gang gi tshe chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid cung zad kyang ston par byed pa mi nus pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes dri ba'i don no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid cung zad kyang ston par byed pa mi nus pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes dri ba'i don no //
translated: But when it is not able to show the emptiness of any dharma at all, then how can it be asked, ‚ÄúHow does the world show reality?‚Äù

original: mi 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: mi 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIt does not perish, etc.‚Äù

original: lu dzi zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba la'o //
analyzed: lu dzi zhes bya ba ni 'tshe ba la'o //
translated: The root luj means to harm.

original: du dzi zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa la ste khams gzhan no //
analyzed: du dzi zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa la ste khams gzhan no //
translated: The root duj means to destroy, to go to another realm.

original: ka be re la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ka be re la sogs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the very existence of the letters ka, be, etc.,

original: dzdza: yig ces bshad par byed pa ni mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dzdza: yig ces bshad par byed pa ni mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the letter ja is explained as ‚Äúnot perishing.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma nyid 'gag pas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid 'gag pas so //
translated: Because of momentariness, there is cessation.

original: rab tu mi 'jig pas na zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'gag pas so //
analyzed: rab tu mi 'jig pas na zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'gag pas so //
translated: Because of non-perishing, there is continuity.

original: 'di ci ltar bstan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar bstan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is this shown?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni phung po rnams so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni phung po rnams so //
translated: The meaning is as follows: The nature of emptiness is the aggregates.

original: don dam par kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid dam gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'on kyang don 'di la 'jig rten du shes pa po 'ga' zhig med de de bzhin gshegs pas shes @178b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pas don 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bas na de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'jig
analyzed: don dam par kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid dam gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no // 'on kyang don 'di la 'jig rten du shes pa po 'ga' zhig med de de bzhin gshegs pas shes @178b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pas don 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bas na de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'jig
translated: In the ultimate, they do not exist by the nature of the imagined or the dependent.

original: rten ston par byed pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rten ston par byed pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, in this matter, there is no knower of the world, but the TathƒÅgata, who, in dependence on the perfection of wisdom, has fully awakened to this matter. Therefore, the TathƒÅgatas are said to be the teachers of the world.

original: stong pa nyid kho na la de dang de'i phyin ci log gi gnyen po nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa dang / de la rnam par rtog pa thams cad mtshan ma med pas shin tu yang zhi ba mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kho na la de dang de'i phyin ci log gi gnyen po nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa dang / de la rnam par rtog pa thams cad mtshan ma med pas shin tu yang zhi ba mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is signless because it is the antidote to the various misconceptions about emptiness itself. It is the pacification of all conceptualizations, since it is signless.üîΩIt is wishless because it is the antidote to the wish for the various conceptualizations of the object of abandonment.

original: yongs su btang ba rnam par rtog pa thams cad smon pa rnams pha rol du smon pa med pa'o //üîΩslar yang mtshams sbyor ba med pas shin tu yang smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su btang ba rnam par rtog pa thams cad smon pa rnams pha rol du smon pa med pa'o // slar yang mtshams sbyor ba med pas shin tu yang smon pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the pacification of all wishes, since it is wishless.

original: bye brag gi rgyu thams cad med pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag gi rgyu thams cad med pas mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is unconditioned because it is the antidote to the various causes of differentiation.

original: rgyu dang rkyen thams cad spros pa bcad pa skye ba dang bral bas mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen thams cad spros pa bcad pa skye ba dang bral bas mi skye ba'o //
translated: It is non-production because it is the antidote to the various causes and conditions, since it is the cessation of conceptual proliferation.

original: dngos po'i spros pa thams cad log pas dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i spros pa thams cad log pas dngos po med pa'o //
translated: It is non-existence because it is the antidote to the various entities, since it is the cessation of the proliferation of entities.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs par gyur pas rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs par gyur pas rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the realm of the Dharma because it is the cause of all purified phenomena, since it is the object of suchness.

original: slar yang rnam pa gzhan gyis 'jig rten yang dag par bstan pa gsungs pa ni /üîΩgang dag gis yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: slar yang rnam pa gzhan gyis 'jig rten yang dag par bstan pa gsungs pa ni / gang dag gis yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Again, the correct teaching of the world is stated in another way:üîΩ‚ÄúThose who think that the mind of sentient beings is the mind of the TathƒÅgata,üîΩthey do not know the real nature of the mind.‚ÄùüîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.

original: sems can dngos po med pas zhes bya ba ni gal te sems can gang gi sems de dag de'i sems ni de rnams kyi sems zhes shes par gyur na yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes so //
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pas zhes bya ba ni gal te sems can gang gi sems de dag de'i sems ni de rnams kyi sems zhes shes par gyur na yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes so //
translated: If the mind of sentient beings were the mind of the TathƒÅgata, then the TathƒÅgata would be defiled.üîΩBut the TathƒÅgata is not defiled.

original: sems rnams dang sems can rnams ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems rnams dang sems can rnams ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos ma yin te / 'o na ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos gang yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩ‚ÄúThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: med par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: med par gyur pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: The mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sems rnams dang sems can rnams kyang gzigs pa ma yin no//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sems rnams dang sems can rnams kyang gzigs pa ma yin no//
translated: The mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the TathƒÅgata.üîΩThe mind of sentient beings is not the mind of the Tath

original: sems kyi gnas skabs la shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun du brtags pa'i sems can gyi gnas skabs la yang shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas skabs la shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun du brtags pa'i sems can gyi gnas skabs la yang shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of mind is utterly nonexistent, and because the state of sentient beings is also utterly nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir sems rnams dang sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems rnams dang sems can rnams rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúhe knows the minds and sentient beings.‚Äù

original: ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa zhes gang gi tshe shes na de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam pa rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa zhes gang gi tshe shes na de'i tshe ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam pa rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: When he knows the ‚Äúnot as it really is,‚Äù then he knows the ‚Äúas it really is‚Äù aspect.

original: sems mkhyen pa zhes gang zhig brjod pa de smon lam la sogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: sems mkhyen pa zhes gang zhig brjod pa de smon lam la sogs pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: As for the statement ‚Äúhe knows the mind,‚Äù that is by the application of vows, etc.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that the knowledge of the minds of others is conventional.

original: gzhal du med pa ni sems can mu ma mchis pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa ni sems can mu ma mchis pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIncalculable‚Äù means that sentient beings are infinite.

original: grangs med pa ni @179a * //
analyzed: grangs med pa ni @179a * //
translated: ‚ÄúImmeasurable‚Äù means

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye bas sems can re rer bgrang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye bas sems can re rer bgrang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that it is impossible to count each sentient being by way of the categories of attachment, etc.

original: sems dang 'brel ba'i sems rnams dang gzhal du med pa nyid dang grangs med pa nyid la shes pa bstan pa de yang don dam par med par gyur pa nyid kyis de yang sems can med par gyur ba'i shes pa med pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang 'brel ba'i sems rnams dang gzhal du med pa nyid dang grangs med pa nyid la shes pa bstan pa de yang don dam par med par gyur pa nyid kyis de yang sems can med par gyur ba'i shes pa med pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The teaching of cognition in relation to the mind, and to the immeasurable and innumerable minds, is also not due to the non-existence of cognition in the absence of sentient beings, but rather due to the ultimate non-existence of those.

original: sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because sentient beings are non-existent.

original: mdor bsdus pas bstan yang /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas bstan yang /
translated: Although taught concisely,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: it is further stated extensively with Moreover... and so on.

original: gzhan dag kyang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can gzhal du med pa nyid bstan nas gang yang de rnams zhes bya ba'i 'gres phyis 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems can gzhal du med pa nyid bstan nas gang yang de rnams zhes bya ba'i 'gres phyis 'don pa yin no //
translated: Others and so on teach the immeasurable nature of sentient beings, and the repetition and so on is to be applied later.

original: gnas gzhan la yang le'u 'di la 'gres phyin ci log par byed do //
analyzed: gnas gzhan la yang le'u 'di la 'gres phyin ci log par byed do //
translated: In other editions, this chapter has the repetition in the reverse order.

original: de lta bu'i 'don pa ni sngon gyi 'grel pa mkhan po rnams kyis ma gus pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'don pa ni sngon gyi 'grel pa mkhan po rnams kyis ma gus pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: Such a repetition is done out of disrespect by the former commentators.

original: sems can gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi dbye bas sna tshogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems can gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyi dbye bas sna tshogs pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bya ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase incalculable sentient beings refers to the various colors and shapes of sentient beings, which are differentiated in terms of the realms, destinies, and modes of birth.

original: grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba gcig la yang de rnams bgrang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba gcig la yang de rnams bgrang bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase immeasurable sentient beings refers to the fact that it is impossible to count them even in a single lifetime.üîΩHere, the phrase because sentient beings are unreal is the reason that was stated earlier. The phrase because sentient beings are devoid of intrinsic nature is the reason that is stated here. The phrase therefore, sentient beings are immeasurable and incalculable explains the meaning of the previous reason.

original: 'dir yang sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni gang gi phyir sems can rnams la ngo bo nyid med pas tshad med pa dang grangs med pa de'i phyir sems can rnams tshad med pa dangüîΩgrangs med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang sems can dngos po med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar gsungs pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni gang gi phyir sems can rnams la ngo bo nyid med pas tshad med pa dang grangs med pa de'i phyir sems can rnams tshad med pa dang grangs med pa'o //
translated: The phrase because sentient beings are devoid of intrinsic nature is the reason that is stated here. The phrase therefore, sentient beings are immeasurable and incalculable explains the meaning of the previous reason.

original: 'di yang stong pa nyid la dmigs pa don dam pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yang stong pa nyid la dmigs pa don dam pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs so //
translated: This passage was also spoken by the BhagavƒÅn with reference to the ultimate nonconceptual wisdom that focuses on emptiness.

original: de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang slar sems can rnams la phan pa'i don du kun rdzob pa'i gzhal du med pa dang grangs med pa la sogs pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par mdzad pa zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang slar sems can rnams la phan pa'i don du kun rdzob pa'i gzhal du med pa dang grangs med pa la sogs pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par mdzad pa zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having fully awakened, the BhagavƒÅn again teaches the immeasurable and innumerable conventional existents for the sake of benefiting sentient beings.

original: sems can gzhal du med pa dag gi sems zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhal du med pa nyid sems can gzhal du med pas bstan to //
analyzed: sems can gzhal du med pa dag gi sems zhes bya ba ni sngar gzhal du med pa nyid sems can gzhal du med pas bstan to //
translated: The ‚Äúminds of immeasurable sentient beings‚Äù were previously taught to be immeasurable due to the immeasurability of sentient beings.

original: da ltar ni slar sems gcig yin yang gzhal du med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid kyis gzhal du med pa zhes khyad par ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni slar sems gcig yin yang gzhal du med pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa nyid kyis gzhal du med pa zhes khyad par ro //
translated: Now, although the mind is singular, it is immeasurable due to the observation of immeasurable forms and so on. This is the difference.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye bas @179b gzhal du med pa'i sems can rnams rtogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sems can de rnams kyi sems dag kyang srid pa ji lta bar gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye bas @179b gzhal du med pa'i sems can rnams rtogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sems can de rnams kyi sems dag kyang srid pa ji lta bar gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: This shows that just as sentient beings are immeasurable due to the division of color and shape, so too the minds of those sentient beings are immeasurable due to the existence of various existences.

original: 'di yang gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das mngon par shes pas khyad par dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das mngon par shes pas khyad par dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sems yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the discernment of the minds of yogins who are distinguished by their higher knowledge.

original: gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste /
translated: The reading of some authorities is ‚Äúincalculable and inexhaustible.‚Äù

original: de la mi zad pa'i sems rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rjes sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin pas sems can rnams yongs su ma dor ba'i phyir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi zad pa'i sems rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rjes sems can rnams yongs su 'dzin pas sems can rnams yongs su ma dor ba'i phyir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The inexhaustible minds are to be understood as the minds of the bodhisattvas, who, out of compassion, do not abandon sentient beings, because they do not abandon sentient beings.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i don yongs su shes pa la rgyu gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i don yongs su shes pa la rgyu gsungs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The cause of the understanding of the meaning as it has been taught is stated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata, having understood the minds of all sentient beings, etc.‚Äù

original: byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis mdzad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma'i mi rtag pa nyid kyis mdzad pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúEmpowerment‚Äù means that the TathƒÅgata does not act through the impermanence of momentariness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid kyi sems la chos gang la yang rang gi ngo bo yang dag par 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid kyi sems la chos gang la yang rang gi ngo bo yang dag par 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: In the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs true nature, no dharma whatsoever arises in its own intrinsic reality.

original: gang gis zad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is that by which they are exhausted.

original: de'i sems zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sems zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa'i ngo bos chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: His ‚Äúmind‚Äù is that which, by the nature of the object of meditation and the meditator being the same, abides in the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom, the nature of which is the nonapprehension of all dharmas.

original: 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun rnams rnam par chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun rnams rnam par chad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnceasing‚Äù means that the continuum is not interrupted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad kyi skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa la gnas pa skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad kyi skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa la gnas pa skye ba med pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is ‚Äúnonarising,‚Äù abiding in the ultimate truth, the characteristic of the nonarising of all dharmas.

original: dmigs pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa med pa'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sbyor bas gnas pa med pa'i phyir gnas med pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúbaseless,‚Äù because it does not abide by the application of apprehension.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnams dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rten med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnams dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rten med pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúunsupported,‚Äù because the signs of all dharmas are not apprehended.

original: de bas na gzhal du med pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gzhal du med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is immeasurable.

original: dmigs pa thams cad 'jug pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad 'jug pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no measure of the engagement of all objects.

original: sems de mi zad pa ni sems yang dag pa la ji ltar bshad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems de mi zad pa ni sems yang dag pa la ji ltar bshad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rten don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inexhaustibility of that mind is due to the fact that the mind of reality is inexhaustible by virtue of the ultimate reality of the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas so //
translated: By whom? By one who possesses the qualities of consecration and so on.

original: de ltar ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sems rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa la sogs pa don dam par rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pas mnyam pa dmigs parüîΩbya ba dang / dmigs @180a * //
analyzed: de ltar ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sems rnams kyis stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa la sogs pa don dam par rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pas mnyam pa dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs @180a * //
translated: Thus, as it is, refers to the ultimate knowledge of the nature of emptiness, the immeasurable, the inexhaustible, and so on, by the minds that know reality.

original: par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: The knowledge that abides in the nature of the object and the subject is called the knowledge of equality.

original: 'thad pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'thad pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The justification is stated:

original: nam mkha' bzhin du gzhal du med cing mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du gzhal du med cing mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúit is immeasurable and inexhaustible like space‚Äù is as follows.

original: gang zhig gzhal du med pa dang zad pa de cung zad shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhal du med pa dang zad pa de cung zad shes pa yin te /
translated: That which is immeasurable and inexhaustible is not known in the least.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis mtshan ma med pa nyid kyis nam mkha' ltar gzhal du med pa dang zad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis mtshan ma med pa nyid kyis nam mkha' ltar gzhal du med pa dang zad pa med pa'o //
translated: The mind of the TathƒÅgata, by the power of the perfection of wisdom, is immeasurable and inexhaustible like space, because it is signless.

original: de'i dngos po ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ci zhig yod //
translated: What is its reality?

original: gang zhig yongs su shes par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su shes par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is not known?

original: gzhan yang bsdus pa rnams zhes bya ba ste dge ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsdus pa rnams zhes bya ba ste dge ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is a collection, that is, it is wholesome.

original: dmigs pa bsdus pa zhes chos mngon pa rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa bsdus pa zhes chos mngon pa rnams so //
translated: The collection of objects is the Abhidharma.

original: ji ltar bsdus pa'i sems she na gsungs pa ni de bsdus pa dang bcas pa zad pa nyid du dang / zad pa yang ma zad pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bsdus pa'i sems she na gsungs pa ni de bsdus pa dang bcas pa zad pa nyid du dang / zad pa yang ma zad pa nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is the mind collected? It is said: ‚ÄúIt is collected together with its collection, and it is exhausted as exhaustion itself, and exhaustion is not exhausted.‚Äù

original: zad pa ni dmigs pa bsdu ba ste sems kun rdzob tu zad pa nyid du shes pa la de nyid ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni dmigs pa bsdu ba ste sems kun rdzob tu zad pa nyid du shes pa la de nyid ni zad pa'o //
translated: Exhaustion is the gathering of the objective supports, and the conventional exhaustion of the mind is known as just that.

original: don dam par mi zad pa ste sems kyi rang bzhin mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par mi zad pa ste sems kyi rang bzhin mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not ultimately exhausted, because the nature of the mind is inexhaustible.

original: de ltar na bsdus pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin la ji lta ba bzhin gyis med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir don dam par de shes pa na bsdus pa'i sems zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsdus pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin la ji lta ba bzhin gyis med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir don dam par de shes pa na bsdus pa'i sems zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind that is gathered is said to be the mind that is gathered in the ultimate, because its nature is non-existent just as it is.

original: de ni bsdus pa zad pa nyid du dang zad pa yang ma zad pa nyid du zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsdus pa zad pa nyid du dang zad pa yang ma zad pa nyid du zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: That is said to be the exhaustion of the gathered, and the exhaustion of the exhaustion is not exhausted.

original: der dmigs pa la bsdu ba ni sems kyi ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: der dmigs pa la bsdu ba ni sems kyi ma zad pa'o //
translated: The gathering of the objective supports there is the non-exhaustion of the mind.

original: de yang ma zad pa nyid de ma zad pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin la zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ma zad pa nyid de ma zad pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin la zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is also not exhausted, because the nature of the mind that is not exhausted is exhausted.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de yang dag par bsdus pa zad pa dang zad pa yang mi zad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba brjod do//
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa de yang dag par bsdus pa zad pa dang zad pa yang mi zad pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba brjod do//
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is said to be the exhaustion of the gathered and the exhaustion of the exhaustion is not exhausted.

original: 'ga' zhig tu ni mi zad pa ni mi zad pas zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu ni mi zad pa ni mi zad pas zhes bya ba 'don pa yin no //
translated: In some places, the reading is ‚Äúinexhaustible through inexhaustibility.‚Äù

original: de ni kun rdzob pa'i zad pa ni don dam par mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob pa'i zad pa ni don dam par mi zad pa ste /
translated: The exhaustion of the conventional is the inexhaustibility of the ultimate.

original: de ni de ltar shes so //
analyzed: de ni de ltar shes so //
translated: That is how it should be understood.

original: gzhan yang g-yengs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yengs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang g-yengs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yengs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúdistracted‚Äù means associated with distraction.

original: yang dag par bsdus pa rmugs pa dang yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems ni yang dag par bsdu pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par bsdus pa rmugs pa dang yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems ni yang dag par bsdu pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúConcentrated‚Äù means the mind associated with lethargy.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul la 'jug pa 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i yul la 'jug pa 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is projected into the objects of the five collections of consciousness.

original: de ni rnam par g-yeng ba ste nyon mongs pa gzhan dang yang dag par mtshungs pa zhes phyi ma rnams so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par g-yeng ba ste nyon mongs pa gzhan dang yang dag par mtshungs pa zhes phyi ma rnams so //
translated: That is distraction, associated with other afflictions.

original: de 'di kha che ba rnams gus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'di kha che ba rnams gus pa ma yin te /
translated: The Kashmiri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas do not respect this.

original: de @180b ltar na gcig nyid la yang dag par bsdu ba nyid dang rnam par g-yeng ba nyid du thal ba'o //
analyzed: de @180b ltar na gcig nyid la yang dag par bsdu ba nyid dang rnam par g-yeng ba nyid du thal ba'o //
translated: Thus, it follows that a single mind would be both concentrated and distracted.

original: nyon mongs pa can rmugs pas yang dag par sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can rmugs pas yang dag par sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied by the afflicted torpor.

original: yang dag par bsdus pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsdus pa ni de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is distracted because it is associated with other afflictions.

original: chos nyid las zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'i stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid las zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'i stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: From reality means from the emptiness of the nature of mind.

original: de las chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba'am zad pa gang yin zhes gsungs pa ni g-yeng ba med pa dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba'am zad pa gang yin zhes gsungs pa ni g-yeng ba med pa dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since all dharmas are of one taste with that, it is said that any distraction or exhaustion is nondistraction and inexhaustibility.

original: 'ga' zhig tu rab 'byor chos nyid la sems g-yengs pa'i sems de dag ni mtshan nyid med pas sems de dag ni mi zad pa rnam par mi zad pa ma g-yengs par sems de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te zhes bya
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rab 'byor chos nyid la sems g-yengs pa'i sems de dag ni mtshan nyid med pas sems de dag ni mi zad pa rnam par mi zad pa ma g-yengs par sems de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te zhes bya
translated: In some places, Subh≈´ti, those minds that are distracted from reality are without characteristics. Those minds are inexhaustible, not exhausted, undistracted. He knows those minds as they are in reality.

original: ba'i 'don pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i 'don pa'o //
translated: This is the reading.

original: de la chos nyid las ni stong pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de la chos nyid las ni stong pa nyid las so //
translated: The ultimate is emptiness.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The distraction is conventional.

original: don dam par ji lta bu yin zhes mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ji lta bu yin zhes mi zad pa ste /
translated: How is it ultimate?

original: skad cig ma rnams dor nas yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par mi zad pa ni rgyun nye bar zhi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams dor nas yod pa'i phyir ro // rnam par mi zad pa ni rgyun nye bar zhi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it exists even when the moments are discarded.üîΩ It is non-exhaustible because the continuum is not extinguished.

original: ma g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du 'gro ba yang dag par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du 'gro ba yang dag par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is undistracted because it does not go out to external objects.

original: ci'i phyir 'di lta bu'i rnam pa zhes gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di lta bu'i rnam pa zhes gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is it said to be of such a kind? It is said to be without characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is empty of its own characteristic, that is the meaning.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang sems kyi mi dmigs pa rgyas par byed pa ni //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang sems kyi mi dmigs pa rgyas par byed pa ni //
translated: Another aspect of the non-apprehension of mind is elaborated:

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba dngos su yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang yang dag par sbyor ba dngos su yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: Moreover, Subh≈´ti, the afflictions are nonvirtuous because they are the afflictions that are directly produced by the connection with the afflictions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The afflictions do not become afflicted.

original: de rnams ni med par gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni med par gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Those are the non-existent afflictions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entities of the afflictions do not exist ultimately.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni log pa'i sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni log pa'i sgro 'dogs pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflictions engage through the superimposition of error.

original: brdar 'dogs pa med pa ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdar 'dogs pa med pa ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-existent designation is because of the non-conceptuality of the ultimate.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs par ma gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs par ma gyur pa rnams zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba rnams so //
translated: The minds that are not afflicted are the virtues that are the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste zhes bya ba ni //
translated: They are naturally radiant.

original: @181a * // sems kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dri ma dang bral ba rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @181a * // sems kyi chos nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dri ma dang bral ba rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reality of mind is naturally luminous, free from defilements, and always devoid of afflictions, because of emptiness.

original: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can te le lo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhum pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can te le lo dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDepression‚Äù is afflicted, because it is associated with laziness.

original: gzhi med pa'i zhum pa zhes bya ba la gzhi med pa ni rten med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i zhum pa zhes bya ba la gzhi med pa ni rten med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDepression without a basis‚Äù means without a support.

original: gzhi med pa nyid kyis zhum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa nyid kyis zhum pa'o //
translated: Depression is without a basis, because it is without a support.

original: sems ni zhum pa ste sems kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin la de stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis le lo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni zhum pa ste sems kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin la de stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis le lo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is depressed, not the nature of mind, because of the absence of laziness due to the nature of emptiness.

original: sems rab tu bzung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems rab tu bzung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is well-taken hold of‚Äù means virtuous,

original: brtson 'grus dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with effort.

original: de rnams kyis don dam pa'i rang bzhin gsungs pa ni gzung ba ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis don dam pa'i rang bzhin gsungs pa ni gzung ba ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The ultimate nature of those is stated as ‚Äúnot apprehended,‚Äù etc.

original: de kho na nyid las stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid las stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the emptiness of reality, the nature of emptiness.

original: rab tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa ni brtson 'grus yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa ni brtson 'grus yang dag par sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Not to be grasped is not to apply effort.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Contaminated means the afflictions.

original: bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs de rnams dang sbyor bas zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs de rnams dang sbyor bas zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: They are contaminated because they are connected with those states of latent tendencies.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa ni ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi bdag nyid la yod pa ni ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Without an intrinsic nature means that which exists in its own nature is an intrinsic nature.

original: de med pas ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Because that does not exist, it is without an intrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ngo bo nyid med ce na /
translated: Why is it without an intrinsic nature?

original: gsungs pa ni med pa dang 'dra ba yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni med pa dang 'dra ba yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said: It is like non-existence.

original: gzung ba la sogs pa med pa rnams la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa med pa rnams la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of conceiving non-existent objects and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos zag pa med pa'i sems rnams la gang zhig shes pa ste de rnams kyi don dam pa shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos zag pa med pa'i sems rnams la gang zhig shes pa ste de rnams kyi don dam pa shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ultimate knowledge of those minds that are uncontaminated by the nature of emptiness is called the knowledge of the ultimate.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni zag pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni zag pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uncontaminated ones are the antidotes to the contaminants.

original: ngo bo nyid med par gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par gzhol ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called ‚Äúinclined toward the absence of an intrinsic nature‚Äù because they are free from all intrinsic natures.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gzhol ba 'di rnams la yod pas na de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du gzhol ba 'di rnams la yod pas na de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: The ultimate reality is the perfected nature. Since these have the perfected nature as their object, they are said to be ‚Äúinclined toward the absence of an intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: dngos po med par gzhal ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don ni 'di nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med par gzhal ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don ni 'di nyid do //
translated: The meaning is the same as in the line ‚Äúthey are inclined toward the absence of an intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: lhun gyis grub pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are spontaneous because they are nonconceptual.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang yang dag par ldan pa ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang yang dag par ldan pa ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Those who are associated with desire are those who are endowed with desire.

original: rab 'byor sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la don 'di yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la don 'di yin te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, those who are associated with desire in their minds means the following.

original: 'dir 'dod chags dang @181b bcas pa'i sems rnams ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba 'di la gal te 'dod chags dang sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ces de ltar shes na ji lta baüîΩbzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'dod chags dang @181b bcas pa'i sems rnams ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba 'di la gal te 'dod chags dang sems ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ces de ltar shes na ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa ma yin no //
translated: If one thinks that the mind that is associated with attachment is attachment itself, then it is not thoroughly known just as it is.

original: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos yin na sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid kyang ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos so //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i shin tu dag pa'i shes rab bam sems ni 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos sam /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos yin na sems kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid kyang ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos so // de bzhin gshegs pa'i shin tu dag pa'i shes rab bam sems ni 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las byung ba'i chos sam /
translated: The mind that is associated with attachment is a real entity just as it is, and the mind that is isolated from attachment is also a real entity just as it is.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba ma yin te //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba ma yin te //
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs pure wisdom or mind does not see the mind that is associated with attachment as a mental factor that is attachment or as a real entity.

original: de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kun du brtags pa shin tu med par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kun du brtags pa shin tu med par gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind that is associated with attachment is completely non-existent in the state of attachment, etc.

original: de'i phyir ngag de la don ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni ji lta bar gyur ba ma yin pa mi bden pa zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag de la don ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems ni ji lta bar gyur ba ma yin pa mi bden pa zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of that statement should be understood as follows: ‚ÄúThe mind that is associated with attachment is not as it really is, and is not true.‚Äù

original: de spangs nas ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam pas rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de spangs nas ji lta ba bzhin gyi rnam pas rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having abandoned that, one fully knows by means of the mode of reality.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang yang dag par mi ldan pa'i phyir de ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang yang dag par mi ldan pa'i phyir de ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe minds of those who are free from attachment‚Äù means that they are not associated with attachment, and therefore they are called ‚Äúthe antidote to attachment.‚Äù

original: 'o na mi slob pa'i sems ni ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /üîΩde'i rgyud la 'dod chags mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na mi slob pa'i sems ni ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ste / de'i rgyud la 'dod chags mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But how can the mind of one who is not a trainee be free from attachment?üîΩBecause attachment is not found in his mental continuum, and because it is not the antidote.

original: rnam par spangs pa dang rnam par smon pa'i dbang du song ba la sogs pas gnyen po nyid de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa dang rnam par smon pa'i dbang du song ba la sogs pas gnyen po nyid de ltar ma yin no //
translated: It is not the antidote in that way, because it is governed by the abandonment and the aspiration.

original: gal te yang mi slob pa'i sems ni 'dod chags spang ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa'am rnam par smod pa yang gnyen po ni yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang mi slob pa'i sems ni 'dod chags spang ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa'am rnam par smod pa yang gnyen po ni yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the mind of one beyond training were not the antidote to the abandonment of attachment, then the mind of contempt would also be the antidote.

original: sems kyis bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis de 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyis bral ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis de 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind that is free from attachment‚Äù means that it is not associated with attachment due to being free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la kun rdzob tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la kun rdzob tu 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to say that a mind that is free from attachment is associated with attachment in a conventional sense.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid gang yin pa de ni sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin zhes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin nyid ni stong pa nyid de de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid gang yin pa de ni sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin zhes bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin nyid ni stong pa nyid de de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin
translated: The suchness of a mind that is free from attachment is not a mind that is associated with attachment.

original: zhes nye bar mtshon pa'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes shes par bya zhing don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes nye bar mtshon pa'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes shes par bya zhing don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúsuchness‚Äù is a synonym for emptiness.

original: sems @182a * //
analyzed: sems @182a * //
translated: It should be understood that the suchness of a mind that is associated with attachment is also the suchness of a mind that is free from attachment.üîΩThe meaning of this statement is as follows.

original: kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid dang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyang don dam par med do //
analyzed: kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid dang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyang don dam par med do //
translated: The possession of desire and the absence of desire do not exist ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu kun brtags kyi rnam pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu kun brtags kyi rnam pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes smra bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot say that they are free from desire and possess desire in the conventional sense, because of the imagined nature.

original: tshul 'di nyid kyis sems zhes sdang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres rnams kyang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid kyis sems zhes sdang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres rnams kyang bshad par bya'o //
translated: By this very method, the rest of the verses on the mind associated with hatred, etc., should be explained.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba la zhes sdang ni sdang ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa rnams zhes bya ba la zhes sdang ni sdang ba'o //
translated: The mind associated with hatred is the mind that is associated with hatred.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa las 'di'i tha dad par byed pa ni 'di la mtha' gcig tu 'dod pa spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa las 'di'i tha dad par byed pa ni 'di la mtha' gcig tu 'dod pa spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mind that is associated with hatred is distinguished from the mind associated with desire, etc., because it is the mind that is exclusively associated with hatred.

original: sems rgya chen po ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos kyis che ba dang snying rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos chen po'i sems can rnams kyis bsnyen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rgya chen po ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos kyis che ba dang snying rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos chen po'i sems can rnams kyis bsnyen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThose with a narrow mind‚Äù are those who are not great in terms of the Dharma of purification and the great Dharma of the bodhisattvas, such as compassion.

original: rgya chen po ni dge ba'i sems zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya chen po ni dge ba'i sems zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: A ‚Äúgreat mind‚Äù is called a virtuous mind.

original: de bzlog pa ni chen po ma yin par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzlog pa ni chen po ma yin par gyur ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is a ‚Äúnarrow mind.‚Äù

original: 'ong ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout coming‚Äù and so on.

original: chen po ma yin pa nyid ni chen po nyid gzhan dag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po ma yin pa nyid ni chen po nyid gzhan dag nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: A ‚Äúnarrow mind‚Äù is a great mind in relation to others.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbang gis yod pa yin na de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ni de ltar mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i dbang gis yod pa yin na de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ni de ltar mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúGoing‚Äù and ‚Äúcoming‚Äù exist by the power of going and coming, but the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata does not see it in that way.

original: 'on kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mthong ba yin no /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du mthong ba yin no /
translated: Rather, it is seen as the nature of nonexistence.

original: de ltar na chen por gyur ba ma yin pa'i sems ni chen por gyur pa ma yin pa zhes yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chen por gyur ba ma yin pa'i sems ni chen por gyur pa ma yin pa zhes yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind that is not great is not a non-great.

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa ni dngos po med pa 'di ltar brjod pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa ni dngos po med pa 'di ltar brjod pa yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of them as they are is the non-existence of things, as has been stated.

original: de la ring po nas nye bar 'ong ba ni 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ring po nas nye bar 'ong ba ni 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: Here, coming from afar is non-coming.

original: nye ba nas ring por 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o ;
analyzed: nye ba nas ring por 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o ;
translated: Going from near is going.

original: / kun nas 'gro ba ni gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: / kun nas 'gro ba ni gtogs pa'o //
translated: Going all around is being attached.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi sems rnams kyi chos nyid ni stong pa nyid de des mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi sems rnams kyi chos nyid ni stong pa nyid de des mnyam pa'o //
translated: By sameness means by the sameness of the mind. The reality of the mind is emptiness. By that it is the same.

original: de rnams kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid de de bas na stong pa nyid kyis mnyam pa chen por gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang bzhin ni stong pa nyid de de bas na stong pa nyid kyis mnyam pa chen por gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of those is emptiness. Therefore, emptiness is the great non-greatness.

original: rgya che ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i 'gres 'di ni 'ga' zhig chen por gyur ba ma yin pa'i 'gres las snga rol du mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i ngor 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i 'gres 'di ni 'ga' zhig chen por gyur ba ma yin pa'i 'gres las snga rol du mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i ngor 'don pa yin no //
translated: This is the reading in the case of the realization of the absence of greatness, which is the opposite of the absence of vastness.

original: rgya che ba ni dmigs pa la sogs pa rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni dmigs pa la sogs pa rgya che ba'o //
translated: Vastness is the vastness of the objective supports, etc.

original: de med pa ni rgya che ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni rgya che ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is the absence of vastness.

original: kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la kun nas slong ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la kun nas slong ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: The absence of the motivating force refers to the absence of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the emptiness of the unoriginated and the unceased.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.

original: de @182b med pas na slong ba dang mi ldan pa ni skye ba med pa dang stong pa nyid de de dang sbyor bas kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de @182b med pas na slong ba dang mi ldan pa ni skye ba med pa dang stong pa nyid de de dang sbyor bas kun nas slong ba dang mi ldan pa'o //
