translated: The absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.

original: kun nas slong ba med par gtogs pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //üîΩsems de dag ni mi 'bri zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas slong ba med par gtogs pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //üîΩsems de dag ni mi 'bri zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination.üîΩThe absence of the motivating force is the absence of the nature of origination

original: sems gzhan rnams kyi 'grib pa ni ma yin pa dang rgya che ba'i sems rnams kyi 'phel ba ma yin ba dang gnyi ga dag la yang mi 'bral ba ni rnam par 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gzhan rnams kyi 'grib pa ni ma yin pa dang rgya che ba'i sems rnams kyi 'phel ba ma yin ba dang gnyi ga dag la yang mi 'bral ba ni rnam par 'jig pa yin no //
translated: The decrease of other minds is not, and the increase of vast minds is not. The non-separation from both is their destruction.

original: 'on kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas rgya chen po'i sems de'i bral ba med pa nyid de stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir mthong zhing sems rgya che ba shes so zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas rgya chen po'i sems de'i bral ba med pa nyid de stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo'i phyir mthong zhing sems rgya che ba shes so zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, based on the perfection of wisdom, the non-separation of that vast mind is seen, and the vast mind is known, because it has the nature of emptiness.

original: bral ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la rtogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir bral ba ni chos kyi dbyings nyid do //
analyzed: bral ba zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la rtogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir bral ba ni chos kyi dbyings nyid do //
translated: In the recitation separation, separation is the realm of phenomena itself, because it is free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad med pa'i sems bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad med pa'i sems bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti and so on explains the immeasurable mind.

original: rten med pa'i tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: rten med pa'i tshad med pa ste /
translated: It is immeasurable without support.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni tshad med pa nyid ni khyab par byas nas gnas pa'i phyir ram dbyibs kyi dbang gis yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni tshad med pa nyid ni khyab par byas nas gnas pa'i phyir ram dbyibs kyi dbang gis yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is said: ‚ÄúIt exists by way of spatial division, because it is located by pervading immeasurability.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di ltar tshad med pa'i sems gzigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di ltar tshad med pa'i sems gzigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata does not see the mind as immeasurable in this way.

original: 'on kyang sems rnams thams cad kyi rten med pa nyid ni rab tu mi gnas pa nyid du gzigs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems rnams thams cad kyi rten med pa nyid ni rab tu mi gnas pa nyid du gzigs so //
translated: However, he sees that all minds are without support, because they are not located.

original: de ltar gzigs shing tshad med pa'i sems ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzigs shing tshad med pa'i sems ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he sees and is said to know the immeasurable mind as it is.

original: 'gres 'di ni sngar gyi po ti rnams la med pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'gres 'di ni sngar gyi po ti rnams la med pa nyid de /
translated: This passage is not found in the earlier editions.

original: de bas na bsnan pa zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de bas na bsnan pa zhes smra'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called an interpolation.

original: bstan du yod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ni 'dir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de gang gis thos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su sems mtshon pa yin pa de dang sbyor ba'i phyir bstan du yod pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa ni 'dir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de gang gis thos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su sems mtshon pa yin pa de dang sbyor ba'i phyir bstan du yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is demonstrable‚Äù means that demonstration here has the characteristic of impermanence, etc., and it is demonstrable because it is applied to that which is indicated by the mind in the state of hearing, etc.

original: mnyam par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid mnyam pa sems de rnams la rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mnyam par bstan pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid mnyam pa sems de rnams la rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe mnyam par bstan pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of sameness is when, through supramundane wisdom, the sameness of mind that is the nature of reality is realized.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid de sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid de sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyi chos nyid do //
translated: That is the nature of mind, and the nature of mind is the reality of mind.

original: de nyid ni ngo bo nyid de 'di rnams la yod pa de bas na sems kyi ngo bo nyid de tshig bar ma mi snang ba'i bsdu ba'o //üîΩbstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mtshan nyid dang bcas pa zhes bya ba brjod pa de @183a * //
analyzed: de nyid ni ngo bo nyid de 'di rnams la yod pa de bas na sems kyi ngo bo nyid de tshig bar ma mi snang ba'i bsdu ba'o // bstan du med pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mtshan nyid dang bcas pa zhes bya ba brjod pa de @183a * //
translated: That is the nature of mind, and those who have it are said to have the nature of mind.üîΩThe teaching of the absence of characteristics is when, through the power of meditation, the characteristics of impermanence and so on are directly perceived.

original: rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid des sgom ba rab kyi gnas skabs su rang gi ngang gis yang nas yang du dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bstan du med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid des sgom ba rab kyi gnas skabs su rang gi ngang gis yang nas yang du dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe bstan du med pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the absence of appearance is when, through the power of meditation, the characteristics of impermanence and so on are directly perceived.

original: 'di yang rang gi ngo bo dmigs pas sems rnams kyi kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pas don dam par ji ltar mkhyen ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang rang gi ngo bo dmigs pas sems rnams kyi kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pas don dam par ji ltar mkhyen ces gsungs pa ni /
translated: This also is the reality of the mind‚Äôs relative nature, which is perceived. How does the TathƒÅgata know it ultimately?

original: mtshan nyid med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is without a characteristic, etc. ‚Äù

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid de de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid de de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind‚Äôs characteristic is called ‚Äúapprehending,‚Äù which is its intrinsic nature.

original: don ni rdzas kyi rang bzhin te de rnam par dben pa'i phyir sems de ni mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: don ni rdzas kyi rang bzhin te de rnam par dben pa'i phyir sems de ni mi snang ba'o //
translated: The object is the nature of a substance, and because it is devoid of that, the mind is not manifest.

original: mi snang ba nyid gsungs pa ni spyan rnams thams cad la snang bar ma gyur ba zhes bya ba la sems zhes bya ba kun brtags brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mi snang ba nyid gsungs pa ni spyan rnams thams cad la snang bar ma gyur ba zhes bya ba la sems zhes bya ba kun brtags brjod pa yin te /
translated: He explains that it is not manifest: ‚ÄúIt is not manifest to any eye.‚Äù The word ‚Äúmind‚Äù is a restatement of the word ‚Äúimagined.‚Äù

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it does not exist by way of its intrinsic identity, because it does not exist.

original: mthong ba de yang mig rnams la snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba de yang mig rnams la snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That seeing also is not manifest to the eyes.

original: de bas na snang bar ma gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na snang bar ma gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúnot manifest‚Äù is that it is not manifest to any eye.

original: gsum mam zhes bya ba ni sha dang lha dang shes rab kyi spyan rnams so //
analyzed: gsum mam zhes bya ba ni sha dang lha dang shes rab kyi spyan rnams so //
translated: The three are the fleshly eye, the divine eye, and the eye of wisdom.

original: thams cad la zhes pa ni chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes pa ni chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la yang ngo //
translated: All refers to the Dharma eye and the Buddha eye.

original: mdor bsdus pas spyan ni rnam pa bzhi ste gzugs 'dzin pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa dang rnam pa thams cad du shes bya ba thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas spyan ni rnam pa bzhi ste gzugs 'dzin pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin pa dang kun rdzob kyi bden pa 'dzin pa dang rnam pa thams cad du shes bya ba thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In brief, the eyes are of four kinds: the eye that perceives form, the eye that perceives ultimate reality, the eye that perceives conventional reality, and the eye that perceives all objects of knowledge in every way.

original: gzugs 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The eye that perceives form is also of two kinds:

original: las kyi 'bras bu dang bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu dang bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result of action and the result of meditation.

original: de la las kyi 'bras bu ni sha'i spyan no //
analyzed: de la las kyi 'bras bu ni sha'i spyan no //
translated: The result of action is the fleshly eye.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni lha'i spyan no //üîΩdon dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin par byed pa ni shes rab kyi spyan no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni lha'i spyan no // don dam pa'i bden pa 'dzin par byed pa ni shes rab kyi spyan no //
translated: The result of meditation is the divine eye.üîΩThe eye that perceives ultimate reality is the eye of wisdom.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis 'phags pa'i gang zag thob par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis 'phags pa'i gang zag thob par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of attaining the status of an ƒÅrya by the power of the knowledge of ultimate reality.

original: kun rdzob pa'i phyin ci log pa'i chos rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa 'dzin par byed pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi spyan no //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa'i phyin ci log pa'i chos rnams sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa 'dzin par byed pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi spyan no //
translated: The gnosis that apprehends the truths of suffering and so on of conventional false phenomena is the Dharma eye.

original: thams cad du 'bad pa med pa tsam gyis shes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
analyzed: thams cad du 'bad pa med pa tsam gyis shes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan no //
translated: Knowledge that occurs effortlessly in all ways is the Buddha eye.

original: gal te yang kun rdzob kyi spyan la kun rdzob kyi gzugs snang bar gyur pa de lta na yang de bdag nyid des med pa nyid ces de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen no //
analyzed: gal te yang kun rdzob kyi spyan la kun rdzob kyi gzugs snang bar gyur pa de lta na yang de bdag nyid des med pa nyid ces de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen no //
translated: Even though conventional forms appear to the conventional eye, the TathƒÅgata knows that they do not exist by their own nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis med pa nyid kyi phyir spyan rnams thams cad la snang bar ma gyur pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis med pa nyid kyi phyir spyan rnams thams cad la snang bar ma gyur pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because they do not exist by their own nature, they are said not to appear to any eye.

original: sngon @183b gyi po ta rnams la gsum mam zhes 'don pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon @183b gyi po ta rnams la gsum mam zhes 'don pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the old editions, the text reads ‚Äúthree‚Äù instead of ‚Äúall.‚Äù

original: de la chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la kun rdzob pa'i rnam par dag pa'i shes rab nyid kyis shes rab kyi spyan nyid la khongs su bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de la chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la kun rdzob pa'i rnam par dag pa'i shes rab nyid kyis shes rab kyi spyan nyid la khongs su bsdu ba'o //
translated: The Dharma eye and the Buddha eye are included in the eye of wisdom, because they are the wisdom that is pure with regard to the conventional.

original: gang zhig yang bshad pa shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan rnams kyi yod pa'i don 'dzin pa yang dag par 'byung bas snang bar ma gyur ba'i sems sha dang lha'i spyan dag la phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir mi 'dzin pa zhes byaüîΩba de ni rigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig yang bshad pa shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan rnams kyi yod pa'i don 'dzin pa yang dag par 'byung bas snang bar ma gyur ba'i sems sha dang lha'i spyan dag la phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de ni rigs te /
translated: It is correct to say that the eye of flesh and the divine eye do not apprehend the object that is the domain of the eye of wisdom, the Dharma eye, and the Buddha eye, because they do not arise from the correct apprehension of the object.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi ye shes ni phyin ci log ces bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi ye shes ni phyin ci log ces bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The conventional wisdom of the buddhas is not called erroneous.

original: slob dpon rnams kyis 'di ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi don dam pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis kun rdzob kyi ye shes kyang phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon rnams kyis 'di ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi don dam pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis kun rdzob kyi ye shes kyang phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The masters say that the conventional wisdom of the buddhas is not erroneous because it is the power of the ultimate wisdom of the buddhas.

original: gal te kun rdzob kyi don snang ba nyid kyis phyin ci log pa nyid yin na de'i tshe chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la yang de yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob kyi don snang ba nyid kyis phyin ci log pa nyid yin na de'i tshe chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la yang de yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the meaning of the conventional is just appearance, then at that time, even the Dharma eye and the Buddha eye would be mistaken.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,üîΩit is said:üîΩJust as a magician conjures up

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan 'ga' zhig / rta la sogs pa'i yul sprul pa //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mkhan 'ga' zhig / rta la sogs pa'i yul sprul pa //
translated: objects such as horses,

original: sems ni yul dang bral ba zhes //
analyzed: sems ni yul dang bral ba zhes //
translated: the mind is free from objects.

original: des na 'khrul pa skyes ma yin //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa skyes ma yin //
translated: Therefore, error does not arise.

original: zhes bya ba rigs pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rigs pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the argument.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bur smra ba la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'khrul pa nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bur smra ba la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'khrul pa nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even for one who maintains that consciousness is like an illusion, error is not established with respect to the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata.

original: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ces bya ba de'i de lta bu'i ngo bo dang por mngon du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid ces bya ba de'i de lta bu'i ngo bo dang por mngon du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is not an entity that is first actualized.

original: gang gis phyis snang ba la yang ma 'khrul bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis phyis snang ba la yang ma 'khrul bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Later, it is said that it is not mistaken with respect to appearance.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: sgyu ma dang ni smig rgyu chu yi zla ba mnyam pa'i ngo bo ste //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang ni smig rgyu chu yi zla ba mnyam pa'i ngo bo ste //
translated: The nature of illusion, mirage, and the moon in water is the same.

original: dngos po rnams ni mi bden pa yi snang ba tsam du rig 'gyur mod //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni mi bden pa yi snang ba tsam du rig 'gyur mod //
translated: Things are known to be false, mere appearances.

original: sngar ni ye shes nam mkha' bzhin du gal te stong nyid la //
analyzed: sngar ni ye shes nam mkha' bzhin du gal te stong nyid la //
translated: If, previously, wisdom were empty like space,

original: yod 'gyur gzhan du na yang de bzhin nyid ni sgra tsam kho na'o //
analyzed: yod 'gyur gzhan du na yang de bzhin nyid ni sgra tsam kho na'o //
translated: then suchness would be mere words.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob pa'i yul yang ye shes ni phyin ci log pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kun rdzob pa'i yul yang ye shes ni phyin ci log pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the wisdom of the Lord, even with regard to conventional objects, is not erroneous.

original: thog mar 'jug pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog mar 'jug pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages through the power of the wisdom that apprehends emptiness, the ultimate truth, which is the first object of engagement.

original: chen mo rnams kyi 'don pa yang ji ltar bshad par bya /
analyzed: chen mo rnams kyi 'don pa yang ji ltar bshad par bya /
translated: How can one explain the recitation of the MahƒÅyƒÅnists?

original: rab 'byor 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga'i bzhin gyi sems te snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde bas na snga ma @184a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga'i bzhin gyi sems te snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste / de bas na snga ma @184a * //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, here the five eyes of the TathƒÅgata are not illuminated by the mind.‚Äù

original: nyid ni skyon dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ni skyon dang bral ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the previous explanation is free from fault.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pas thogs par byas pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pas thogs par byas pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúObstructed‚Äù refers to the consciousness of form, etc., of ordinary beings, which is obstructed by walls, etc.

original: med pa la kun du brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig 'di kun rdzob tu dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa so sor nges pa'i dmigs pa la gzhan dbang du gyur pa de rnams ni de kho na nyid kyis stong pa ste /
analyzed: med pa la kun du brtags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig 'di kun rdzob tu dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa so sor nges pa'i dmigs pa la gzhan dbang du gyur pa de rnams ni de kho na nyid kyis stong pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúImagined in the unreal‚Äù and so on means that those which are imagined in the conventional, which are the dependent imagined objects, are empty of reality.

original: gang gi phyir med pa la kun du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa la kun du brtags pa'o //
translated: Because they are imagined in the unreal.

original: med pa ni gnyis te 'di rnams kyis kun du brtags pa ni zhes de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni gnyis te 'di rnams kyis kun du brtags pa ni zhes de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: The unreal is twofold: the non-existent and the existent.

original: thogs pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sgrib pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang zhig mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i rtsig pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sgrib pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnobstructed‚Äù refers to those which are not obstructed by walls, etc., of those endowed with supernormal powers.

original: gnyis su med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis su med par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-dual‚Äù means empty of the nature of reality.

original: gang gi phyir ma byung bar kun du 'byung ba ste yang dag pa'i bdag nyid kyis yang dag par byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma byung bar kun du 'byung ba ste yang dag pa'i bdag nyid kyis yang dag par byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not arise as something that has not arisen, i.e., it does not arise in the nature of something real.

original: bla na yod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi drod dang rtse mo la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi cha rnams so //
analyzed: bla na yod pa rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi drod dang rtse mo la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi cha rnams so //
translated: Those that are surpassable are the special aspects of heat, summit, etc. of those who have entered the career of the bodhisattva.

original: sems bla na yod pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla na yod pa yang don dam pa bla na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems bla na yod pa'i yang dag pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla na yod pa yang don dam pa bla na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind that is surpassable is the suchness that is surpassable, etc. Even that which is surpassable is not surpassable in the ultimate,

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rlom sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rlom sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the conceit of the nature of emptiness.üîΩThose that are unsurpassable are the reality that is free from all conceptual elaboration, because of the lack of any special time in the essenceless cyclic existence.

original: bla na med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba snying po med pa'i dus thams cad khyad par dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du spros pa med pa yin te gang gi phyir sems phra mo tsam yang dmigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sems
analyzed: bla na med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba snying po med pa'i dus thams cad khyad par dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du spros pa med pa yin te gang gi phyir sems phra mo tsam yang dmigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir sems
translated: Because even the mere subtle mind is not perceived, therefore the mind that is unsurpassable is the suchness that is unsurpassable.

original: phra mo tsam yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste der ni med ces bya ba'i ngag gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phra mo tsam yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste der ni med ces bya ba'i ngag gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Because even the subtle is not observed is stated in some recensions. There, does not exist is the remainder of the sentence.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: Those not in equipoise are the afflicted minds.

original: bshad par gyur pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad par gyur pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are associated with what has been explained.

original: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings la des mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings la des mnyam pa ste /
translated: Unequipoised means unequal, because it is not equal to the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: don dam par de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages that ultimately.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gang zhig kun rdzob tu mnyam par ma bzhag par ro //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gang zhig kun rdzob tu mnyam par ma bzhag par ro //
translated: Not in equipoise is that which is not in equipoise conventionally.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ram de nyid kyi phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir ram de nyid kyi phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: Because of variety, or because of that, it is not in equipoise.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa rnams zhes @184b bya ba ni dge ba rnams te/ dge ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa rnams zhes @184b bya ba ni dge ba rnams te/ dge ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those in equipoise are the virtuous ones, because they are associated with virtuous samƒÅdhi.

original: mnyam pa dang mnyam pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mnyam pas zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: By equal to the equal is meant: they are well-established in the equality of all things.

original: de'i dmigs pa dang mthar thug pa nyid kyis mnyam par 'jug cing zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa dang mthar thug pa nyid kyis mnyam par 'jug cing zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By they enter into equality is meant: by their very object and their very conclusion.

original: de bzhin du de dag ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, they are like space.

original: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings pa'o //
translated: By liberated is meant: ordinary men are bound by the defilements.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By naturally liberated is meant: they are naturally free from impurity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid du dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid du dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: For this very reason, they are essentially non-existent in reality.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don de nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don de nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the expression they have the nature of non-self-existence is the same.

original: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams la rnam par grol ba dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid de de'i phyir rnam par grol ba nyid do ;üîΩ/ de ltar na kun rdzob tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo don dam par de bzhin gshegs pas de rnams thams cad stong pa nyid kyis mkhyen pa zhes so sor nye bar bstan nas thams cad khyad par med
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa rnams la rnam par grol ba dang ldan pa'i phyir don dam pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir med pa nyid de de'i phyir rnam par grol ba nyid do ; / de ltar na kun rdzob tu zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo don dam par de bzhin gshegs pas de rnams thams cad stong pa nyid kyis mkhyen pa zhes so sor nye bar bstan nas thams cad khyad par med
translated: ‚ÄúLiberated‚Äù means that because the noble ones possess liberation, they are not perceived by the ultimate wisdom of the TathƒÅgata, and thus they are nonexistent. Therefore, they are liberated.

original: par de kho na nyid gcig pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mkhyen pa zhes bstan par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: par de kho na nyid gcig pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid mkhyen pa zhes bstan par mdzad pa ni /
translated: Thus, having individually taught that the TathƒÅgata knows that all of these things, such as the contaminated and uncontaminated, are empty in the ultimate sense, he teaches that they are known to be of the nature of emptiness, the essence of the one reality, without distinction.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Subh≈´ti,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems pa ltar med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems nyid kyi phyir sems zhes bya ba ni kun brtags brjod pa yin te de yang bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems pa ltar med pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems nyid kyi phyir sems zhes bya ba ni kun brtags brjod pa yin te de yang bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose that are not like mind‚Äù and so on is a restatement of the imagined nature. That is not existent in and of itself.

original: de bas na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yod par gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúbecause they do not exist‚Äù means that they do not exist in reality.

original: ma byung ba'i phyir ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba'i phyir ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they do not arise‚Äù means that they are not produced by causes and conditions.

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ni sgyu ma'i glang po ltar mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ni sgyu ma'i glang po ltar mi bden pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not fully accomplished‚Äù means that they are not real, like an illusory elephant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid mthong ba rnams kyi mig la snang bar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid mthong ba rnams kyi mig la snang bar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they do not appear to the eyes of those who see reality.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni bshad zin pa gsum gyi'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin all of them‚Äù refers to the three that have been explained.

original: chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la shes rab kyi spyan nyid la khongs su bsdu ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dag la shes rab kyi spyan nyid la khongs su bsdu ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that the eye of wisdom is included in the Dharma eye and the Buddha eye.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par ston pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang 'jig rten @185a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa thams cad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par ston pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang 'jig rten @185a * //
translated: Likewise, because of revealing all the mental activities of all sentient beings by way of the nature of emptiness, the TathƒÅgatas and the world

original: ston par byed cing nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ston par byed cing nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: are revealed and gathered.

original: da ni phye ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten ston par mdzad cing zhes bya ba ni bstan par mdzad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni phye ba la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten ston par mdzad cing zhes bya ba ni bstan par mdzad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach the divisions, etc., it says ‚Äúrevealing the world‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can gzhan ni spyir sems can rnams so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan ni spyir sems can rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúOther sentient beings‚Äù are sentient beings in general.

original: gang zag gzhan ni 'jig rten la khyad par du 'dod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan ni 'jig rten la khyad par du 'dod pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúOther persons‚Äù are those who are asserted to be special in the world.

original: gyen du phye par byed pa ni ston par byed pa ldang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gyen du phye par byed pa ni ston par byed pa ldang bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRevealing upward‚Äù is revealing and causing to arise.

original: lta ba phyin ci log pa'i mu stegs pa'i sems rnams la brten nas 'dzin pa'i dbang dang sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'i dbang gis phye ba rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log pa'i mu stegs pa'i sems rnams la brten nas 'dzin pa'i dbang dang sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'i dbang gis phye ba rnams so //
translated: The mind of the tƒ´rthikas who have a wrong view is divided by the power of grasping and the power of the extreme of superimposition.

original: chad pa bzung ba'i dbang dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'i dbang gis nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyi rgyun ni btsums pa'o //
analyzed: chad pa bzung ba'i dbang dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'i dbang gis nges par 'dzin pa'i sems kyi rgyun ni btsums pa'o //
translated: The stream of the mind that definitely grasps by the power of grasping at annihilation and the power of the extreme of denial is closed.

original: gzugs la gnas shing ji srid du rnam par shes pa la gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la gnas shing ji srid du rnam par shes pa la gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Abiding in form up to abiding in consciousness, and so on.

original: de rnams thams cad phung po lnga nas brtsams nas skye bar 'gyur zhes phung po lnga la brten pa de rnams shes shing ji lta ba bzhin du de rnams mkhyen zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad phung po lnga nas brtsams nas skye bar 'gyur zhes phung po lnga la brten pa de rnams shes shing ji lta ba bzhin du de rnams mkhyen zhes pa'i don to //
translated: All of those arise based on the five aggregates, meaning that they are based on the five aggregates.  Knowing those as they are means knowing them as they are.

original: ji ltar de rnams shes zhes bya ba'i dri ba sngon du 'gro ba mu stegs pa rnams kyis dpe bcu bzhis bstan par byed pa ni de bzhin song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de rnams shes zhes bya ba'i dri ba sngon du 'gro ba mu stegs pa rnams kyis dpe bcu bzhis bstan par byed pa ni de bzhin song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The question How are they known? is preceded by the fourteen examples taught by the tƒ´rthikas, beginning with gone thus.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag bdag nyid kyi thar pa song bde bzhin du 'di yang song ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag bdag nyid kyi thar pa song bde bzhin du 'di yang song ba ste /
translated: Just as others have gone to their own liberation, so too has this one.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is a TathƒÅgata.üîΩSome tƒ´rthikas have produced the view that the self is liberated.

original: mu stegs byed kha cig la bdag nyid grol ba zhes lta ba 'di bskyed pa bzhin de shi phan chad 'byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed kha cig la bdag nyid grol ba zhes lta ba 'di bskyed pa bzhin de shi phan chad 'byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: After death, it is called arising.

original: ji ltar 'di skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How does it arise?

original: kha cig ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams la mgo gnon par byed /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams la mgo gnon par byed /
translated: Some, by relying on the mundane path, suppress the afflictions.

original: kha cig ni 'jig rten pa'i lam nyid kyis gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed par byed /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig rten pa'i lam nyid kyis gzhan gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa'i mngon par shes pa skyed par byed /
translated: Some, by the mundane path itself, generate the superknowledges such as knowledge of the minds of others.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi sems shes pa de rnams la kha cig ni grol ba zhes de ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi sems shes pa de rnams la kha cig ni grol ba zhes de ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who know the minds of others say that some are liberated.

original: de rnams la dus gzhan gyis shi bar gyur pa la srid pa gzhan gyis nyon mongs pa dang las yang dag par 'byung bas lha'i mig gis skye ba mthong zhing lta ba 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams la dus gzhan gyis shi bar gyur pa la srid pa gzhan gyis nyon mongs pa dang las yang dag par 'byung bas lha'i mig gis skye ba mthong zhing lta ba 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Since other afflictions and actions arise for them through other existences, they see birth through the divine eye and their view is as follows.

original: de bzhin song ba shi phan chad 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin song ba shi phan chad 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who has gone to such and such a state does not arise after death.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag kyang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams la mgo gnon par @185b byas te 'du shes med pa'i sems can nam gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa rnams la mgo gnon par @185b byas te 'du shes med pa'i sems can nam gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Others, through the mundane path, suppress the afflictions and are born among sentient beings devoid of ideation or among formless sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag lha'i mig gis de bzhin nyid kyi skye ba mthong ba phyir ro /
analyzed: gzhan dag lha'i mig gis de bzhin nyid kyi skye ba mthong ba phyir ro /
translated: Others see the birth of suchness through the divine eye.

original: ba'i lha'i mig gis phung po lnga nyid sems can du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ba'i lha'i mig gis phung po lnga nyid sems can du mthong ba ste /
translated: Through the divine eye of the path of cultivation, they see the five aggregates themselves as sentient beings.

original: de rnams ni 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They have the following view:

original: de bzhin song ba shi phan chad mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin song ba shi phan chad mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who has gone to such and such a state does not arise after death.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni snga ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams mgo gnon par byas pa kha cig ni 'du shes med pa rnams su skye ba yin no //üîΩkha cig ni gzhan du de rnams las gzhan dag snga ma bzhin du mngon par shes pa kha cig la skye ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni snga ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams mgo gnon par byas pa kha cig ni 'du shes med pa rnams su skye ba yin no // kha cig ni gzhan du de rnams las gzhan dag snga ma bzhin du mngon par shes pa kha cig la skye ba mthong ngo //
translated: The others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.

translated: The others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.

original: de rnams ni de ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin song ba shi phan chad 'byung ba yang ma yin mi 'byung ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni de ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin song ba shi phan chad 'byung ba yang ma yin mi 'byung ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements, are reborn among the gods without ideation.üîΩThe others, like the first, are those who, by the force of their defilements,

original: lta ba 'di dag thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la brten pa nyid du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba 'di dag thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la brten pa nyid du skye ba yin no //
translated: All these views arise in dependence on the five aggregates, form, etc.

original: des na gsungs pa ni gzugs la brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na gsungs pa ni gzugs la brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that they are based on form, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Similarly, they are based on feeling, perception, the formations, and consciousness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa mthong nas sems can 'di 'am kho bo gzugs bzang ba'am ngan pa zhes bya ba'i blo skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa mthong nas sems can 'di 'am kho bo gzugs bzang ba'am ngan pa zhes bya ba'i blo skye ba yin no //
translated: having seen the form of another person or oneself, the idea arises that this person or I am beautiful or ugly.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal bas khyab pa'i 'du byed mthong nas 'di 'am kho bo bde ba dang ldan pa'am sdug bsngal dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i blo skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal bas khyab pa'i 'du byed mthong nas 'di 'am kho bo bde ba dang ldan pa'am sdug bsngal dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i blo skye ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, having seen the formations that are pervaded by pleasure and pain, the idea arises that this person or I am happy or unhappy.

original: de lta bu'i ming can 'du byed mthong nas 'di 'am kho bo rgyal rigs sam bram ze'i rigs tshig gis kyang sangs rgyas sbyin ba'am yon tan bshes gnyen zhes bya ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ming can 'du byed mthong nas 'di 'am kho bo rgyal rigs sam bram ze'i rigs tshig gis kyang sangs rgyas sbyin ba'am yon tan bshes gnyen zhes bya ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seeing such a composite, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is me‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am a member of the warrior caste‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am a Brahmin,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am a giver,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am a spiritual teacher.‚Äù

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba dang 'bral ba'i 'du byed mthong nas 'di 'am kho bo phyis pa'am mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bya ba dang 'bral ba'i 'du byed mthong nas 'di 'am kho bo phyis pa'am mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seeing a composite that is free from virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is me‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am an ascetic‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am a scholar.‚Äù

original: yul la shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa mthong nas 'di'am kho bo 'di mthong nas zhes bya ba'i @186a * //üîΩblo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la shes pa'i rjes su 'jug pa mthong nas 'di'am kho bo 'di mthong nas zhes bya ba'i @186a * // blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seeing a composite that engages with objects of knowledge, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is me‚Äù or ‚ÄúI see this.‚Äù

original: de bas na bdag gi blo phung po lnga'i yul nyid do //üîΩgzhan yang bdag ces bya ba'i blo 'di mngon sum pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi blo phung po lnga'i yul nyid do // gzhan yang bdag ces bya ba'i blo 'di mngon sum pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Therefore, the object of the idea of self is the five aggregates.üîΩMoreover, does the idea of self apprehend an object that is directly perceived?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin par byed pa yin /
translated: Or does it apprehend an object that is inferred?

original: phyogs dang po la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nyid mngon sum pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams nyid mngon sum pa ste /
translated: The first position is that the aggregates of form, etc. are directly perceived,

original: sems can gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not sentient beings.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i don 'dzin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that the meaning of inference is apprehended,

original: byis pa dang khye'u rnams la yang mngon par ma sbyar yang glo bur du 'jug pa zhes bdag smra ba bos bdag gi gnod pa khas len pas rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa dang khye'u rnams la yang mngon par ma sbyar yang glo bur du 'jug pa zhes bdag smra ba bos bdag gi gnod pa khas len pas rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: because even children and infants, without having been taught, suddenly say ‚ÄúI‚Äù and accept ‚ÄúI‚Äù as injured.

original: shes pa 'di rnams kun rdzob pa yin yang zab cing zab par snang ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gcig tu rang nyid kyis mngon par mkhyen cing mngon du mdzad nas rab tu rig pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di rnams kun rdzob pa yin yang zab cing zab par snang ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gcig tu rang nyid kyis mngon par mkhyen cing mngon du mdzad nas rab tu rig pa'o //
translated: Although these cognitions are conventional, the profound and very profound appear to the Lord Buddha, who has realized them by his own knowledge and has fully understood them.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid phal cher lta ba'i gnas 'di rnams kyi rgyu gang yin pa dang don dam pa gang yin pa dang 'bras bu gang yin pa dang dpe gang yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa gang rnams kyi skye bar 'gyur ba de thams
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid phal cher lta ba'i gnas 'di rnams kyi rgyu gang yin pa dang don dam pa gang yin pa dang 'bras bu gang yin pa dang dpe gang yin pa dang nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa gang rnams kyi skye bar 'gyur ba de thams
translated: BhagavƒÅn, you are the one who knows the causes of these views, what is ultimate, what is the result, what is the example, and what is the definite emergence of all of these views.üîΩ

original: cad rnam pa dang bcas pa dang bstan pa dang bcas pa mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: cad rnam pa dang bcas pa dang bstan pa dang bcas pa mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: The Lord knows all the causes, the ultimate, the results, the examples, and the liberations of these views, as well as the arising of all of them with their aspects and their teachings.

original: gzhan ni lta ba 'di rnams 'di ltar lung bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni lta ba 'di rnams 'di ltar lung bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: No one else is able to teach these views in this way.

original: de bzhin du 'chad bzhin pa'i rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chad bzhin pa'i rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: Similarly, in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThe self is permanent,‚Äù the world of sentient beings is the self.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world is the container world.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes bya ba dang / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go //
translated: ‚ÄúThis statement that the self is permanent is true, the others are ignorant,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis statement that the self is impermanent is true, the others are ignorant.‚Äù

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta ba 'di ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta ba 'di ji ltar skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the view ‚Äúthe world is eternal‚Äù arise?

original: 'dir dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig phyi rol gyi lam gyis sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa bskyed nas bskal pa mang po'am bskal pa brgya phrag mang po'am skye ba brgya phrag mang po dang skye ba stong phrag mang po dran par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir dge sbyong ngam bram ze kha cig phyi rol gyi lam gyis sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa bskyed nas bskal pa mang po'am bskal pa brgya phrag mang po'am skye ba brgya phrag mang po dang skye ba stong phrag mang po dran par byed de /
translated: Here, some ascetics and brahmins, through the path of externalism, recollecting past abodes for many eons, many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons,

original: de rnams kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa /
translated: they are skilled in dependent origination.

original: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la dran pa tsam ji lta ba bzhin mi shes shing 'du shes dang tshor ba'i dbye ba mthong zhing rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la dran pa tsam ji lta ba bzhin mi shes shing 'du shes dang tshor ba'i dbye ba mthong zhing rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They merely recollect past formations as they were, not knowing them as they are, seeing the distinction of perception and feeling, not the distinction of their own characteristics.

original: de 'di ltar lta @186b ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di ltar lta @186b ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They have this view:

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe self and the world are eternal.

original: lha'i mig la yang dag par brten pas sam 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig ma 'jig pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes shing da ltar byung ba nyid kyi don sngar 'dus byas pa rtog par byed cing rnam par shes pa'i
analyzed: lha'i mig la yang dag par brten pas sam 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig ma 'jig pa'i rjes su 'jug pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes shing da ltar byung ba nyid kyi don sngar 'dus byas pa rtog par byed cing rnam par shes pa'i
translated: Or else, they see that the divine eye does not see the destruction of the moment of conditioned factors, and that it is the present that conceives and cognizes the past.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun 'jig rten 'di las 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba mi shes shing phra ba dang rtag pa rnams la phra ba rnams las rags pa'i rdzas rnam par 'byed par gyur pa phra ba'i gnas skabs nye bar gnas pa zhes mthong zhing ci rigs pas
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun 'jig rten 'di las 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba mi shes shing phra ba dang rtag pa rnams la phra ba rnams las rags pa'i rdzas rnam par 'byed par gyur pa phra ba'i gnas skabs nye bar gnas pa zhes mthong zhing ci rigs pas
translated: They do not see the destruction of the stream of consciousness that passes from this world to the next world. They do not see the subtle, but they see the gross, and they see the subtle state of the gross.

original: 'di bzhin du 'gyur ro //üîΩbdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa kha cig la 'di ltar lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di bzhin du 'gyur ro // bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa kha cig la 'di ltar lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They say: ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚ÄùüîΩSome say: ‚ÄúThe self and the world are eternal.‚Äù

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mi rtag pa ste lta ba 'di yang ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni mi rtag pa ste lta ba 'di yang ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How does the view arise that ‚ÄúThe self and the world are not eternal‚Äù?

original: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams zhes bya ba'i sems can yod de de rnams 'du shes skye ba nyid kyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams zhes bya ba'i sems can yod de de rnams 'du shes skye ba nyid kyis 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There are sentient beings called ‚Äúgods without ideation‚Äù who die when ideation reappears.

original: de rnams las la la zhig 'chi 'pho ba mngon par shes pa thob nas sngar 'du shes pas rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams las la la zhig 'chi 'pho ba mngon par shes pa thob nas sngar 'du shes pas rjes su dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some of them, through the acquisition of superknowledge, remember their former births.

original: de nas gzhan la rjes su dran par byed de de la 'di ltar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'jig rten 'di ni mi rtag pa ste yang na rang nyid kyis spobs pa lhag pa so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa rtog ge'i stobs kyis smra ba dag dang 'jig rten ni mi rtag pa ste kha cig yang 'di ltar lta ba can du bdag dang
analyzed: de nas gzhan la rjes su dran par byed de de la 'di ltar 'gyur ro // 'jig rten 'di ni mi rtag pa ste yang na rang nyid kyis spobs pa lhag pa so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa rtog ge'i stobs kyis smra ba dag dang 'jig rten ni mi rtag pa ste kha cig yang 'di ltar lta ba can du bdag dang
translated: Then they remember the births of others and say:üîΩ‚ÄúThis world is impermanent;üîΩsome say: ‚ÄúThe world is permanent;üîΩsome say: ‚ÄúThe world is both permanent and impermanent;

original: 'jig rten ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ste /üîΩji ltar yang lta ba 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa ste /üîΩji ltar yang lta ba 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: some say: ‚ÄúThe world is neither permanent nor impermanent.‚Äù

original: 'dir 'jig rten 'jig pa la sems can rnams la phal cher 'od gsal gyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten 'jig pa la sems can rnams la phal cher 'od gsal gyi lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, when the world is destroyed, sentient beings are mostly reborn among the luminous gods.

original: de nas skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten la sems can rnams cig shos de las shi 'phos nas tshangs ba'i gzhal yas khang du skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde nas gcig pur gyur pa de la yun ring por gnas shing 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten la sems can rnams cig shos de las shi 'phos nas tshangs ba'i gzhal yas khang du skye bar 'gyur ro // de nas gcig pur gyur pa de la yun ring por gnas shing 'di ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when the world is about to be formed, sentient beings die and transmigrate from that other place and are reborn in the Brahma palace.

original: sems can gzhan yang 'dir skye bar 'gyur zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gzhan yang 'dir skye bar 'gyur zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Then, remaining alone for a long time, they think, ‚ÄúOther sentient beings will be born here.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes la de'i tshe zad pas de las shi 'phos te tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde rnams la yang 'di ltar kho bo cag ni tshangs pa dang byed pa po dang sprul pa po zhes 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la de'i tshe zad pas de las shi 'phos te tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ro // de rnams la yang 'di ltar kho bo cag ni tshangs pa dang byed pa po dang sprul pa po zhes 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, when their lifespan is exhausted, they die and are reborn in another Brahma world.üîΩThey think, ‚ÄúI am Brahma, the creator, the emanator.‚Äù

original: de la yang 'di ltar kho bo ni 'di rnams kyi byed pa po zhes 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'di ltar kho bo ni 'di rnams kyi byed pa po zhes 'gyur ro //
translated: They also think, ‚ÄúI am the creator of these.‚Äù

original: de rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten las kyang shi 'phos nas mngon bar @187a * //
analyzed: de rnams tshangs pa'i 'jig rten las kyang shi 'phos nas mngon bar @187a * //
translated: After they die and transmigrate from the Brahma world, they are born in the desire realm.üîΩ

original: shes pa bskyed nas tshangs pa mthong zhing 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa bskyed nas tshangs pa mthong zhing 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having died from the Brahma world, they generate superknowledge and see Brahma.

original: tshangs pa ni rtag pa ste kho bo cag ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni rtag pa ste kho bo cag ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They become those who hold the view that Brahma is permanent and we are impermanent.üîΩSimilarly, there are gods called those who delight in emanations.

original: de bzhin du rol pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i lha rnams yod de de rnams la shin tu kha cig rol pa la dga' ba nyams su myong zhing dran pa yang dag par nyams pas de las shi 'phos pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rol pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i lha rnams yod de de rnams la shin tu kha cig rol pa la dga' ba nyams su myong zhing dran pa yang dag par nyams pas de las shi 'phos pas /
translated: Some of them experience the delight of emanations and due to the degeneration of mindfulness, they die from there.

original: mngon par shes pa bskyed nas de rnams mthong zhing 'di skad ces smra bar gyur to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bskyed nas de rnams mthong zhing 'di skad ces smra bar gyur to //
translated: Having generated superknowledge, they see those gods and say,

original: gang zhig dus ring por rol pa la dga' ba thob pa ma yin pa de rnams ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig dus ring por rol pa la dga' ba thob pa ma yin pa de rnams ni rtag pa ste /
translated: Those who obtain the delight of emanations for a long time are permanent.

original: kho bo cag ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: We are impermanent.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi skyon byed pa rnams la shin tu yid kyi skyon bskyed nas 'chi 'pho ba snga ma bzhin du 'di ltar shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi skyon byed pa rnams la shin tu yid kyi skyon bskyed nas 'chi 'pho ba snga ma bzhin du 'di ltar shes par 'gyur te /
translated: They will die and pass away, understanding it in this way:

original: de rnams rtag pa kho bo cag ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams rtag pa kho bo cag ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWe are impermanent, but they are permanent.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gzhan dag rtog ge'i stobs kyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dag rtog ge'i stobs kyis /
translated: Moreover, others, through the power of speculation,

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni mi rtag pa ste sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ni mi rtag pa ste sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: say that form, sound, smell, taste, and touch are impermanent, but the mind, mentation, and consciousness are permanent.

original: de ltar rnams pa bzhis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bdag dang 'jig rten zhes bya ba 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnams pa bzhis rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bdag dang 'jig rten zhes bya ba 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will have a view that the self and the world are permanent or impermanent in four ways.

original: gzhan dag kyang yi ge sna tshogs pa la mngon bar zhen te don gyi sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yi ge sna tshogs pa la mngon bar zhen te don gyi sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Others are attached to the variety of letters, but not to the variety of meanings.

original: de rnams ni 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni 'di ltar lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a view in this way:

original: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin la mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba dang bdag dang 'jig rten mtha' dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten ni rtag pa yang ma yin la mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba dang bdag dang 'jig rten mtha' dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The world is neither permanent nor impermanent, the world is finite, the world is infinite, etc.

original: ji ltar yang lta ba 'di rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang lta ba 'di rnams skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How do these views arise?

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa 'ga' zhig bsam gtan chung ba la brten pas lha'i mig bskyed de 'og dang steng dang chu zheng du sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten mtha' dang bcas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa 'ga' zhig bsam gtan chung ba la brten pas lha'i mig bskyed de 'og dang steng dang chu zheng du sems can gyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten mtha' dang bcas pa mthong ngo //
translated: Some worldly person, by relying on a small meditation, generates the divine eye and sees the world of beings and the receptacle world, below, above, across, with its limits.

original: de la 'di ltar 'gyur te mtha' dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'gyur te mtha' dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He thinks: ‚ÄúIt is finite.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni bsam gtan chen po la brten nas 'og dang ste dang chu zheng du mtha' mi mngon no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bsam gtan chen po la brten nas 'og dang ste dang chu zheng du mtha' mi mngon no //
translated: Another, by relying on a great meditation, does not see any limit below, above, across.

original: de la 'di ltar 'gyur te mtha' med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar 'gyur te mtha' med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He thinks: ‚ÄúIt is infinite.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni bsam gtan 'bring la brten pas steng dang 'og dang mtha'i 'du shes can chu zheng du mtha' med pa'i 'du shes can de la 'di ltar 'gyur te mtha' dang @187b bcas pa dang mtha' dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni bsam gtan 'bring la brten pas steng dang 'og dang mtha'i 'du shes can chu zheng du mtha' med pa'i 'du shes can de la 'di ltar 'gyur te mtha' dang @187b bcas pa dang mtha' dang bral ba'o //
translated: The other is based on medium concentration, and has the notion of above, below, and the end, and the notion that space is infinite.

original: gzhan ni yi ge sna tshogs pa nyid la mngon bar zhen nas don sna tshogs pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni yi ge sna tshogs pa nyid la mngon bar zhen nas don sna tshogs pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: The other is attached to the variety of letters, not to the variety of meanings.

original: de 'di ltar smra ste /
analyzed: de 'di ltar smra ste /
translated: He speaks thus:

original: bdag dang 'jig rten mtha' dang bcas pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrnam pa gzhan yang 'das pa'i skye ba nyid gcig bu mthong zhes smra ba ni mtha' dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'jig rten mtha' dang bcas pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o // rnam pa gzhan yang 'das pa'i skye ba nyid gcig bu mthong zhes smra ba ni mtha' dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe self and the world are neither finite nor infinite.‚ÄùüîΩAnother mode: ‚ÄúI see only one past birth‚Äù is called finite.

original: gzhan dag 'das pa mang po 'jig pa dang skye ba mthong zhing smra ba ni mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'das pa mang po 'jig pa dang skye ba mthong zhing smra ba ni mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others say: ‚ÄúI see and declare many past destructions and creations of the world,‚Äù which is called infinite.

original: gzhan ni ma 'ongs pa 'jig pa tsam 'das pa mang ba 'jig pa dang skye ba dag mthong zhing smra pa ni mtha' dang bcas pa yang yin la mtha' med pa yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyi ge sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir snga ma bzhin du yang 'ga' zhig bdag ni gzugs can mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma 'ongs pa 'jig pa tsam 'das pa mang ba 'jig pa dang skye ba dag mthong zhing smra pa ni mtha' dang bcas pa yang yin la mtha' med pa yang zhes bya ba'o // yi ge sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir snga ma bzhin du yang 'ga' zhig bdag ni gzugs can mthong ngo //
translated: The fifth, who maintain that the past and the future exist and that the present is the destruction of the future which has not yet arisen or has already arisen, are the Nirgranthas.

original: gzhan ni gzugs med pa rnams la'o //üîΩgzhan ni lus kyi chas gzugs can no //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzugs med pa rnams la'o // gzhan ni lus kyi chas gzugs can no //
translated: The sixth, who maintain that the past and the future do not exist, are the LokƒÅyatas.üîΩThe seventh, who maintain that the past and the future exist and that the present is the destruction of the future which has not yet arisen or has already arisen, are the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas.üîΩThe eighth, who maintain that the past and the future do not exist, are the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÖghikas.

original: gzhan gyi chas gzugs can ma yin pa gang zhig gzugs can des smra ba ni mtha' dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chas gzugs can ma yin pa gang zhig gzugs can des smra ba ni mtha' dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ninth, who maintain that the past and the future exist and that the present is the destruction of the future which has not yet arisen or has already arisen, are the SarvƒÅstivƒÅdins.

original: gang zhig gzugs can ma yin pa des smra ba ni mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs can ma yin pa des smra ba ni mtha' dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The tenth, who maintain that the past and the future do not exist, are the Mahƒ´≈õƒÅsakas.üîΩThe eleventh, who maintain that the past and the future exist and that the present is the destruction of the future which has not yet arisen or has already arisen, are the Dharmaguptakas.

original: gzhan ni lus kyi chas mtha' dang bcas pa dang gzugs can med pa'i chas mtha' dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni lus kyi chas mtha' dang bcas pa dang gzugs can med pa'i chas mtha' dang bral ba'o //
translated: The twelfth, who maintain that the past and the future do not exist, are the SautrƒÅntikas.üîΩThe thirteenth, who maintain that the past and the future exist and that the present is the destruction of the future which has not yet arisen or has already arisen, are the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas.üîΩThe fourteenth, who maintain that the past and the future do not exist, are the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÖghikas.üîΩThe fifteenth, who maintain that the past and the future exist and that the present is the destruction of the future which has not yet arisen or has

original: gzhan ni yi ge sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir snga ma bzhin du srog de ni lus de'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni yi ge sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir snga ma bzhin du srog de ni lus de'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other is that the life force is the same as the body, as previously stated, because of the diversity of letters.

original: gang la la zhig bdag la gzugs can mthong ba de ni lus nyid bdag tu smra ba ni ji ltar chad par smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: gang la la zhig bdag la gzugs can mthong ba de ni lus nyid bdag tu smra ba ni ji ltar chad par smra ba rnams so //
translated: Those who say that the self is seen as having form are like the annihilationists.üîΩThey also say that the mind itself is the nature of consciousness, pleasure, and so on, like the potency of alcohol.

original: 'di dag kyang bzi ba'i nus pa bzhin du sems nyid kyang shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo lus kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ni gzugs la brten pa'o zhes bya ba nas 'di niüîΩrnam par shes pa la brten pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang bzi ba'i nus pa bzhin du sems nyid kyang shes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo lus kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ni gzugs la brten pa'o zhes bya ba nas 'di ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa ste zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is based on form, up to this is based on consciousness.

original: gang zhig gzugs can ma yin pa'i bdag 'dod pa des smra ba ni srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs can ma yin pa'i bdag 'dod pa des smra ba ni srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those who assert a formless self say that the life force is one thing and the body is another.

original: de la yang bdag la bdag tu 'dzin pas gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nyid smras pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang bdag la bdag tu 'dzin pas gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i yul nyid smras pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: And it is said that the self is the object of the form, etc., grasped by the self-habit, because it is the object of the self-habit.

original: de dag gzugs la brten pa nas ji srid rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de dag gzugs la brten pa nas ji srid rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The self-habit is based on form, etc., up to consciousness.

original: 'on te lta ba'i gnas 'di rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du @188a * //üîΩbrjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te lta ba'i gnas 'di rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du @188a * // brjod pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is said that these bases of views are neutral.

original: de ji ltar mtha' gcig tu smra ba'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar mtha' gcig tu smra ba'o //
translated: How can it be said in one way and not in another?

original: mdo sde las kyang lung ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang lung ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sutra is neutral.

original: der bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang cha gcig gis mtha' gcig tu byas pa yin nam ci /
analyzed: der bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang cha gcig gis mtha' gcig tu byas pa yin nam ci /
translated: Did the Lord make a one-sided assertion there?

original: 'jig rten ni rtag pa'am 'on te mi rtag pa nas ji srid srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba'i mtha' gcig la dris pa la /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rtag pa'am 'on te mi rtag pa nas ji srid srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan no zhes bya ba'i mtha' gcig la dris pa la /
translated: When asked about the world, whether it is eternal or not, up to whether life is one thing and the body another,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: the Lord said:

original: 'di ni mtha' gcig tu smra ba dag gis khyed cag la mtha' gcig tu byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtha' gcig tu smra ba dag gis khyed cag la mtha' gcig tu byas pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not something that the dogmatists have made for you.

original: 'di ni khyed cag la don dang bcas pa ma yin la 'phags pa'i yid las byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don du yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed cag la don dang bcas pa ma yin la 'phags pa'i yid las byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i don du yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not something that is meaningful for you, nor is it capable of being the object of the noble ones‚Äô minds and of being free from attachment.üîΩNor is it because you have realized the absence of death. Therefore, this is something that I have made for you.

original: ji srid du shi ba med pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir yang ma yin pas 'di bdag gis khyed cag la mtha' gcig tu byas pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro
analyzed: ji srid du shi ba med pa mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir yang ma yin pas 'di bdag gis khyed cag la mtha' gcig tu byas pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro
translated: This is the truth of suffering, this is the origin of suffering, this is the cessation of suffering, this is the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: ba'i lam zhes bya ba bdag gis mtha' gcig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i lam zhes bya ba bdag gis mtha' gcig tu byas pa'o //
translated: This is something that I have made for you.

original: 'di ni khyed cag la don dang bcas pa ji srid du shi ba med pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyed cag la don dang bcas pa ji srid du shi ba med pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is something that is meaningful for you, because you have realized the absence of death.

original: de ltar lta ba rnams nye bar bstan nas ji ltar bcom ldan 'das 'dis rnam pa kun rdzob pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa de ltar ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba rnams nye bar bstan nas ji ltar bcom ldan 'das 'dis rnam pa kun rdzob pa'i ye shes kyis mkhyen pa de ltar ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the views, he teaches how the Lord knows them with conventional knowledge.

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, Subhuti, etc.

original: phye ba dang btsums pa nyid smra ba dang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa nyid 'di rnams kyi brjod pa zhes skye ba'i rgyu mdo sde rnams las gsungs pa kho bo cag gis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phye ba dang btsums pa nyid smra ba dang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa nyid 'di rnams kyi brjod pa zhes skye ba'i rgyu mdo sde rnams las gsungs pa kho bo cag gis bstan pa'o //
translated: The opening and closing themselves, the verbal expression, the superimposition and denial, are the expressions of these, the causes of arising, taught in the sutras. We have explained them.

original: de ltar kun rdzob ngo bo nyid nye bar bstan nas don dam par de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa nyid ye shes 'di zhes ston cing gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob ngo bo nyid nye bar bstan nas don dam par de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa nyid ye shes 'di zhes ston cing gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught the conventional nature, he teaches and explains this knowledge which has thusness as its object in the ultimate.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, Subhuti, the Tathagata, etc.

original: ji ltar gzugs mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know form?

original: de bzhin nyid du ji lta ba de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ji lta ba de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as it is in thusness, just so.

original: de bzhin nyid du 'dogs par mdzad ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gcig pu rnam par gzhag par byed pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni gang zhig nyid ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩda ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams thams cad dang 'phags pa'i chos thams cad dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin nyid la tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo @188b nyid kyis chos rnams thams cad gnyis
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du 'dogs par mdzad ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gcig pu rnam par gzhag par byed pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni gang zhig nyid ces bya ba'i don to // da ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams thams cad dang 'phags pa'i chos thams cad dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin nyid la tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo @188b nyid kyis chos rnams thams cad gnyis
