translated: The phrase it is designated as thusness means that it is the one thusness that is posited. The phrase what is it? means what is it?

original: su med par nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas ston par byed pa ni /üîΩrab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //üîΩde bzhin nyid 'di ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: su med par nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas ston par byed pa ni / rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas so // de bzhin nyid 'di ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that all mundane and supramundane phenomena, all noble phenomena, the TathƒÅgata, and thusness are non-different, he teaches by way of a summary that all phenomena are non-dual by nature, with the wordsüîΩTherefore, Subh≈´ti, thusness is the one thusness.

original: 'di ni rgyas par gsungs pa de bzhin nyid ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyas par gsungs pa de bzhin nyid ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: This is the extensive explanation. Thusness is the one thusness and so on.

original: ji ltar chos thams cad kyi chos nyid 'di ni ji ltar gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad kyi chos nyid 'di ni ji ltar gcig pa ste /
translated: Just as the reality of all phenomena is one,üîΩjust as all phenomena have various forms, so too does it exist.

original: ji ltar chos rnams thams cad sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can de ltar de yang yod par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa du ma dang bral pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams thams cad sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can de ltar de yang yod par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa du ma dang bral pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is called ‚Äúfree from the multiplicity of things and nonthings.‚Äù

original: du ma nyid dang chos thams cad las tha dad pa'i gang zhig yod pa dang med pa dag de dag dang bra ba chos thams cad las tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ma nyid dang chos thams cad las tha dad pa'i gang zhig yod pa dang med pa dag de dag dang bra ba chos thams cad las tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The multiplicity of things and nonthings is neither different from all phenomena nor is it the same as all phenomena.

original: ji ltar 'di bzhin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di bzhin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äújust as it is.‚Äù

original: gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is said because it is not one and it is not different.

original: gal te de bzhin nyid ni dngos po rnams dang lhan cig tu gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po rnams mthong ba las de bzhin nyid kyang mthong ba de'i phyir dngos po mthong ba so so'i skye bo rnams kyang grol bar
analyzed: gal te de bzhin nyid ni dngos po rnams dang lhan cig tu gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid du yod par gyur na de'i tshe dngos po rnams mthong ba las de bzhin nyid kyang mthong ba de'i phyir dngos po mthong ba so so'i skye bo rnams kyang grol bar
translated: If suchness existed with the entity of things as one with them, then at the time things are seen, suchness would also be seen. Therefore, ordinary beings who see things would be liberated.

original: 'gyur ro // de bas na 'di la dngos po rnams dang lhan cig tu gcig pa nyid med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bas na 'di la dngos po rnams dang lhan cig tu gcig pa nyid med ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that suchness does not exist as one with things.

original: tha dad pa nyid la ni chos rnams thams cad kyi brdzun pa nyid grub pa ma yin te gnyis dang bral ba nyid ni de rnams kyi brdzun pa nyid de yang de rnams las shin tu tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid la ni chos rnams thams cad kyi brdzun pa nyid grub pa ma yin te gnyis dang bral ba nyid ni de rnams kyi brdzun pa nyid de yang de rnams las shin tu tha dad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were different from them, the falsity of all phenomena would not be established, because freedom from duality is their falsity, and that would be utterly different from them.

original: de ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi kun brtags kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi mi brjod pa nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid la nye bar bstan nas yongs su dag pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo
analyzed: de ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi kun brtags kyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi mi brjod pa nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid la nye bar bstan nas yongs su dag pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo
translated: Thus, having taught the imagined form, etc. of the childish ordinary beings, and the inexpressibility of identity and difference in the pure suchness, he teaches the nature of the perfected, which is completely purified:

original: bo gsungs pa ni mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bo gsungs pa ni mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: because of its inexhaustibility, etc.

original: zad pa ni 'grib pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni 'grib pa'o //
translated: Exhaustion is decrease.

original: de sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa de la de'i tshe yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa de la de'i tshe yod pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, it does not exist in the abandonment of all obscurations.üîΩBecause of its immutability, etc.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste de ni gnas skabs kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste de ni gnas skabs kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is the reading in some places. It should be explained as: because of the absence of a division of states.üîΩBecause of its non-duality, etc.

original: gnyis su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos pos dben pa'i mtshan nyid can de la dngos po'i chos tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos pos dben pa'i mtshan nyid can de la dngos po'i chos tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: In it, which has the characteristic of the emptiness of entity, there is no differentiation of the attributes of entity.

original: tha dad par byed pa po yod pas gsungs pa ni gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya @189a * //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa po yod pas gsungs pa ni gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir zhes bya @189a * //
translated: The statement that there is a separate agent is because there is no duality.

original: ba'o // de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mal pa'i 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa'i nye bar sdud par byed de po ti 'ga' zhig la 'jig rten la yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la rab 'byor de ltar na
analyzed: ba'o // de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mal pa'i 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa'i nye bar sdud par byed de po ti 'ga' zhig la 'jig rten la yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la rab 'byor de ltar na
translated: Thus, etc. concludes the demonstration of the ordinary world. In some editions, after the statement ‚Äúdemonstration of the world,‚Äù there is ‚ÄúSubhuti, thus,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'jig rten yang dag par ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ji srid du skye bar byed pa'i yum dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'jig rten yang dag par ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ji srid du skye bar byed pa'i yum dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i 'gres 'don pa yin no //
translated: the Tathagata demonstrates the world in the world,‚Äù etc., up to the verse ‚Äúthe mother of production, the producer.‚Äù

original: 'di yang mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du bsnan pa ste po ti snga ma rnams la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang mngon rtogs dang sbyar ba'i don du bsnan pa ste po ti snga ma rnams la ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is added for the purpose of application to realization, because it is not seen in the earlier editions.

original: gzhung 'di yang de ltar 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes don dang ma 'brel ba ste nye bar bsdu bar byas pa'i phyir gnas skabs gang yin /
analyzed: gzhung 'di yang de ltar 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes don dang ma 'brel ba ste nye bar bsdu bar byas pa'i phyir gnas skabs gang yin /
translated: This treatise is also like that, since it is a summary that is not related to the meaning of the statement, ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata teaches the world correctly.‚Äù

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du 'jig rten ston par mdzad ces bya ba'i nye bar bsdu ba'o //üîΩgal te yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'jig rten ston par mdzad na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yum dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsdu ba la gnas skabs gang yin 'dir thams cad du gnas skabs 'di la 'jig
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten du 'jig rten ston par mdzad ces bya ba'i nye bar bsdu ba'o // gal te yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'jig rten ston par mdzad na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yum dang skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsdu ba la gnas skabs gang yin 'dir thams cad du gnas skabs 'di la 'jig
translated: Thus, the summary statement, ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata teaches the world in the world,‚Äù is complete.üîΩIf the TathƒÅgata teaches the world in the world, then the summary statement, ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata is the mother and producer of the world,‚Äù is complete.üîΩIn what context is this? Here, in every context, this context is the teaching of the world correctly.

original: rten yang dag par ston par mdzad pa zhes mdor bstan pa de skyed par byed pa'i yum zhes ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: rten yang dag par ston par mdzad pa zhes mdor bstan pa de skyed par byed pa'i yum zhes ji ltar brjod //
translated: How can it be said that the mother who produces the world is the TathƒÅgata?

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi de bzhin nyid mkhyen pa ma yin pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung yang 'di dang rjes su mthun pa ste de bas na 'di bsnan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi de bzhin nyid mkhyen pa ma yin pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung yang 'di dang rjes su mthun pa ste de bas na 'di bsnan pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the text that will be explained, ‚ÄúHe is not the knower of the suchness of the world,‚Äù is consistent with this. Therefore, it is only added.

original: gang gi phyir gcig pu gnyis su byar med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid de'i phyir 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi de bzhin nyid mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig pu gnyis su byar med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo de bzhin nyid de'i phyir 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi de bzhin nyid mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: Because suchness has the nature of being one and indivisible, etc., therefore, in this way, he is the knower of the suchness of the world.

original: ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni don par yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni don par yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Undeluded suchness is because of the existence of the object.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-different suchness is because of immutability.üîΩIn order to teach that the Thus-Gone One appears in the world with the name ‚ÄúThus-Gone‚Äù after fully awakening to suchness through fully knowing suchness, it is said:

original: de lta bu'i de bzhin nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes mtshan du sgra rnam par grags pa 'jig rten du 'byung zhes ston par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: de lta bu'i de bzhin nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes mtshan du sgra rnam par grags pa 'jig rten du 'byung zhes ston par byed pa ni de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: Thus, the one who has fully known suchness,

original: pa ste / zab ste zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang gzung bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste / zab ste zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang gzung bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase profound means that it is difficult for even the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas to grasp.

original: rab tu 'byed cing zhes bya ba ni @189b de bzhin nyid rtogs pas chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrab tu ston to zhes bya ba ni de la brten pa'i longs spyod dang sprul pa so sor rnyed pas sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi byang chub la sems can thams cad la rjes su mthun par 'khor ba ji srid brten pa'i ngo bo rjes su len
analyzed: rab tu 'byed cing zhes bya ba ni @189b de bzhin nyid rtogs pas chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro // rab tu ston to zhes bya ba ni de la brten pa'i longs spyod dang sprul pa so sor rnyed pas sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi byang chub la sems can thams cad la rjes su mthun par 'khor ba ji srid brten pa'i ngo bo rjes su len
translated: The phrase it is analyzed means that the Dharma body is attained by the realization of suchness.

original: pa yin no //
analyzed: pa yin no //
translated: The phrase it is taught means that it is the object of the bodhisattva who possesses the three bodies, because he attains the enjoyment and emanation bodies that are based on it. He takes on a form that is in accord with the world for as long as the world exists, in order to lead all sentient beings to enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni shin tu phra ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir spyod yul yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni shin tu phra ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir spyod yul yin zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that this is the domain of the bodhisattva who possesses subtle wisdom.

original: su zhig 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: su zhig 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase whoever has faith in this... indicates the result of faith.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rgyu ni brnag pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ste dgra bcom pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i smon lam ni brnag pa la de yang yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rgyu ni brnag pa yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ste dgra bcom pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i smon lam ni brnag pa la de yang yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of arhatship is the completion of the vow, because the vow of the arhat is the abandonment of the defilements.

original: gzhan dag ni dgra bcom pa brnag pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes dgag tshig dang rab tu 'brel ba smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dgra bcom pa brnag pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes dgag tshig dang rab tu 'brel ba smra'o //
translated: Others explain the negative particle in the phrase ‚Äúnot the completion of the vow‚Äù as a particle of prohibition.üîΩThis is the statement of the very incompleteness of the vow, because of the dedication to enlightenment.

original: 'di ni rnag pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid kyis byang chub la yongs su bsngo ba nyid gsungs pa ni byang chub tu yong su bsngo pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub la 'dod pa'i brnag pa yang dag pa de
analyzed: 'di ni rnag pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa nyid kyis byang chub la yongs su bsngo ba nyid gsungs pa ni byang chub tu yong su bsngo pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub la 'dod pa'i brnag pa yang dag pa de
translated: The vow of the arhat is not complete because of the dedication to enlightenment of the Tathagata, by the power of the Tathagata.

original: ltar yan rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ltar yan rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The vow of the arhat is not complete because of the desire for enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni zhi ba la gcig pa'i dgra bcom pa la yan mos pa'i yul ma yin zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi ba la gcig pa'i dgra bcom pa la yan mos pa'i yul ma yin zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: This shows that the single-pointed arhat is not the object of the vow.

original: lha ba phun sum tshogs pa rnams sam zhes bya ba ste mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: lha ba phun sum tshogs pa rnams sam zhes bya ba ste mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The excellent gods are the Bodhisattvas who have attained the Path of Seeing.

original: gnas pa 'di dag ni de bzhin nyid kyi kho na ste /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di dag ni de bzhin nyid kyi kho na ste /
translated: These stations are of Suchness itself.

original: ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo la ltos pas mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo la ltos pas mang po'i tshig go //
translated: The plural form is used because they are dependent on the nature of unreversed Suchness, etc.

original: 'on te de bzhin nyid ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin nyid ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: But if Suchness is the Suchness which was fully enlightened by the Buddhas of the past, and is also the Suchness which the Lord has proclaimed,

original: de ji tsam gang zhig tshol bar byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de ji tsam gang zhig tshol bar byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: how much and what is sought?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The answer is: Thus, etc.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa 'di la zad pa med pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa 'di la zad pa med pa zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that in this Suchness, which is like space and is the unchanging perfect reality, there is no exhaustion.

original: chos zab mo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kho na ste gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos zab mo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kho na ste gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The so-called profound doctrine is just the reality of thusness, not another, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dir mtshan nyid rnams ji ltar gzhag ces bya ba ni zab pa zhes gnas skabs kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dir mtshan nyid rnams ji ltar gzhag ces bya ba ni zab pa zhes gnas skabs kyis so //
translated: Bhagavan, how are the characteristics established here?

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir mtshan nyid rnams dang zab pa'am ci /üîΩyang na ngo bo gzhan zhes bya ba'i dri @190a * //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa rnams ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir mtshan nyid rnams dang zab pa'am ci / yang na ngo bo gzhan zhes bya ba'i dri @190a * //
translated: Are the thusnesses, and so on, profound or not, because they have the nature of thusness?

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: Or, is the meaning of the question, Is there another nature?üîΩThe Bhagavan said, Divine sons, emptiness is established here as a characteristic.

original: lha'i bu dag stong pa'o zhes 'di la mtshan nyid gzhag go zhes bya ba la mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid dang ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa zab pa rnams stong pa zhes byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag stong pa'o zhes 'di la mtshan nyid gzhag go zhes bya ba la mtshan nyid ni de bzhin nyid dang ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa zab pa rnams stong pa zhes byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The characteristics are the profound thusnesses, unmistaken thusnesses, and so on, which are established as emptiness.

original: de la phyis pa'i spyod yul kun brtags kyi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyis pa'i spyod yul kun brtags kyi ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because it is free from the imagined nature, the domain of conceptuality.

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa dang mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir shin tu zhi ba nyid ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa dang mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir shin tu zhi ba nyid ni mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is the signless because it is utterly calm, due to the absence of all conceptualization, discursive thought, mental construction, and sign.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang smon lam yongs su dor bar byas pa rnams la yang gzhan smon pa med pas smon pa med pas med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang smon lam yongs su dor bar byas pa rnams la yang gzhan smon pa med pas smon pa med pas med pa'o //
translated: It is the wishless because it is free from the wish for any other state, for those who have renounced all conceptualization and prayer.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dod thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa chad pa ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'dod thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa chad pa ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the unformed because it is the cessation of all causes and effects, of all conceptualization and mental construction.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba 'dus ma byas pa'i gnas skabs can ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba 'dus ma byas pa'i gnas skabs can ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the unborn and unceasing because it is the unconditioned state, free from origination, etc.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: It is the uncontaminated and unpurified because it is utterly pure.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa spros pa thams cad chad pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa spros pa thams cad chad pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //
translated: It is the insubstantial because it is the cessation of all mental constructions, such as subject and object.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana because it is the transcendence of all afflictions and suffering.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the dharma-dhƒÅtu because it is the cause of the ƒÅrya dharmas.

original: ji ltar yang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir zab pa zhes de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir zab pa zhes de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs nas gsungs pa ni mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is it profound? Because of the emptiness of the characteristics of suchness and so on. Why is that?

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba brjod du med pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu mi gnas pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba brjod du med pa don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu mi gnas pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: It is nonabiding, because it is free from all conceptual thought and discursive thought, because it is inexpressible, and because it is not established by way of its ultimate nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i bdag nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i bdag nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like space, because it is like space, abiding in the nature of the absence of characteristics, being free from all characteristics in every respect.

original: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mtshan nyid 'di rnams gsungs pa sngar ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mtshan nyid 'di rnams gsungs pa sngar ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, after the Tathagata fully awakened, he taught these characteristics, which did not exist previously?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩ'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa zhes gsungs pa ni / 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are similar to space.

original: gzugs su bgrang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs su bgrang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag dben pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are not counted as forms, because they are the nature of emptiness.

original: gzugs la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa rnams la rten med pa'i phyir @190b ro ;
analyzed: gzugs la brten pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa rnams la rten med pa'i phyir @190b ro ;
translated: They do not depend on form, because those who are equal to space have no support.

original: / nam mkha' bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis brgya lam na 'byung ba nyid kyis thog mar rnam par gzhag par byed pa po yod par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: / nam mkha' bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis brgya lam na 'byung ba nyid kyis thog mar rnam par gzhag par byed pa po yod par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Just as space is, the Tathagatas, who appear from time to time, are said to be the first to establish them.

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag ni lha'am mi'am mi ma yin bdag gis ma bzhag go zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag ni lha'am mi'am mi ma yin bdag gis ma bzhag go zhes bya ba ste /
translated: These characteristics were not established by gods, humans, or non-humans.

original: chos nyid la mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pa dang phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni bskyod mi nus so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos nyid la mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pa dang phyin ci ma log pa'i yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni bskyod mi nus so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of the unchanging perfect nature and the characteristic of the unmistaken perfect nature in reality is said to be unshakable.

original: bskyod pa'am gnod par byed pa mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskyod pa'am gnod par byed pa mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it cannot be shaken or harmed.üîΩThese are the characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag kho nar zad do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gis mtshan nyid de de'i zlog pa la gnod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag kho nar zad do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang gis mtshan nyid de de'i zlog pa la gnod par byed pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that whatever is characterized by whatever is harmed by the opposite of that,

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by its own characteristic.

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha' ni phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas so sor byed par gyur pa yang nam mkha' gzhan la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha' ni phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas so sor byed par gyur pa yang nam mkha' gzhan la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because space is not harmed by another space, even though it is differentiated by the aggregates and so on.

original: lag gis gzhag pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag gis gzhag pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not established by the hand means that like space, it remains at all times.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa lha'i bu dag gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa lha'i bu dag gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúDivine sons, whatever is characterized by whatever is harmed by the opposite of that,üîΩbut not by its own characteristic.

original: bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' ni sus kyang ma bzhag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nam mkha' ni sus kyang ma bzhag go //
translated: The Blessed One said: ‚ÄúSpace is not established by anyone.

original: 'di lta ste nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir gang gis kyang bzhag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir gang gis kyang bzhag pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Just as space is not established by anyone because it is unconditioned, so it is with the characteristics. This is the intended meaning.

original: lha'i bu dag de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGods, it is the same with the appearance of the TathƒÅgatas.‚Äù This is the stability of the Dharma.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid rnams la dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar su zhig nam gyi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gsungs pa ni ji ltar 'di dag gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ni mtshan nyid rnams la dus thams cad du gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar su zhig nam gyi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gsungs pa ni ji ltar 'di dag gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of stability is stated: ‚ÄúThe characteristics remain at all times. Just as space is not made by anyone, so it is with the characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar nyid rtogs pa'am de bzhin nyid rtogs pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes nges pa'i tshig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar nyid rtogs pa'am de bzhin nyid rtogs pa de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes nges pa'i tshig gi phyir ro //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is said to be so-named because he has realized suchness or has realized reality. This is the etymology of the word TathƒÅgata.

original: mtshan nyid zab mo 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid zab mo 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: These profound characteristics, etc.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: The characteristics are fully and perfectly enlightened.

original: de rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pas na de'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pas na de'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Since they are essenceless, therefore they are profound.

original: ji skad gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rtogs pa po med rtogs bya ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa po med rtogs bya ni //
translated: There is no realizer, there is no realization,

original: don dam pa 'dir yod ma yin //
analyzed: don dam pa 'dir yod ma yin //
translated: there is no ultimate here.

original: kye ma shin du rtogs dka' ba //
analyzed: kye ma shin du rtogs dka' ba //
translated: Alas, it is very difficult to realize,

original: chos nyid khyed kyis rtogs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid khyed kyis rtogs pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reality that you have realized.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de @191a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de @191a * //
translated: Thus,

original: bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is the non-attached wisdom of the Tathagatas.

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang chags pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang chags pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the unobstructed wisdom and non-attached wisdom in all ways.

original: de yang don dam par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de'i phyir chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang don dam par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de'i phyir chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, ultimately it is the nature of not observing any phenomena. Therefore, all phenomena are unobservable.

original: kun rdzob tu ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyi'i ngo bo nyid kyis la khyad par du tha dad pa brjod par 'dod pas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyi'i ngo bo nyid kyis la khyad par du tha dad pa brjod par 'dod pas gsungs pa ni /
translated: In the conventional sense, the essence of the wisdoms of the mirror and so forth is the perfection of wisdom, and they are said to be different in particular, but the same in general essence.

original: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes kyi slad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes kyi slad du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of non-attached wisdom‚Äù is made by one who wishes to express this.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul lo ;
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod yul lo ;
translated: Therefore, it is the domain of the perfection of wisdom.

original: / de ltar chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid med pa dang mtshan nyid yang dag par mthong bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten la ston par mdzad pa zhes nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: / de ltar chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid med pa dang mtshan nyid yang dag par mthong bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten la ston par mdzad pa zhes nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the perfection of wisdom is the teacher of the world, because it sees the lack of characteristics and the true characteristics of all phenomena,

original: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the summary is stated by ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is like this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: da ni byas pa shes pa dang byas pa tshor ba nyid kyi dbang gis 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed cing zhes ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni byas pa shes pa dang byas pa tshor ba nyid kyi dbang gis 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed cing zhes ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the teacher of the world is also the one who knows and feels what is done,

original: rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: As for how, Subhuti, and so on,

original: chos 'di zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: the this Dharma is the brief teaching,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom is the extensive explanation.

original: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang chos kyi gnas ni rten no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang chos kyi gnas ni rten no //
translated: As for not abiding, the abode of substance and Dharma is the support.

original: de med pas nam mkha' bzhin du chos la bkur stir mdzad ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
analyzed: de med pas nam mkha' bzhin du chos la bkur stir mdzad ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, it is like space, and it is said that it is honored in the Dharma, which is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'di la bkur stir mdzad pa la sogs pa'i rgyu gang yin zhes na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la bkur stir mdzad pa la sogs pa'i rgyu gang yin zhes na /
translated: Similarly, if one asks, What is the cause of honoring this and so on?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, This perfection of wisdom, and so on.

original: gal te yang chos rnams kyi de nyid chos nyid de de lta na yang ci'i phyir 'di la bkur stir mdzad pa de ci'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni 'di las zhes gsungs pa ni 'di las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te yang chos rnams kyi de nyid chos nyid de de lta na yang ci'i phyir 'di la bkur stir mdzad pa de ci'i phyir zhes gsungs pa ni 'di las zhes gsungs pa ni 'di las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Even if the suchness of phenomena is the nature of phenomena, why is it honored? The question Why is that? is stated as Why is that?

original: rab tu 'byed pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The thoroughly established nature is the thorough differentiation.

original: de lta na yang ci'i phyir bkur sti la sogs pa mdzad ces gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci'i phyir bkur sti la sogs pa mdzad ces gsungs pa ni /
translated: Even so, why do you perform worship and so forth?

original: byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúI am grateful and thankful,‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di ni bdag gis byas 'di ni bdag gis rtogs zhes rang nyid kyis 'ong ba dang sgrub pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis byas 'di ni bdag gis rtogs zhes rang nyid kyis 'ong ba dang sgrub pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he himself has realized the coming and the accomplishment, thinking, ‚ÄúThis was done by me, this was realized by me.‚Äù

original: yang gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas de rnams nyid la byas pa nyid bsngags par mdzad /
analyzed: yang gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas de rnams nyid la byas pa nyid bsngags par mdzad /
translated: Again, he praises their very gratitude, beginning with ‚ÄúWhoever,‚Äù and so forth.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata, he says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is grateful and thankful.

original: @191b gang gi phyir gyi sgra ni nges pa la'o //
analyzed: @191b gang gi phyir gyi sgra ni nges pa la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is for the sake of certainty.

original: 'di ni byas pa shes pa nyid dang / byas pa tshor ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byas pa shes pa nyid dang / byas pa tshor ba nyid bstan par byed pa ni /
translated: This is the teaching on gratitude and thankfulness.

original: rab 'byor gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, whoever,‚Äù and so forth, is the teaching on gratitude and thankfulness.

original: theg pa gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen pos so //
analyzed: theg pa gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen pos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whatever vehicle‚Äù means by the Great Vehicle.

original: sgrub pa gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: sgrub pa gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: By whatever practice means by the path of seeing.

original: rjes su 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis de mi brjed pa las so //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin cing zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis de mi brjed pa las so //
translated: He takes care of means he does not forget it himself.

original: rjes su skyong zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la skal ba ji lta ba de bzhin du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su skyong zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la skal ba ji lta ba de bzhin du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He protects means he teaches beings according to their lot.

original: ma byas pa ma byas pa zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni gang gis kyang ma byas pa'i chos rnams ma byas pa'i bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o //üîΩ'gyur ba med pa med pa ni 'gyur ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa ma byas pa zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba ni gang gis kyang ma byas pa'i chos rnams ma byas pa'i bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o // 'gyur ba med pa med pa ni 'gyur ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: He fully awakens to the unmade as unmade means he fully awakens to all dharmas as unmade by their very nature, since they are not made by anyone.

original: 'gyur ba med pa zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa mi 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid kyis mkhyen par ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa mi 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid kyis mkhyen par ro //
translated: He fully awakens to the unchangeable as unchangeable means he fully awakens to the unchangeable as unchangeable by their very nature, since they are free from change.üîΩHe fully awakens to the unconditioned as unconditioned means he fully awakens to the unconditioned as unconditioned by their very nature, since they are not conditioned by any conditions.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don 'di nyid do /
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la yang don 'di nyid do /
translated: The meaning of the verse on the absence of conceptualization:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should know that the Tathagata knows what is done and feels what is done.üîΩEven though fully enlightened, he knows what is not done, just as it is, as the knowledge of what is done.

original: ji ltar yang ma byas pa'o zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang ji ltar byas pa shes pa nyid ma byas pa nyid du shes pas ma byas pa nyid 'dir 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas zhesüîΩbya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yang ma byas pa'o zhes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyang ji ltar byas pa shes pa nyid ma byas pa nyid du shes pas ma byas pa nyid 'dir 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said that this is not done, based on the perfection of wisdom.üîΩAll phenomena are penetrated by wisdom.üîΩSince they have the nature of emptiness, what is not done is penetrated by wisdom.

original: chos thams cad ye shes 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ma byas pa zhes gang zhig ye shes 'jug pa de yang 'di dag gis byas pa dang 'di dag gis rtogs pa zhes rang nyid kyis don sgrub pa rtogs
analyzed: chos thams cad ye shes 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ma byas pa zhes gang zhig ye shes 'jug pa de yang 'di dag gis byas pa dang 'di dag gis rtogs pa zhes rang nyid kyis don sgrub pa rtogs
translated: That is also not done by these, nor is it realized by these.

original: pa'i phyir byas pa shes pa dang byas pa tshor ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir byas pa shes pa dang byas pa tshor ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since the meaning is accomplished by itself, it is the intention of knowing what is done and feeling what is done.

original: chen mo rnams la rab 'byor 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor ba zhes 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: chen mo rnams la rab 'byor 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa shes shing byas pa tshor ba zhes 'don pa yin no //
translated: The great ones say, Subhuti, this is the Tathagata's knowledge of what is done and gratitude.

original: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni 'dis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni 'dis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary is For this reason too, etc.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni byas pa shes pa dang byas pa tshor ba'i dbang gis yang 'jig rten 'di yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni byas pa shes pa dang byas pa tshor ba'i dbang gis yang 'jig rten 'di yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, for this reason means that because of the knowledge of what is done and gratitude, this world is shown correctly.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad shes pa po dang mthong ba po med pa yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad shes pa po dang mthong ba po med pa yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la /
translated: Blessed One, when all dharmas are without a knower and a seer, then, etc.

original: shes pa med pas na shes pa po med pa'o //üîΩde'i @192a * //
analyzed: shes pa med pas na shes pa po med pa'o // de'i @192a * //
translated: Because there is no knowing, there is no knower.

original: phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skyed par byed pa zhes mi 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skyed par byed pa zhes mi 'thad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is the maker is not tenable.

original: mthong ba med pas na mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba med pas na mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: Because there is no seeing, there is no seer.

original: de bas na 'jig rten 'di yang dag par ston pa zhes mi 'thad pa zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten 'di yang dag par ston pa zhes mi 'thad pa zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, this world is shown correctly is not tenable.

original: yang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dag gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dag gis mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang dag par ston par byed pa zhes rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Or else, because the mental consciousness and the eye consciousness, etc. do not apprehend it, it is not a real demonstrator.

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston par byed de chos thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir dang rten med pa'i phyir shes pa po med pa dang mthong ba po med pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston par byed de chos thams cad kyis stong pa'i phyir dang rten med pa'i phyir shes pa po med pa dang mthong ba po med pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is what is being demonstrated by ‚ÄúIt is just so, etc.‚Äù It is true that there is no knower and no seer, because all dharmas are empty and have no support.

original: 'on kyang don 'di la 'jig rten du shes pa po su zhig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang don 'di la 'jig rten du shes pa po su zhig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nevertheless, in this matter, there is no knower in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas don 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bas na de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyed par mdzad pa dang 'jig rten 'di yang dag par ston par mdzad pa zhes stod
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas don 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bas na de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyed par mdzad pa dang 'jig rten 'di yang dag par ston par mdzad pa zhes stod
translated: The TathƒÅgata, having fully awakened to this matter by relying on this perfection of wisdom, is therefore praised as the producer of the TathƒÅgatas and the real demonstrator of this world.

original: par byed pa zhes bstod pa'i ngag 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: par byed pa zhes bstod pa'i ngag 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the words ‚Äúis praised. ‚Äù

original: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary is ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so forth.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la shes pa po med pa dang mthong ba po med pa yang dag par ston pas so //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la shes pa po med pa dang mthong ba po med pa yang dag par ston pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Thus‚Äù means that the one who knows and the one who sees do not exist in all phenomena.

original: yang chos thams cad mthong ba rnams la ma mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa zhes ston par byed pa ni gzugs ma mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: yang chos thams cad mthong ba rnams la ma mthong ba'i phyir 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa zhes ston par byed pa ni gzugs ma mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that the world is correctly taught to those who see all phenomena as unseen. This is taught by ‚Äúnot seeing form‚Äù and so forth.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs ni de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs pa de'i tshe ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs ni de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs pa de'i tshe ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: When form is seen by the TathƒÅgata, at that time it is taught.

original: gal te gzugs mthong bar gyur na rab rib can ltar bden pa'i don mthong bas de ston par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mthong bar gyur na rab rib can ltar bden pa'i don mthong bas de ston par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If form were seen, it would not be taught, because it would be seen as having the meaning of true existence, like someone with cataracts.

original: de ltar na sngar gyi dus su rab rib can gyis skra shad 'dzings pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba na phyis skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mthong ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar gyi dus su rab rib can gyis skra shad 'dzings pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba na phyis skye bar mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe mthong ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when the consciousness that perceives the matted hair of one with eye disease arises in the past, but does not arise later, at that time it is called ‚Äúpure vision.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir ston par byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir ston par byed pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, here also, because it does not generate consciousnesses that perceive form and so on, it is called ‚Äúthe teacher.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated as ‚Äúwhen it does not generate consciousnesses that perceive form.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas @192b nye bar sdud par byed pa ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i dbang gis kyang ston par byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas @192b nye bar sdud par byed pa ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la sogs pa mthong ba'i dbang gis kyang ston par byed pa zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, thus‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on is the summary. It is stated that it is the teacher because it sees the emptiness and inconceivability of the world and so on.

original: rab 'byor yang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor yang ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, moreover‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: The world is the five aggregates.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world is the world of the five aggregates.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rjod par byed pa dang shes par byed pa dang yang dag par mthong bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni chung du dang 'bring dang che ba'i rim gyis de'i dmigs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir tshig rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang shes par byed pa dang yang dag par mthong bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni chung du dang 'bring dang che ba'i rim gyis de'i dmigs pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir tshig rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three words ‚Äúexpounder,‚Äù ‚Äúmaker known,‚Äù and ‚Äúmaker evident‚Äù refer to the three degrees of the small, medium, and great, because they generate the nonconceptual intuition of that object.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rtog ge'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rtog ge'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable is suchness, because it is beyond the domain of sophistry.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni smon pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: The peaceful is the absence of wishes.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bral ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bral ba nyid kyis so //
translated: The isolated is the absence of signs.

original: rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what aspect?

original: 'jig rten rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnam par dag pas so //
translated: By the purity of the world.

original: 'jig rten rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that the world is pure by nature.

original: de ltar 'jig rten mthong bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed ces bya ba gtso bo la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten mthong bar mdzad do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten yang dag par ston par byed ces bya ba gtso bo la ltos par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by this aspect, ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom shows the world correctly‚Äù should be understood in terms of the principal matter.

original: po ti gzhan rnams la 'don pa'i tha dad pa yang tshul 'di nyid kyis bshad par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: po ti gzhan rnams la 'don pa'i tha dad pa yang tshul 'di nyid kyis bshad par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The differences in recitation found in other texts should be explained by this very method.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u de ltar brjod pa ste le'u bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten yang dag par ston pa de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u de ltar brjod pa ste le'u bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This concludes the chapter on the perfection of wisdom, the twelfth in the Ornament of the Essence, an explanation of the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: 'jig rten du bu rnams kyi ma ni 'dzam bu'i gling sna tshogs pa ston par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten du bu rnams kyi ma ni 'dzam bu'i gling sna tshogs pa ston par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the world, mothers show their children the various things of Jambudvipa.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yum ste de bas na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs nyid la rnam pa mang pos 'jig rten ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba le'u snga ma la bstan zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yum ste de bas na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs nyid la rnam pa mang pos 'jig rten ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba le'u snga ma la bstan zin to //
translated: The Bhagavatƒ´ is also the mother of the TathƒÅgatas. Therefore, in the very state of perfect enlightenment, she is the one who teaches the world in many ways. This has been taught in the previous chapter.

original: da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor bcom ldan 'das ma sngon gyi spyod pa rnams la yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis phan par mdzad pa zhes ston par mdzad pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: da ni gnas brtan rab 'byor bcom ldan 'das ma sngon gyi spyod pa rnams la yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis phan par mdzad pa zhes ston par mdzad pa ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Now, the elder Subh≈´ti teaches that the Bhagavatƒ´ also benefits the Buddhas in their previous conduct. This is taught by Then, the Bhagavat said to the elder Subh≈´ti... and so on.

original: zab mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zab mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Profound and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zab ce na gsungs pa @193a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zab ce na gsungs pa @193a * //
translated: Why is it profound? It is said:

original: ni bgyi ba chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ni bgyi ba chen pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By means of great deeds... and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa de'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bya ba chen pos nye bar gnas pa de'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Because it abides by means of great deeds, therefore it is profound.

original: kye ma'i sgra ni dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: kye ma'i sgra ni dga' ba la'o //
translated: The exclamation Oh! is for delight.

original: ji tsam gyis she na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis she na /
translated: How much so?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bgyi ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bgyi ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The inconceivable, etc.

original: bsam pa las rnam par 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa las rnam par 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Inconceivable is because it transcends thought.

original: mnyam pa las 'das pa'i phyir mnyam pa ma mchis pa'o //üîΩgzhal ba las 'das pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa las 'das pa'i phyir mnyam pa ma mchis pa'o // gzhal ba las 'das pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: Unequalled is because it transcends equality.üîΩ Immeasurable is because it transcends measurement.

original: grangs las 'das pa'i phyir grangs ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: grangs las 'das pa'i phyir grangs ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Numberless is because it transcends number.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Equal to the unequalled is because it is not common.

original: sngon gyi po ti rnams la gzhal du ma mchis pa dang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sgra dag 'gres pa thams cad la 'don pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi po ti rnams la gzhal du ma mchis pa dang mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sgra dag 'gres pa thams cad la 'don pa ma yin no //
translated: In the old editions, the words immeasurable, unequalled, and equal to the unequalled are not pronounced in all the repetitions.

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas khas blangs pa'o //
translated: So it is and so forth is the acceptance.

original: don 'chad par 'dod cing rang nyid kyis dri bar byed pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: don 'chad par 'dod cing rang nyid kyis dri bar byed pa ni ci ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Desiring to explain the meaning and asking himself, he says how is it? and so forth.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don gyi bya bas bya bar 'ongs pa yang dag par bsgrubs pas nye bar gnas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni ci zhig yin gang zhig sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don gyi bya bas bya bar 'ongs pa yang dag par bsgrubs pas nye bar gnas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni ci zhig yin gang zhig sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúWhat is that inconceivable reality which is present as the accomplishment of the task through the activity of the inconceivable?‚Äù

original: lan ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúInconceivable itself, etc.‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du de ltar gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni chos rnams ji lta ba bzhin du de ltar gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, the state of a TathƒÅgata is the teaching of things as they are.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni don dam pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni don dam pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: Buddhahood is the full realization of the ultimate reality of things.

original: rang 'byung ba nyid ni slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung ba nyid ni slob dpon med par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: Self-arising is the full realization without a teacher.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du chos rnams thams cad la dag pa chags pa med pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad du chos rnams thams cad la dag pa chags pa med pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Omniscience is the knowledge of all things in all modes, pure, unobstructed, and unattached.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de lta bus so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de lta bus so //
translated: Thus is the meaning of the question.

original: bya ba 'di ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab ces gsungs pa ni sems kyis bsam par mi nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba 'di ji ltar bsam gyis mi khyab ces gsungs pa ni sems kyis bsam par mi nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: How is this activity inconceivable? It is said that it is not possible to conceive of it with the mind.

original: gang zhig bsam pa'i yul de cis kyang sems la sogs pa rnams kyi yul yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bsam pa'i yul de cis kyang sems la sogs pa rnams kyi yul yin zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that whatever is an object of thought is an object of the mind and so on.

original: sems dang rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi las sems las byung ba shes rab la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems dang rnam par shes pa dang yid kyi las sems las byung ba shes rab la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The mind, consciousness, mental activity, mental factors such as wisdom, and so on.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa nyid ni ri bong @193b gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir bsam par bya ba mi nus so //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa nyid ni ri bong @193b gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir bsam par bya ba mi nus so //
translated: The imagined Tathagatas, etc., are not possible as objects of thought because they do not exist, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sgyu mas sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sgyu mas sprul pa'i glang po la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Imagination is inconceivable because it is false, like an elephant conjured up by magic.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rnam par shes pa gang gis kyang bzung bar nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rnam par shes pa gang gis kyang bzung bar nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The form of reality is not an object of any consciousness, and therefore it is said to be inconceivable.

original: bsam par bya ba'i don dang gzhal bar bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba yang bsam pa'i sgra ni ci'i phyir te gang zhig bsam par bya bar mi nus pa de shin tu yang 'jal bar mi nus zhes grags pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i don dang gzhal bar bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba yang bsam pa'i sgra ni ci'i phyir te gang zhig bsam par bya bar mi nus pa de shin tu yang 'jal bar mi nus zhes grags pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúobject of thought‚Äù and ‚Äúobject of comprehension‚Äù is also well known: the term ‚Äúthought‚Äù means ‚Äúwhy,‚Äù that is, if something cannot be thought, then it cannot be comprehended at all.

original: de bzhin du gzhal du med pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dri ba dang lan rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal du med pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'i dri ba dang lan rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the questions and answers about the activity of the inconceivable, etc., should be understood.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te gal te bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams nyid la yin na de'i tshe 'di ni chos thams cad la khyab par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te gal te bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams nyid la yin na de'i tshe 'di ni chos thams cad la khyab par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The idea is this: if the inconceivable, etc., belong only to the TathƒÅgatas, etc., then they do not pervade all things.

original: de ltar rigs pa ma yin te gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid de chos rnams thams cad kyi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rigs pa mnyam pa'i phyir rjes su rlom sems su mdzad cing gsungs pa ni de bzhin te zhes bya
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa ma yin te gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid de chos rnams thams cad kyi yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rigs pa mnyam pa'i phyir rjes su rlom sems su mdzad cing gsungs pa ni de bzhin te zhes bya
translated: It is not so, because the Lord has declared and conceived the equality of reason in the following passage: ‚ÄúThat reality of the Tathagata is also the reality of all things.‚Äù

original: ba ste / chos nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs su byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: ba ste / chos nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs su byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang dben pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat reality‚Äù is the voidness of the characteristics of form, etc.

original: 'dir sems pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bshad pa'i chos nyid la mtshan ma med pa'i phyir chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni so sor gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir sems pa med pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bshad pa'i chos nyid la mtshan ma med pa'i phyir chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni so sor gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout thought‚Äù means that all things are without thought, because the reality of all things, as it has been explained, is without signs. ‚ÄúAll things‚Äù means each of the things, form, feeling, etc.

original: gzhan dun bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag la tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dun bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag la tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the probandum and the probans would not be different.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi'o //üîΩgtan tshigs 'di nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi'o // gtan tshigs 'di nyid ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa rnams kyi zhes bstan pa'i don du gsungs pa ni de ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is equal to space‚Äù is for those who are unequal and equal.üîΩThis very reason is taught for the sake of showing the inconceivability, etc. of the perfection of wisdom, beginning with ‚ÄúWhat do you think, Subh≈´ti?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams la sgrub pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams la sgrub pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams la phanüîΩpar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams la sgrub pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams la sgrub pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams la phanüîΩpar mdzad pa'o //
